Overview

This document contains information about vector function specifications in AndeSoft Vector Library (hereafter VEC Library or libvec) for AndeStar V5 toolchains and describes how to use these functions.

VEC Library provides comprehensive functions that have been heavily optimized for RISC-V Vector Extension. These functions include basic operations for vectors or matrices, functions that compute more complicated algorithms such as filtering or image resizing, and transform functions.

Designed and developed with toolchains from AndeSight v5.0.0 and later versions, VEC Library provides easy-to-use APIs to encapsulate the complexity of calculations when processing signals. It benefits you to save development resources, focus on your system and reduce development time.

The functions in VEC Library are organized into the following categories: basic vector, filtering, image, matrix, transform, complex, utility, statistics, Support Vector Machine (SVM) estimation, distance, sorting, interpolation, and window functions. For detailed descriptions of each category, see List of Functions.

To call the library functions, simply include header files provided by VEC Library. These header files define prototypes and instance structures of functions. They are named according to the function categories, as listed below:

  • riscv_vec_basic.h

  • riscv_vec_filtering.h

  • riscv_vec_image.h

  • riscv_vec_interp.h

  • riscv_vec_matrix.h

  • riscv_vec_transform.h

  • riscv_vec_complex.h

  • riscv_vec_utils.h

  • riscv_vec_statistics.h

  • riscv_vec_svm.h

  • riscv_vec_distance.h

  • riscv_vec_sort.h

  • riscv_vec_window.h

For example, to use basic functions for operations with vectors, you can include riscv_vec_basic.h in your C files.

VEC Library defines several data types, structures, and macros to properly store signal data for later processing. These data types, structures, and macros are defined in riscv_vec_types.h and riscv_dsp_math_types.h. They are as follows:

typedef int8_t q7_t;     //for 8-bit signed integer
typedef int8_t s8_t;     //for 8-bit signed integer in image functions
typedef uint8_t u8_t;    //for 8-bit unsigned integer
typedef int16_t q15_t;   //for 16-bit signed integer
typedef int16_t s16_t;   //for 16-bit signed integer in image functions
typedef uint16_t u16_t;  //for 16-bit unsigned integer
typedef int32_t q31_t;   //for 32-bit signed integer
typedef int32_t s32_t;   //for 32-bit signed integer in image functions
typedef uint32_t u32_t;  //for 32-bit unsigned integer
typedef int64_t q63_t;   //for 64-bit signed integer
typedef int64_t s64_t;   //for 64-bit signed integer in image functions
typedef uint64_t u64_t;  //for 64-bit unsigned integer
typedef float float32_t;  //for 32-bit single-precision floating-point
typedef _Float16 float16_t; //for 16-bit half-precision floating-point
typedef __bf16 bf16_t; //for 16-bit brain floating-point
typedef double float64_t;  //for 64-bit double-precision floating-point
typedef struct { float32_t x; float32_t y; } riscv_vec_f32x2_t;
     //for the structure of two floating point numbers
typedef struct { float32_t x; float32_t y; float32_t z; } riscv_vec_f32x3_t;
     //for the structure of three floating point numbers,
typedef struct { float32_t x; float32_t y; float32_t z; float32_t w; } riscv_vec_f32x4_t;
     //for the structure of four floating point numbers
#define RISCV_VEC_OK        ((int)0)     //for the returned value 0
#define RISCV_VEC_FAIL      ((int)-1)    //for the returned value 1
typedef enum
{
    RISCV_VEC_SUCCESS                 =  0,
    RISCV_VEC_MALLOC_FAIL             = -1,
    RISCV_VEC_INPUT_PARAM_ERROR       = -2,
} riscv_vec_status;
Note

If your application uses functions involving the half-precision or brain floating-point data types, compile it with the appropriate option (-mzfh for half-precision, -mext-bf16min for brain floating-point), and ensure that your toolchain (e.g., v5f or v5d) supports HardFloat; otherwise, execution issues may occur.

Linking Options for Newlib and MCUlib Toolchains

In addition to the above header files, different linking options are required depending on the toolchain in use. Options for Newlib and MCUlib Toolchains describes the options for Newlib and MCUlib toolchains. The supported options may differ depending on the toolchain type; see Supported Linking Options for Different Extensions.

Table 1. Options for Newlib and MCUlib Toolchains
Option Description

-lvec

Links VEC Library libvec.a without RISC-V Vector Extension

-lvec_v

Links VEC Library libvec_v.a with RISC-V Vector Extension, AndeStar V5 Vector Dot Product Extension, and ELEN=32 support

-lvec_v_seg

Links VEC Library libvec_v_seg.a with RISC-V Vector Extension, AndeStar V5 Vector Dot Product Extension, ELEN=32 support, RISC-V BF16 Extension: Zfbfmin, AndeStar V5 Vector BFLOAT16 Conversion Extension, Andes BFLOAT16 Computation, and RISC-V Vector segment load/store instructions

-lvec_v_elen64

Links VEC Library libvec_v_elen64.a with RISC-V Vector Extension, AndeStar V5 Vector Dot Product Extension, and ELEN=64 support

-lvec_v_elen64_seg

Links VEC Library libvec_v_elen64_seg.a with RISC-V Vector Extension, AndeStar V5 Vector Dot Product Extension, ELEN=64 support, RISC-V BF16 Extension: Zfbfmin, AndeStar V5 Vector BFLOAT16 Conversion Extension, Andes BFLOAT16 Computation, and RISC-V Vector segment load/store instructions

-lvec_v_elen64_felen64

Links VEC Library libvec_v_elen64_felen64.a with RISC-V Vector Extension, AndeStar V5 Vector Dot Product Extension, ELEN=64 and FELEN=64 support

-lvec_v_elen64_felen64_seg

Links VEC Library libvec_v_elen64_felen64_seg.a with RISC-V Vector Extension, AndeStar V5 Vector Dot Product Extension, ELEN=64 and FELEN=64 support, RISC-V BF16 Extension: Zfbfmin, AndeStar V5 Vector BFLOAT16 Conversion Extension, Andes BFLOAT16 Computation, and RISC-V Vector segment load/store instructions

-mext-dsp

Enables DSP ISA Extension

-mext-vector

Enables RISC-V Vector Extension

-mext-zc

Enables RISC-V Code Size Reduction Extension

-mzfh

Enables the half-precision floating-point type

-mext-bf16min

Enables the brain floating-point type and RISC-V BF16 Extension

-mtune=andes-45-series

Enables a more efficient library on AndesCore 45-series processors

-lm

Links the standard C math library

To ensure successful compilation of programs that use library functions relying on the standard C math library, be sure to link against it by specifying the -lm option.

Supported Linking Options for Different Extensions summarizes the required linking options depending on the extension supportability of running targets. In the table, With means considered, Without means not, N means FELEN is not equal to 64, and Y means it is equal to 64.

Table 2. Supported Linking Options for Different Extensions
Vector Segment Load/Store Instructions Vector ELEN Vector FELEN 64 RISC-V BF16 Extension and Andes BFLOAT16 Computation Linking Options

Without

Without

Without

Without

-lvec

Without

32

N

Without

-mext-vector -lvec_v

Without

64

N

Without

-mext-vector -lvec_v_elen64

Without

64

Y

Without

-mext-vector
-lvec_v_elen64_felen64

With

32

N

With

-mext-vector -lvec_v_seg

With

64

N

With

-mext-vector
-lvec_v_elen64_seg

With

64

Y

With

-mext-vector
-lvec_v_elen64_felen64_seg
Note

When targeting AndesCore 45-series processors, use the -mtune=andes-45-series option to enable optimizations specialized for these processors.

For RV32 targets and toolchains, only the linking options with ELEN=32 are supported (e.g., -lvec_v or -lvec_v_seg).

For RV64 v5d toolchains, the -lvec_v_elen64 option is not supported.

Linking options with FELEN=64 are supported only in the v5d toolchain (e.g., -lvec_v_elen64_felen64 or -lvec_v_elen64_felen64_seg).

The riscv_vec_convert_q3_q7 and riscv_vec_convert_s4_s8 functions are supported only when AndeStar V5 INT4 Vector Load Extension is available in target.

The functions with _bf16 in their names (e.g., riscv_vec_mul_bf16) are supported only when the target supports RISC-V BF16 Extension, AndeStar V5 Vector BFLOAT16 Conversion Extension, and Andes BFLOAT16 Computation.

If your application uses functions involving the half-precision or brain floating-point data types (i.e., functions named with F16 or BF16), ensure that your toolchain (e.g., v5f or v5d) supports HardFloat.

Compile the application with one of the following options:

  • -mzfh to enable the half-precision data type and the RISC-V Zfh/Zvfh Extensions

  • -mext-bf16min to enable the brain floating-point data type and the RISC-V BF16 extension

In addition, to prevent potential issues when loading the program, note that applications built with the following options require corresponding target support; otherwise, execution issues may occur:

  • -mext-dsp: DSP ISA Extension

  • -mext-vector: RISC-V Vector Extension

  • -lvec_v_seg or -lvec_v_elen64_seg or -lvec_v_elen64_felen64_seg:
    RISC-V Vector segment load/store instructions

  • -lvec_v_elen64 or -lvec_v_elen64_seg or -lvec_v_elen64_felen64 or -lvec_v_elen64_felen64_seg: ELEN=64

  • -lvec_v_elen64_felen64 or -lvec_v_elen64_felen64_seg: FELEN=64

  • -mzfh: RISC-V Zfh/Zvfh Extensions

  • -mext-zc: RISC-V Code Size Reduction Extension

  • -mext-bf16min: RISC-V BF16 Extension

Linking Options for Glibc Toolchains

Options for Glibc Toolchains describes the available options for Glibc toolchains.

Table 3. Options for Glibc Toolchains
Option Description

-static

Applies static linking

-lvec

Links VEC Library libvec.a without RISC-V Vector Extension

-lvec_v

Links VEC Library libvec_v.a with RISC-V Vector Extension, AndeStar V5 Vector Dot Product Extension, and ELEN=32 support

-lvec_v_seg

Links VEC Library libvec_v_seg.a with RISC-V Vector Extension, AndeStar V5 Vector Dot Product Extension, ELEN=32 support, RISC-V BF16 Extension: Zfbfmin, AndeStar V5 Vector BFLOAT16 Conversion Extension, Andes BFLOAT16 Computation, and RISC-V Vector segment load/store instructions

-lvec_v_elen64

Links VEC Library libvec_v_elen64.a with RISC-V Vector Extension, AndeStar V5 Vector Dot Product Extension, and ELEN=64 support

-lvec_v_elen64_seg

Links VEC Library libvec_v_elen64_seg.a with RISC-V Vector Extension, AndeStar V5 Vector Dot Product Extension, ELEN=64 support, RISC-V BF16 Extension: Zfbfmin, AndeStar V5 Vector BFLOAT16 Conversion Extension, Andes BFLOAT16 Computation, and RISC-V Vector segment load/store instructions

-lvec_v_elen64_felen64

Links VEC Library libvec_v_elen64_felen64.a with RISC-V Vector Extension, AndeStar V5 Vector Dot Product Extension, ELEN=64 and FELEN=64 support

-lvec_v_elen64_felen64_seg

Links VEC Library libvec_v_elen64_felen64_seg.a with RISC-V Vector Extension, AndeStar V5 Vector Dot Product Extension, ELEN=64 and FELEN=64 support, RISC-V BF16 Extension: Zfbfmin, AndeStar V5 Vector BFLOAT16 Conversion Extension, Andes BFLOAT16 Computation, and RISC-V Vector segment load/store instructions

-mext-vector

Enables the RISC-V Vector Extension

-mext-zc

Enables RISC-V Code Size Reduction Extension

-mzfh

Enables the half-precision floating-point type

-mext-bf16min

Enables the brain floating-point type and RISC-V BF16 Extension

-lm

Links the standard C math library

To ensure successful compilation of programs that use library functions relying on the standard C math library, be sure to link against it by specifying the -lm option.

Static and dynamic linking require different options. Linking Options for Different Types summarizes the required linking options needed based on the type of linking and the application’s extension support requirements. In the table, With means considered, Without means not, N means FELEN is not equal to 64, and Y means it is equal to 64.

Table 4. Linking Options for Different Types
Vector Segment Load/Store Instructions Vector ELEN Vector FELEN 64 RISC-V BF16 Extension and Andes BFLOAT16 Computation Linking Type Linking Options

Without

Without

Note

For RV32 targets and toolchains, only the linking options with ELEN=32 are supported (e.g., -lvec_v or -lvec_v_seg).

For RV64 v5d toolchains, the -lvec_v_elen64 option is not supported.

Linking options with FELEN=64 are supported only in the v5d toolchain (e.g., -lvec_v_elen64_felen64 or -lvec_v_elen64_felen64_seg).

The riscv_vec_convert_q3_q7 and riscv_vec_convert_s4_s8 functions are supported only when AndeStar V5 INT4 Vector Load Extension is available in target.

The functions with _bf16 in their names (e.g., riscv_vec_mul_bf16) are supported only when the target supports RISC-V BF16 Extension, AndeStar V5 Vector BFLOAT16 Conversion Extension, and Andes BFLOAT16 Computation.

If your application uses functions involving half-precision floating-point data type (i.e., functions with F16 in their names), ensure that your toolchain (e.g., v5f or v5d toolchain) supports HardFloat.

Compile the application with one of the following options:

  • -mzfh to enable the half-precision data type and the RISC-V Zfh/Zvfh Extensions

  • -mext-bf16min to enable the brain floating-point data type and the RISC-V BF16 extension

In addition, to prevent potential issues when loading the program, be aware that applications built with the following options cannot be executed on targets that lack the corresponding support:

  • -mext-vector: RISC-V Vector Extension

  • -lvec_v_seg or -lvec_v_elen64_seg or -lvec_v_elen64_felen64_seg:
    RISC-V Vector segment load/store instructions

  • -lvec_v_elen64 or -lvec_v_elen64_seg or -lvec_v_elen64_felen64 or -lvec_v_elen64_felen64_seg: ELEN=64

  • -lvec_v_elen64_felen64 or -lvec_v_elen64_felen64_seg: FELEN=64

  • -mzfh: RISC-V Zfh/Zvfh Extensions

  • -mext-zc: RISC-V Code Size Reduction Extension

  • -mext-bf16min: RISC-V BF16 extension

Data Alignment for VEC Library Functions

VEC Library functions are designed for 64-bit processors implementing the AndeStar V5 architecture and require 64-byte aligned data.

That is, they assume the base memory addresses of input arrays, including input source arrays and output destination arrays, are aligned to 64-byte boundaries.

These functions are implemented to load/store one word regardless of the type of input pointer, then process with RISC-V Vector Extension to deliver high performance. However, if not aligned to 64 bytes, the functions may cause errors.

For details on misaligned access handling in AndeStar V5-based processors, see the AndeStar V5 System Privileged Architecture and CSR Specification (UM164) document.

To avoid misaligned memory access on 64-bit AndeStar V5-based processors, explicitly declare 64-byte alignment for all data types (e.g., F32, F16, BF16, F64, Q31, Q15, and Q7). For example:

float32_t source[blocksize] __attribute__ ((aligned(64)));
float16_t tmpbuf[blocksize] __attribute__ ((aligned(64)));
bf16_t tmpbuf[blocksize] __attribute__ ((aligned(64)));
float64_t coeffs[blocksize] __attribute__ ((aligned(64)));
q31_t inputA[blocksize] __attribute__ ((aligned(64)));
q15_t outputvec[blocksize] __attribute__ ((aligned(64)));
q7_t source[blocksize] __attribute__ ((aligned(64)));

List of Functions

VEC Library Function List categorizes all functions of VEC Library and includes a Supported Since column. This column uses numbers to indicate the AndeSight (AST) or AndesAIRE version in which each function first became available:

  • 1 = AST v5.0.0 Beta

  • 2 = AST v5.0.0 Official

  • 3 = AST v5.1.0

  • 4 = AST v5.2.0 (VEC Library 2.2.0)

  • 5 = AST v5.3.0 (VEC Library 2.4.0)

  • 6 = AST v5.4.0 (VEC Library 2.5.0)

  • 7 = AndesAIRE NN SDK 1.1.0 Official (VEC Library 2.6.0) and AST v5.4.1 (VEC Library 2.6.1)

Category Function Supported Since

6

Basic Vector Functions

This section includes the following basic vector functions.

Vector Absolute Functions

These functions compute the absolute values of elements in a source vector and store the results one-by-one in a destination vector.

riscv_vec_abs_f32

Declaration
int riscv_vec_abs_f32 (float32_t * dst, float32_t * src, uint32_t count)
Description

Vector absolute function for F32.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[out] dst

Pointer to the output vector

[in] src

Pointer to the input vector

[in] count

Number of elements to be processed
Returns

RISCV_VEC_OK

Example
#define count    3
float32_t src[count] = {0.1, 0.2, 0.3};
float32_t dst[count];
riscv_vec_abs_f32 (dst, src, count);

This example also serves as a reference for examples of F16, F64, Q15, Q31, and Q7 vector absolute functions.

riscv_vec_abs_f16

Declaration
int riscv_vec_abs_f16 (float16_t * dst, float16_t * src, uint32_t count)
Description

Vector absolute function for F16.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[out] dst

Pointer to the output vector

[in] src

Pointer to the input vector

[in] count

Number of elements to be processed
Returns

RISCV_VEC_OK

Note

This function is supported only by toolchains that support hard-float. Additionally, you must apply the -mzfh option in both compiler and linker flags when using this function. For details about the -mzfh linking option, see Linking Options for Newlib and MCUlib Toolchains or Linking Options for Glibc Toolchains.

riscv_vec_abs_bf16

Declaration
int riscv_vec_abs_bf16 (bf16_t * dst, bf16_t * src, uint32_t count)
Description

Vector absolute function for BF16.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[out] dst

Pointer to the output vector

[in] src

Pointer to the input vector

[in] count

Number of elements to be processed
Returns

RISCV_VEC_OK

Note

This function is supported only by toolchains that support hard-float. Additionally, you must apply the -mext-bf16min option in both compiler and linker flags when using this function. For details about the -mext-bf16min linking option, see Linking Options for Newlib and MCUlib Toolchains or Linking Options for Glibc Toolchains.

riscv_vec_abs_f64

Declaration
int riscv_vec_abs_f64 (float64_t * dst, float64_t * src, uint32_t count)
Description

Vector absolute function for F64.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[out] dst

Pointer to the output vector

[in] src

Pointer to the input vector

[in] count

Number of elements to be processed
Returns

RISCV_VEC_OK

riscv_vec_abs_q31

Declaration
int riscv_vec_abs_q31 (q31_t * dst, q31_t * src, uint32_t count)
Description

Vector absolute function for Q31.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[out] dst

Pointer to the output vector

[in] src

Pointer to the input vector

[in] count

Number of elements to be processed
Returns

RISCV_VEC_OK

riscv_vec_abs_q15

Declaration
int riscv_vec_abs_q15 (q15_t * dst, q15_t * src, uint32_t count)
Description

Vector absolute function for Q15.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[out] dst

Pointer to the output vector

[in] src

Pointer to the input vector

[in] count

Number of elements to be processed
Returns

RISCV_VEC_OK

riscv_vec_abs_q7

Declaration
int riscv_vec_abs_q7 (q7_t * dst, q7_t * src, uint32_t count)
Description

Pointer to the output vector

[in] src

Pointer to the input vector

[in] count

Number of elements to be processed
Returns

RISCV_VEC_OK

riscv_vec_abs_f32x2

Declaration
int riscv_vec_abs_f32x2 (riscv_vec_f32x2_t * dst, riscv_vec_f32x2_t * src, uint32_t count)
Description

Vector absolute function for F32x2.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[out] dst

Pointer to the output vector

[in] src

Pointer to the input vector

[in] count

Number of elements to be processed. Each element has a data type of riscv_vec_f32x2_t.
Returns

RISCV_VEC_OK

Example
#define count    3
riscv_vec_f32x2_t src[count] = {{0,1, 0.2}, {-0.1, 0.3}, {-0.2, 0.3}};
riscv_vec_f32x2_t dst[count];
riscv_vec_abs_f32x2 (dst, src, count);

This example also serves as a reference for examples of F32x3 and F32x4 vector absolute functions.

riscv_vec_abs_f32x3

Declaration
int riscv_vec_abs_f32x3 (riscv_vec_f32x3_t * dst, riscv_vec_f32x3_t * src, uint32_t count)
Description

Vector absolute function for F32x3.

Parameter Description

Pointer to the output vector

[in] src

Pointer to the input vector

[in] count

Number of elements to be processed. Each element has a data type of riscv_vec_f32x3_t.
Returns

RISCV_VEC_OK

riscv_vec_abs_f32x4

Declaration
int riscv_vec_abs_f32x4 (riscv_vec_f32x4_t * dst, riscv_vec_f32x4_t * src, uint32_t count)
Description

Vector absolute function for F32x4.

Parameter Description

[out] dst

Pointer to the output vector

[in] src

Pointer to the input vector

[in] count

Number of elements to be processed. Each element has a data type of riscv_vec_f32x4_t.
Returns

RISCV_VEC_OK

Vector Addition Functions

These functions add a source vector to another source vector/scalar and store the results one-by-one in a destination vector.

riscv_vec_add_f32

Declaration
int riscv_vec_add_f32 (float32_t * dst, float32_t * src1, float32_t * src2, uint32_t count)
Description

Vector addition function for F32.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[out] dst

Pointer to the output vector

[in] src1

Pointer to the first input vector

[in] src2

Pointer to the second input vector

[in] count

Number of elements to be processed
Returns

RISCV_VEC_OK

Example
#define count    3
float32_t src1[count] = {0.1, 0.2, 0.3};
float32_t src2[count] = {0.2, -0.3, 0.4};
float32_t dst[count];
riscv_vec_add_f32 (dst, src1, src2, count);

This example also serves as a reference for examples of F16, F64, Q15, Q31, Q7, and U8_U16 vector addition functions.

riscv_vec_add_f16

Declaration
int riscv_vec_add_f16 (float16_t * dst, float16_t * src1, float16_t * src2, uint32_t count)
Description

Vector addition function for F16.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[out] dst

Pointer to the output vector

[in] src1

Pointer to the first input vector

[in] src2

Pointer to the second input vector

[in] count

Number of elements to be processed
Returns

RISCV_VEC_OK

Note

This function is supported only by toolchains that support hard-float. Additionally, you must apply the -mzfh option in both compiler and linker flags when using this function. For details about the -mzfh linking option, see Linking Options for Newlib and MCUlib Toolchains or Linking Options for Glibc Toolchains.

riscv_vec_add_bf16

Declaration
int riscv_vec_add_bf16 (bf16_t * dst, bf16_t * src1, bf16_t * src2, uint32_t count)
Description

Vector addition function for BF16.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[out] dst

Pointer to the output vector

[in] src1

Pointer to the first input vector

[in] src2

Pointer to the second input vector

[in] count

Number of elements to be processed
Returns

RISCV_VEC_OK

Note

This function is supported only by toolchains that support hard-float. Additionally, you must apply the -mext-bf16min option in both compiler and linker flags when using this function. For details about the -mext-bf16min linking option, see Linking Options for Newlib and MCUlib Toolchains or Linking Options for Glibc Toolchains.

riscv_vec_add_f64

Declaration
int riscv_vec_add_f64 (float64_t * dst, float64_t * src1, float64_t * src2, uint32_t count)
Description

Vector addition function for F64.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

Pointer to the output vector

[in] src1

Pointer to the first input vector

[in] src2

Pointer to the second input vector

[in] count

Number of elements to be processed
Returns

RISCV_VEC_OK

int riscv_vec_add_q31 (q31_t * dst, q31_t * src1, q31_t * src2, uint32_t count)

riscv_vec_add_u8_u16

Declaration
int riscv_vec_add_u8_u16 (u16_t * dst, u8_t * src1, u8_t * src2, uint32_t count)
Description

Vector addition function that adds two U8 data and saves the result in U16 format.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[out] dst

Pointer to the output vector

[in] src1

Pointer to the first input vector

[in] src2

Pointer to the second input vector

[in] count

Number of elements to be processed
Returns

RISCV_VEC_OK

riscv_vec_add_f32x2

Declaration
int riscv_vec_add_f32x2 (riscv_vec_f32x2_t * dst, riscv_vec_f32x2_t * src1, riscv_vec_f32x2_t * src2, uint32_t count)
Description

Vector addition function for F32x2.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[out] dst

Pointer to the output vector

[in] src1

Pointer to the first input vector

[in] src2

Pointer to the second input vector

[in] count

Number of elements to be processed. Each element has a data type of riscv_vec_f32x2_t.
Returns

RISCV_VEC_OK

Example
#define count    3
riscv_vec_f32x2_t src1[count] = {
    {0.1, 0.2}, {-0.1, 0.3}, {0.3, 0.1}
  };
riscv_vec_f32x2_t src2[count] = {
    {0.2, -0.3}, {-0.5, 0.1}, {-0.5, 0.1}
  };
riscv_vec_f32x2_t dst[count];
riscv_vec_add_f32x2 (dst, src1, src2, count);

This example also serves as a reference for examples of F32x3 and F32x4 vector addition functions.

riscv_vec_add_f32x3

Declaration
int riscv_vec_add_f32x3 (riscv_vec_f32x3_t * dst, riscv_vec_f32x3_t * src1, riscv_vec_f32x3_t * src2, uint32_t count)

RISCV_VEC_OK

riscv_vec_addc_f32

Declaration
int riscv_vec_addc_f32 (float32_t * dst, float32_t * src, const float32_t cst, uint32_t count)
Description

Vector add constant function for F32.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[out] dst

Pointer to the output vector

[in] src

Pointer to the input vector

[in] cst

Constant value with the data type of float32_t

[in] count

Number of elements to be processed
Returns

RISCV_VEC_OK

Example
#define count    3
float32_t src[count] = {0.1, 0.2, 0.3};
const float32_t cst = 0.2;
float32_t dst[count];
riscv_vec_addc_f32 (dst, src, &cst, count);

This example also serves as a reference for examples of F16, F64, Q15, Q31, Q7, and U8 vector add constant functions.

riscv_vec_addc_f16

Declaration
int riscv_vec_addc_f16 (float16_t * dst, float16_t * src, const float16_t cst, uint32_t count)
Description

Vector add constant function for F16.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[out] dst

Pointer to the output vector

[in] src

Pointer to the input vector

[in] cst

Constant value with the data type of float16_t

[in] count

Number of elements to be processed
Returns

RISCV_VEC_OK

Note

This function is supported only by toolchains that support hard-float. Additionally, you must apply the -mzfh option in both compiler and linker flags when using this function. For details about the -mzfh linking option, see Linking Options for Newlib and MCUlib Toolchains or Linking Options for Glibc Toolchains.

riscv_vec_addc_f32x2

Declaration
int riscv_vec_addc_f32x2 (riscv_vec_f32x2_t * dst, riscv_vec_f32x2_t * src, const riscv_vec_f32x2_t * cst, uint32_t count)
Description

Vector add constant function for F32x2.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[out] dst

Pointer to the output vector

[in] src

Pointer to the input vector

[in] cst

Constant value with the data type of riscv_vec_f32x2_t

[in] count

Number of elements to be processed. Each element has a data type of riscv_vec_f32x2_t.
Returns

RISCV_VEC_OK

Example
#define count    2
riscv_vec_f32x2_t src[count] = {
    {0.1, 0.2}, {-0.1, 0.3}, {0.3, 0.1}
  };
riscv_vec_f32x2_t cst = {0.2, -0.3};
riscv_vec_f32x2_t dst[count];
riscv_vec_addc_f32x2 (dst, src, &cst, count);

This example also serves as a reference for examples of F32x3 and F32x4 vector add constant functions.

Vector Cross Product Function

This function calculates the cross product of two vectors and stores the results in a destination vector.

riscv_vec_cross_f32x3

Declaration
int riscv_vec_cross_f32x3 (riscv_vec_f32x3_t * dst, riscv_vec_f32x3_t * src1, riscv_vec_f32x3_t * src2, uint32_t count)
Description

Vector cross product function for F32x3.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[out] dst

Pointer to the output vector

[in] src1

Pointer to the first input vector

[in] src2

Pointer to the second input vector

[in] count

Number of elements to be processed. Each element has a data type of riscv_vec_f32x3_t.
Returns

RISCV_VEC_OK

Example
#define count    3
riscv_vec_f32x3_t src1[count] = {
    {0.1, 0.2, -0.1}, {-0.1, 0.3, 0.2}, {0.3, 0.1, -0.4}
  };
riscv_vec_f32x3_t src2[count] = {
    {0.2, -0.3, 0.2}, {-0.5, 0.1, 0.3}, {-0.5, 0.1, -0.2}
  };
riscv_vec_f32x3_t dst[count];
riscv_vec_cross_f32x3 (dst, src1, src2, count);

Vector Division Functions

These functions divide a source vector by another source vector/scalar and store the results one-by-one in a destination vector.

riscv_vec_div_f32

Declaration
int riscv_vec_div_f32 (float32_t * dst, float32_t * src1, float32_t * src2, uint32_t count)
Description

Vector division function for F32.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[out] dst

Pointer to the output vector

[in] src1

Pointer to the first input vector

[in] src2

Pointer to the second input vector

[in] count

Number of elements to be processed
Returns

RISCV_VEC_OK

Example
#define count    3
float32_t src1[count] = {0.1, 0.2, 0.3};
float32_t src2[count] = {0.2, -0.3, 0.4};
float32_t dst[count];
riscv_vec_div_f32 (dst, src1, src2, count);

riscv_vec_div_f16

Declaration
int riscv_vec_div_f16 (float16_t * dst, float16_t * src1, float16_t * src2, uint32_t count)
Description

Vector division function for F16.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[out] dst

Pointer to the output vector

[in] src1

Pointer to the first input vector

[in] src2

Pointer to the second input vector

[in] count

Number of elements to be processed
Returns

RISCV_VEC_OK

Note

This function is supported only by toolchains that support hard-float. Additionally, you must apply the -mzfh option in both compiler and linker flags when using this function. For details about the -mzfh linking option, see Linking Options for Newlib and MCUlib Toolchains or Linking Options for Glibc Toolchains.

riscv_vec_div_bf16

Declaration
int riscv_vec_div_bf16 (bf16_t * dst, bf16_t * src1, bf16_t * src2, uint32_t count)
Description

Vector division function for BF16.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[out] dst

Pointer to the output vector

[in] src1

Pointer to the first input vector

[in] src2

Pointer to the second input vector

[in] count

Number of elements to be processed
Returns

RISCV_VEC_OK

Note

This function is supported only by toolchains that support hard-float. Additionally, you must apply the -mext-bf16min option in both compiler and linker flags when using this function. For details about the -mext-bf16min linking option, see Linking Options for Newlib and MCUlib Toolchains or Linking Options for Glibc Toolchains.

riscv_vec_div_f32x2

Declaration
int riscv_vec_div_f32x2 (riscv_vec_f32x2_t * dst, riscv_vec_f32x2_t * src1, riscv_vec_f32x2_t * src2, uint32_t count)
Description

Vector division function for F32x2.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[out] dst

Pointer to the output vector

[in] src1

Pointer to the first input vector

[in] src2

Pointer to the second input vector

[in] count

Number of elements to be processed. Each element has a data type of riscv_vec_f32x2_t.
Returns

RISCV_VEC_OK

Example
#define count    3
riscv_vec_f32x2_t src1[count] = {
    {0.1, 0.2}, {-0.1, 0.3}, {0.3, 0.1}
  };
riscv_vec_f32x2_t src2[count] = {
    {0.2, -0.3}, {-0.5, 0.1}, {-0.5, 0.1}
  };
riscv_vec_f32x2_t dst[count];
riscv_vec_div_f32x2 (dst, src1, src2, count);

This example also serves as a reference for examples of F32x3 and F32x4 vector division functions.

riscv_vec_div_f32x3

Declaration
int riscv_vec_div_f32x3 (riscv_vec_f32x3_t * dst, riscv_vec_f32x3_t * src1, riscv_vec_f32x3_t * src2, uint32_t count)

RISCV_VEC_OK

int riscv_vec_div_f32x4 (riscv_vec_f32x4_t * dst, riscv_vec_f32x4_t * src1, riscv_vec_f32x4_t * src2, uint32_t count)

riscv_vec_divc_f32

Declaration
int riscv_vec_divc_f32 (float32_t * dst, float32_t * src, const float32_t cst, uint32_t count)
Description

Vector divide constant function for F32.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[out] dst

Pointer to the output vector

[in] src

Pointer to the input vector

[in] cst

Constant value with the data type of float32_t

[in] count

Number of the elements to be processed
Returns

RISCV_VEC_OK

Example
#define count    3
float32_t src[count] = {0.1, 0.2, 0.3};
const float32_t cst = 0.2;
float32_t dst[count];
riscv_vec_divc_f32 (dst, src, &cst, count);

riscv_vec_divc_f16

Declaration
int riscv_vec_divc_f16 (float16_t * dst, float16_t * src, const float16_t cst, uint32_t count)

Vector divide constant function for F16.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[out] dst

Pointer to the output vector

[in] src

Pointer to the input vector

[in] cst

Constant value with the data type of float16_t

[in] count

Number of the elements to be processed
Returns

RISCV_VEC_OK

Note

This function is supported only by toolchains that support hard-float. Additionally, you must apply the -mzfh option in both compiler and linker flags when using this function. For details about the -mzfh linking option, see Linking Options for Newlib and MCUlib Toolchains or Linking Options for Glibc Toolchains.

riscv_vec_divc_f32x2

Declaration
int riscv_vec_divc_f32x2 (riscv_vec_f32x2_t * dst, riscv_vec_f32x2_t * src, const riscv_vec_f32x2_t * cst, uint32_t count)
Description

Vector divide constant function for F32x2.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[out] dst

Pointer to the output vector

[in] src

Pointer to the input vector

[in] cst

Constant value with the data type of riscv_vec_f32x2_t

[in] count

Number of the elements to be processed. Each element has a data type of riscv_vec_f32x2_t.
Returns

RISCV_VEC_OK

Example
#define count    2
riscv_vec_f32x2_t src[count] = {
    {0.1, 0.2}, {-0.1, 0.3}, {0.3, 0.1}
  };
riscv_vec_f32x2_t cst = {0.2, -0.3};
riscv_vec_f32x2_t dst[count];
riscv_vec_divc_f32x2 (dst, src, &cst, count);

This example also serves as a reference for examples of F32x3 and F32x4 vector divide constant functions.

riscv_vec_divc_f32x3

Declaration
int riscv_vec_divc_f32x3 (riscv_vec_f32x3_t * dst, riscv_vec_f32x3_t * src, const riscv_vec_f32x3_t * cst, uint32_t count)
Description

Vector divide constant function for F32x3.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[out] dst

Pointer to the output vector

[in] src

Pointer to the input vector

[in] cst

Constant value with the data type of riscv_vec_f32x3_t

[in] count

Number of the elements to be processed. Each element has a data type of riscv_vec_f32x3_t.
Returns

RISCV_VEC_OK

riscv_vec_divc_f32x4

Declaration
int riscv_vec_divc_f32x4 (riscv_vec_f32x4_t * dst, riscv_vec_f32x4_t * src, const riscv_vec_f32x4_t * cst, uint32_t count)
Description

Vector divide constant function for F32x4.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[out] dst

Pointer to the output vector

[in] src

Pointer to the input vector

[in] cst

Constant value with the data type of riscv_vec_f32x4_t

[in] count

Number of the elements to be processed. Each element has a data type of riscv_vec_f32x4_t.
Returns

RISCV_VEC_OK

Vector Dot Product Functions

These functions calculate the dot product of two vectors and store the results in a destination output.

riscv_vec_dprod_f32

Declaration
float32_t riscv_vec_dprod_f32 (float32_t * src1, float32_t * src2, uint32_t count)
Description

Vector dot product function for F32.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in] src1

Pointer to the first input vector

[in] src2

Pointer to the second input vector

[in] count

Number of elements to be processed
Returns

Dot product of the two input vectors

Example
#define count    3
float32_t src1[count] = {0.1, 0.2, 0.3};
float32_t src2[count] = {0.2, -0.3, 0.4};
float32_t out;
out = riscv_vec_dprod_f32 (src1, src2, count);

This example also serves as a reference for examples of F16, F64, Q15, Q31, Q7, Q7xQ15, U8, and U8xQ15 vector dot product functions.

riscv_vec_dprod_f16

Declaration
float16_t riscv_vec_dprod_f16 (float16_t * src1, float16_t * src2, uint32_t count)
Description

Vector dot product function for F16.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in] src1

Pointer of the first input vector

[in] src2

Pointer to the second input vector

[in] count

Number of elements to be processed
Returns

Dot product of the two input vectors

Note

This function is supported only by toolchains that support hard-float. Additionally, you must apply the -mzfh option in both compiler and linker flags when using this function. For details about the -mzfh linking option, see Linking Options for Newlib and MCUlib Toolchains or Linking Options for Glibc Toolchains.

riscv_vec_dprod_bf16

Declaration
float16_t riscv_vec_dprod_bf16 (bf16_t * src1, bf16_t * src2, uint32_t count)
Description

Vector dot product function for BF16.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in] src1

Pointer of the first input vector

[in] src2

Pointer to the second input vector

[in] count

Number of elements to be processed
Returns

Dot product of the two input vectors

Note

This function is supported only by toolchains that support hard-float. Additionally, you must apply the -mext-bf16min option in both compiler and linker flags when using this function. For details about the -mext-bf16min linking option, see Linking Options for Newlib and MCUlib Toolchains or Linking Options for Glibc Toolchains.

riscv_vec_dprod_f32x2

Declaration
int riscv_vec_dprod_f32x2 (float32_t * dst, riscv_vec_f32x2_t * src1, riscv_vec_f32x2_t * src2, uint32_t count)
Description

Vector dot product function for F32x2.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[out] dst

Dot product of the two input vectors

[in] src1

Pointer to the first input vector

[in] src2

Pointer to the second input vector

[in] count

Number of elements to be processed. Each element has a data type of riscv_vec_f32x2_t.
Returns

RISCV_VEC_OK

Example
#define count    3
riscv_vec_f32x2_t src1[count] = {
    {0.1, 0.2}, {-0.1, 0.3}, {0.3, 0.1}
  };
riscv_vec_f32x2_t src2[count] = {
    {0.2, -0.3}, {-0.5, 0.1}, {-0.5, 0.1}
  };
riscv_vec_f32x2_t dst[count];
riscv_vec_dprod_f32x2 (dst, src1, src2, count);

This example also serves as a reference for examples of F32x3 and F32x4 vector dot product functions.

riscv_vec_dprod_f32x3

Declaration
int riscv_vec_dprod_f32x3 (float32_t * dst, riscv_vec_f32x3_t * src1, riscv_vec_f32x3_t * src2, uint32_t count)
Description

Number of elements to be processed. Each element has a data type of riscv_vec_f32x3_t.
Returns

RISCV_VEC_OK

Vector Multiply and Add Functions

These functions calculate the multiplication of two vectors and store the results in a destination vector.

riscv_vec_madd_f32

Declaration
int riscv_vec_madd_f32 (float32_t * dst, float32_t * src1, float32_t * src2, uint32_t count)
Description

Vector multiply and add functions for F32.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in, out] dst

Pointer to the output vector

[in] src1

Pointer to the first input vector

[in] src2

Pointer to the second input vector

[in] count

Number of elements to be processed
Returns

RISCV_VEC_OK

Example
#define count    3
float32_t src1[count] = {0.1, 0.2, 0.3};
float32_t src2[count] = {0.2, -0.3, 0.4};
float32_t dst[count];
riscv_vec_madd_f32 (dst, src1, src2, count);

This example also serves as a reference for an example of F16 vector multiply and add functions.

riscv_vec_madd_f16

Declaration
int riscv_vec_madd_f16 (float16_t * dst, float16_t * src1, float16_t * src2, uint32_t count)
Description

Vector multiply and add functions for F16.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in, out] dst

Pointer to the output vector

[in] src1

Pointer to the first input vector

[in] src2

Pointer to the second input vector

[in] count

Number of elements to be processed
Returns

RISCV_VEC_OK

Note

This function is supported only by toolchains that support hard-float. Additionally, you must apply the -mzfh option in both compiler and linker flags when using this function. For details about the -mzfh linking option, see Linking Options for Newlib and MCUlib Toolchains or Linking Options for Glibc Toolchains.

riscv_vec_madd_f32x2

Declaration
int riscv_vec_madd_f32x2 (riscv_vec_f32x2_t * dst, riscv_vec_f32x2_t * src1, riscv_vec_f32x2_t * src2, uint32_t count)
Description

Vector multiply and add functions for F32x2.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in, out] dst

Pointer to the output vector

[in] src1

Pointer to the first input vector

[in] src2

Pointer to the second input vector

[in] count

Number of elements to be processed. Each element has a data type of riscv_vec_f32x2_t.
Returns

RISCV_VEC_OK

Example
#define count    3
riscv_vec_f32x2_t src1[count] = {
    {0.1, 0.2}, {-0.1, 0.3}, {0.3, 0.1}
  };
riscv_vec_f32x2_t src2[count] = {
    {0.2, -0.3}, {-0.5, 0.1}, {-0.5, 0.1}
  };
riscv_vec_f32x2_t dst[count];
riscv_vec_madd_f32x2 (dst, src1, src2, count);

This example also serves as a reference for examples of F32x3 and F32x4 vector multiply and add functions.

riscv_vec_maddc_f32

Declaration
int riscv_vec_maddc_f32 (float32_t * dst, float32_t * src, const float32_t cst, uint32_t count)
Description

Vector multiply and add constant functions for F32.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in, out] dst

Pointer to the output vector

[in] src

Pointer to the input vector

[in] cst

Constant value with the data type of float32_t

[in] count

Number of elements to be processed
Returns

RISCV_VEC_OK

Example
#define count    3
float32_t src[count] = {0.1, 0.2, 0.3};
const float32_t cst = 0.2;
float32_t dst[count];
riscv_vec_maddc_f32 (dst, src, &cst, count);

This example also serves as a reference for an example of F16 and F64 vector multiply and add constant functions.

Vector Magnitude Functions

These functions compute the magnitude of a vector and store the results in a destination vector.

riscv_vec_mag_f32x2

Declaration
int riscv_vec_mag_f32x2 (float32_t * dst, riscv_vec_f32x2_t * src, uint32_t count)
Description

Vector magnitude function for F32x2.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[out] dst

Magnitude of the input vector

[in] src

Pointer to the input vector

[in] count

Number of elements to be processed. Each element has a data type of riscv_vec_f32x2_t.
Returns

RISCV_VEC_OK

Example
#define count    3
riscv_vec_f32x2_t src[count] = {{0,1, 0.2}, {-0.1, 0.3}, {-0.2, 0.3}};
float32_t dst[count];
riscv_vec_mag_f32x2 (dst, src, count);

This example also serves as a reference for examples of F32x3 and F32x4 vector magnitude functions.

riscv_vec_mag_f32x3

Declaration
int riscv_vec_mag_f32x3 (float32_t * dst, riscv_vec_f32x3_t * src, uint32_t count)

RISCV_VEC_OK

Vector Multiplication Functions

These functions multiply a source vector by another source vector/scalar and store the results one-by-one in a destination vector.

riscv_vec_mul_f32

Declaration
int riscv_vec_mul_f32 (float32_t * dst, float32_t * src1, float32_t * src2, uint32_t count)
Description

Vector multiplication function for F32.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[out] dst

Pointer to the output vector

[in] src1

Pointer to the first input vector

[in] src2

Pointer to the second input vector

[in] count

Number of elements to be processed
Returns

RISCV_VEC_OK

Example
#define count    3
float32_t src1[count] = {0.1, 0.2, 0.3};
float32_t src2[count] = {0.2, -0.3, 0.4};
float32_t dst[count];
riscv_vec_mul_f32 (dst, src1, src2, count);

This example also serves as a reference for examples of F16, F64, Q15, Q31, Q7, and U8_U16 vector multiplication functions.

riscv_vec_mul_f16

Declaration
int riscv_vec_mul_f16 (float16_t * dst, float16_t * src1, float16_t * src2, uint32_t count)
Description

Vector multiplication function for F16.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[out] dst

Pointer to the output vector

[in] src1

Pointer to the first input vector

[in] src2

Pointer to the second input vector

[in] count

Number of elements to be processed
Returns

RISCV_VEC_OK

Note

This function is supported only by toolchains that support hard-float. Additionally, you must apply the -mzfh option in both compiler and linker flags when using this function. For details about the -mzfh linking option, see Linking Options for Newlib and MCUlib Toolchains or Linking Options for Glibc Toolchains.

riscv_vec_mul_bf16

Declaration
int riscv_vec_mul_bf16 (bf16_t * dst, bf16_t * src1, bf16_t * src2, uint32_t count)
Description

Vector multiplication function for BF16.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[out] dst

Pointer to the output vector

[in] src1

Pointer to the first input vector

[in] src2

Pointer to the second input vector

[in] count

Number of elements to be processed
Returns

RISCV_VEC_OK

Note

This function is supported only by toolchains that support hard-float. Additionally, you must apply the -mext-bf16min option in both compiler and linker flags when using this function. For details about the -mext-bf16min linking option, see Linking Options for Newlib and MCUlib Toolchains or Linking Options for Glibc Toolchains.

Declaration
int riscv_vec_mul_u8_u16 (u16_t * dst, u8_t * src1, u8_t * src2, uint32_t count)
Description

Vector multiplication function that multiplies two U8 data and saves the result in U16 format.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[out] dst

Pointer to the output vector

[in] src1

Pointer to the first input vector

[in] src2

Pointer to the second input vector

[in] count

Number of elements to be processed
Returns

RISCV_VEC_OK

riscv_vec_mul_f32x2

Declaration
int riscv_vec_mul_f32x2 (riscv_vec_f32x2_t * dst, riscv_vec_f32x2_t * src1, riscv_vec_f32x2_t * src2, uint32_t count)
Description

Vector multiplication function for F32x2.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[out] dst

Pointer to the output vector

[in] src1

Pointer to the first input vector

[in] src2

Pointer to the second input vector

[in] count

Number of elements to be processed. Each element has a data type of riscv_vec_f32x2_t.
Returns

RISCV_VEC_OK

Example
#define count    3
riscv_vec_f32x2_t src1[count] = {
    {0.1, 0.2}, {-0.1, 0.3}, {0.3, 0.1}
  };
riscv_vec_f32x2_t src2[count] = {
    {0.2, -0.3}, {-0.5, 0.1}, {-0.5, 0.1}
  };
riscv_vec_f32x2_t dst[count];
riscv_vec_mul_f32x2 (dst, src1, src2, count);

This example also serves as a reference for examples of F32x3 and F32x4 vector multiplication functions.

riscv_vec_mul_f32x3

Declaration
int riscv_vec_mul_f32x3 (riscv_vec_f32x3_t * dst, riscv_vec_f32x3_t * src1, riscv_vec_f32x3_t * src2, uint32_t count)

riscv_vec_mulc_f32

Declaration
int riscv_vec_mulc_f32 (float32_t * dst, float32_t * src, const float32_t cst, uint32_t count)
Description

Vector multiply constant function for F32.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[out] dst

Pointer to the output vector

[in] src

Pointer to the input vector

[in] cst

Constant value with the data type of float32_t

[in] count

Number of elements to be processed
Returns

RISCV_VEC_OK

Example
#define count    3
float32_t src[count] = {0.1, 0.2, 0.3};
const float32_t cst = 0.2;
float32_t dst[count];
riscv_vec_mulc_f32 (dst, src, &cst, count);

This example also serves as a reference for examples of F16, F64, Q15, Q31, Q7, and U8 vector multiply constant functions.

riscv_vec_mulc_f16

Declaration
int riscv_vec_mulc_f16 (float16_t * dst, float16_t * src, const float16_t cst, uint32_t count)

Pointer to the input vector

[in] cst

Constant value with the data type of float16_t

[in] count

Number of elements to be processed
Returns

RISCV_VEC_OK

Note

This function is supported only by toolchains that support hard-float. Additionally, you must apply the -mzfh option in both compiler and linker flags when using this function. For details about the -mzfh linking option, see Linking Options for Newlib and MCUlib Toolchains or Linking Options for Glibc Toolchains.

riscv_vec_mulc_f32x2

Declaration
int riscv_vec_mulc_f32x2 (riscv_vec_f32x2_t * dst, riscv_vec_f32x2_t * src, const riscv_vec_f32x2_t * cst, uint32_t count)
Description

Vector multiply constant function for F32x2.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[out] dst

Pointer to the output vector

[in] src

Pointer to the input vector

[in] cst

Constant value with the data type of riscv_vec_f32x2_t

[in] count

Number of elements to be processed. Each element has a data type of riscv_vec_f32x2_t.
Returns

RISCV_VEC_OK

Example
#define count    2
riscv_vec_f32x2_t src[count] = {
    {0.1, 0.2}, {-0.1, 0.3}, {0.3, 0.1}
  };
riscv_vec_f32x2_t cst = {0.2, -0.3};
riscv_vec_f32x2_t dst[count];
riscv_vec_mulc_f32x2 (dst, src, &cst, count);

This example also serves as a reference for examples of F32x3 and F32x4 vector multiply constant functions.

Vector Set Functions

These functions set all elements in a destination vector to a constant value.

riscv_vec_setc_f32

Declaration
int riscv_vec_setc_f32 (float32_t * dst, const float32_t cst, uint32_t count)
Description

Vector set constant function for F32.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[out] dst

Pointer to the output vector

[in] cst

Constant value with the data type of float32_t

[in] count

Number of elements to be processed
Returns

RISCV_VEC_OK

Example
#define count    3
const float32_t cst = 0.2;
float32_t dst[count];
riscv_vec_setc_f32 (dst, &cst, count);

This example also serves as a reference for examples of F16, F64, Q15, Q31, and Q7 vector set constant functions.

Declaration
int riscv_vec_setc_f16 (float16_t * dst, const float16_t cst, uint32_t count)

Vector Subtraction Functions

These functions subtract the elements of one vector from the corresponding elements of another vector/scalar and store the results one-by-one in a destination vector.

riscv_vec_sub_f32

Declaration
int riscv_vec_sub_f32 (float32_t * dst, float32_t * src1, float32_t * src2, uint32_t count)
Description

Vector subtraction function for F32.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[out] dst

Pointer to the output vector

[in] src1

Pointer to the first input vector

[in] src2

Pointer to the second input vector

[in] count

Number of elements to be processed
Returns

RISCV_VEC_OK

Example
#define count    3
float32_t src1[count] = {0.1, 0.2, 0.3};
float32_t src2[count] = {0.2, -0.3, 0.4};
float32_t dst[count];
riscv_vec_sub_f32 (dst, src1, src2, count);

This example also serves as a reference for examples of F16, F64 Q15, Q31, Q7, and U8_Q7 vector subtraction functions.

riscv_vec_sub_f16

Declaration
int riscv_vec_sub_f16 (float16_t * dst, float16_t * src1, float16_t * src2, uint32_t count)
Description

Vector subtraction function for F16.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[out] dst

Pointer to the output vector

[in] src1

Pointer to the first input vector

[in] src2

Pointer to the second input vector

[in] count

Number of elements to be processed
Returns

RISCV_VEC_OK

Note

This function is supported only by toolchains that support hard-float. Additionally, you must apply the -mzfh option in both compiler and linker flags when using this function. For details about the -mzfh linking option, see Linking Options for Newlib and MCUlib Toolchains or Linking Options for Glibc Toolchains.

riscv_vec_sub_u8_q7

Declaration
int riscv_vec_sub_u8_q7 (q7_t * dst, u8_t * src1, u8_t * src2, uint32_t count)
Description

The vector subtraction function that subtracts an U8 element in a vector from its U8 counterpart in another vector and saves the result in Q7 format.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[out] dst

Pointer to the output vector

[in] src1

Pointer to the first input vector

[in] src2

Pointer to the second input vector

[in] count

Number of elements to be processed
Returns

RISCV_VEC_OK

riscv_vec_sub_f32x2

Declaration
int riscv_vec_sub_f32x2 (riscv_vec_f32x2_t * dst, riscv_vec_f32x2_t * src1, riscv_vec_f32x2_t * src2, uint32_t count)
Description

Vector subtraction function for F32x2.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[out] dst

Pointer to the output vector

[in] src1

Pointer to the first input vector

[in] src2

Pointer to the second input vector

[in] count

Number of elements to be processed. Each element has a data type of riscv_vec_f32x2_t.
Returns

RISCV_VEC_OK

Example
#define count    3
riscv_vec_f32x2_t src1[count] = {
    {0.1, 0.2}, {-0.1, 0.3}, {0.3, 0.1}
  };
riscv_vec_f32x2_t src2[count] = {
    {0.2, -0.3}, {-0.5, 0.1}, {-0.5, 0.1}
  };
riscv_vec_f32x2_t dst[count];
riscv_vec_sub_f32x2 (dst, src1, src2, count);

This example also serves as a reference for examples of F32x3 and F32x4 vector subtraction functions.

riscv_vec_sub_f32x3

Declaration
int riscv_vec_sub_f32x3 (riscv_vec_f32x3_t * dst, riscv_vec_f32x3_t * src1, riscv_vec_f32x3_t * src2, uint32_t count)
Description

Vector subtraction function for F32x3.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[out] dst

Pointer to the output vector

[in] src1

Pointer to the first input vector

[in] src2

Pointer to the second input vector

[in] count

Number of elements to be processed. Each element has a data type of riscv_vec_f32x3_t.
Returns

RISCV_VEC_OK

riscv_vec_sub_f32x4

Declaration
int riscv_vec_sub_f32x4 (riscv_vec_f32x4_t * dst, riscv_vec_f32x4_t * src1, riscv_vec_f32x4_t * src2, uint32_t count)
Description

Vector subtraction function for F32x4.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[out] dst

Pointer to the output vector

[in] src1

Pointer to the first input vector

[in] src2

Pointer to the second input vector

[in] count

Number of elements to be processed. Each element has a data type of riscv_vec_f32x4_t.
Returns

RISCV_VEC_OK

riscv_vec_subc_f32

Declaration
int riscv_vec_subc_f32 (float32_t * dst, float32_t * src, const float32_t cst, uint32_t count)
Description

Vector subtract constant function for F32.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[out] dst

Pointer to the output vector

[in] src

Pointer to the input vector

[in] cst

constant value with the data type of float32_t

[in] count

Number of elements to be processed
Returns

RISCV_VEC_OK

Example
#define count    3
float32_t src[count] = {0.1, 0.2, 0.3};
const float32_t cst = 0.2;
float32_t dst[count];
riscv_vec_subc_f32 (dst, src, &cst, count);

This example also serves as a reference for an example of F16 vector subtract constant function.

riscv_vec_subc_f16

Declaration
int riscv_vec_subc_f16 (float16_t * dst, float16_t * src, const float16_t cst, uint32_t count)
Description

Vector subtract constant function for F16.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[out] dst

Pointer to the output vector

[in] src

Pointer to the input vector

[in] cst

Constant value with the data type of float16_t

[in] count

Number of elements to be processed
Returns

RISCV_VEC_OK

Note

This function is supported only by toolchains that support hard-float. Additionally, you must apply the -mzfh option in both compiler and linker flags when using this function. For details about the -mzfh linking option, see Linking Options for Newlib and MCUlib Toolchains or Linking Options for Glibc Toolchains.

riscv_vec_subc_f32x2

Declaration
int riscv_vec_subc_f32x2 (riscv_vec_f32x2_t * dst, riscv_vec_f32x2_t * src, const riscv_vec_f32x2_t * cst, uint32_t count)
Description

Vector subtract constant function for F32x2.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[out] dst

Pointer to the output vector

[in] src

Pointer to the input vector

[in] cst

Constant value with the data type of riscv_vec_f32x2_t

[in] count

Number of elements to be processed. Each element has a data type of riscv_vec_f32x2_t.
Returns

RISCV_VEC_OK

Example
#define count    2
riscv_vec_f32x2_t src[count] = {
    {0.1, 0.2}, {-0.1, 0.3}, {0.3, 0.1}
  };
riscv_vec_f32x2_t cst = {0.2, -0.3};
riscv_vec_f32x2_t dst[count];
riscv_vec_subc_f32x2 (dst, src, &cst, count);

This example also serves as a reference for examples of F32x3 and F32x4 vector subtract constant functions.

riscv_vec_subc_f32x3

int riscv_vec_subc_f32x3 (riscv_vec_f32x3_t * dst, riscv_vec_f32x3_t * src, const riscv_vec_f32x3_t * cst, uint32_t count)

[in] src

Pointer to the input vector

Constant value with the data type of riscv_vec_f32x4_t

[in] count

Number of elements to be processed. Each element has a data type of riscv_vec_f32x4_t.
Returns

RISCV_VEC_OK

riscv_vec_rsubc_f32

Declaration
int riscv_vec_rsubc_f32 (float32_t * dst, float32_t * src, const float32_t cst, uint32_t count)
Description

Constant subtract vector function for F32.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[out] dst

Pointer to the output vector

[in] src

Pointer to the input vector

[in] cst

Constant value with the data type of float32_t

[in] count

Number of elements to be processed
Returns

RISCV_VEC_OK

Example
#define count    3

float32_t src[count] = {0.1, 0.4, -0.2};
const float32_t cst = 0.2;
float32_t dst[count] = {0};
riscv_vec_rsubc_f32 (dst, src, cst, count);

Outputs of the above example are as follows:
dst[0] = 0.2 - 0.1 = 0.1
dst[1] = 0.2 - 0.4 = -0.2
dst[2] = 0.2 - (-0.2) = 0.0

This example also serves as a reference for an example of F16 constant subtract vector function.

riscv_vec_rsubc_f16

Declaration
int riscv_vec_rsubc_f16 (float16_t * dst, float16_t * src, const float16_t cst, uint32_t count)
Description

Constant subtract vector function for F16.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[out] dst

Pointer to the output vector

[in] src

Pointer to the input vector

[in] cst

Constant value with the data type of float16_t

[in] count

Number of elements to be processed
Returns

RISCV_VEC_OK

Note

This function is supported only by toolchains that support hard-float. Additionally, you must apply the -mzfh option in both compiler and linker flags when using this function. For details about the -mzfh linking option, see Linking Options for Newlib and MCUlib Toolchains or Linking Options for Glibc Toolchains.

riscv_vec_rsubc_f32x2

Declaration
int riscv_vec_rsubc_f32x2 (riscv_vec_f32x2_t * dst, riscv_vec_f32x2_t * src, const riscv_vec_f32x2_t * cst, uint32_t count)
Description

Constant subtract vector function for F32x2.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[out] dst

Pointer to the output vector

[in] src

Pointer to the input vector

[in] cst

Constant value with the data type of riscv_vec_f32x2_t

[in] count

Number of elements to be processed. Each element has a data type of riscv_vec_f32x2_t.
Returns

RISCV_VEC_OK

Example
#define count    3

riscv_vec_f32x2_t src[count] = {{0.1, 0.2}, {0.4, -0.1}, {-0.2, 0.3}};
const riscv_vec_f32x2_t cst = {0.2, 0.1};
riscv_vec_f32x2_t dst[count];
riscv_vec_rsubc_f32x2 (dst, src, cst, count);

Outputs of the above example are as follows.
dst[0] = {0.1, -0.1}
dst[1] = {-0.2, 0.2}
dst[2] = {0.4, -0.2}

This example also serves as a reference for examples of F32x3 and F32x4 constant subtract vector functions.

Vector Normalization Functions

These functions normalize source vectors and store the results in a destination vector.

riscv_vec_normalize_f32x2

Declaration
int riscv_vec_normalize_f32x2 (riscv_vec_f32x2_t * dst, riscv_vec_f32x2_t * src, uint32_t count)
Description

Vector normalization function for F32x2.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[out] dst

Pointer to the output vector

[in] src

Pointer to the input vector

[in] count

Number of elements to be processed. Each element has a data type of riscv_vec_f32x2_t.
Returns

RISCV_VEC_OK

Example
#define count    3
riscv_vec_f32x2_t src[count] = {{0,1, 0.2}, {-0.1, 0.3}, {-0.2, 0.3}};
riscv_vec_f32x2_t dst[count];
riscv_vec_normalize_f32x2 (dst, src, count);

This example also serves as a reference for examples of F32x3 and F32x4 vector normalization functions.

riscv_vec_normalize_f32x3

Declaration
int riscv_vec_normalize_f32x3 (riscv_vec_f32x3_t * dst, riscv_vec_f32x3_t * src, uint32_t count)

Parameters are described as follows:

[in] src

Pointer to the input vector

[in] count

Number of elements to be processed. Each element has a data type of riscv_vec_f32x3_t.

RISCV_VEC_OK

int riscv_vec_normalize_f32x4 (riscv_vec_f32x4_t * dst, riscv_vec_f32x4_t * src, uint32_t count)

[in] src

Pointer to the input vector

[in] count

Number of elements to be processed. Each element has a data type of riscv_vec_f32x4_t.
Returns

RISCV_VEC_OK

Vector Negate Functions

These functions negate the elements of a source vector and store the results one-by-one in a destination vector. The behavior can be defined as follows:

\[ \begin{aligned} & \mathtt{for \ (n = 0; \, \, n < size; \, \, n++)} \\ & \quad \quad \mathtt{dst[n] = -src[n];} \end{aligned} \]

riscv_vec_neg_f32

Declaration
int riscv_vec_neg_f32 (float32_t * dst, float32_t * src, uint32_t count)
Description

Vector negate function for F32.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[out] dst

Pointer to the output vector

[in] src

Pointer to the input vector

[in] count

Number of elements to be processed
Returns

RISCV_VEC_OK

Example
#define count    3
float32_t src[count] = {0.1, 0.2, 0.3};
float32_t dst[count];
riscv_vec_neg_f32 (dst, src, count);

This example also serves as a reference for examples of F16, F64, Q15, Q31, and Q7 vector negate functions.

riscv_vec_neg_f16

Declaration
int riscv_vec_neg_f16 (float16_t * dst, float16_t * src, uint32_t count)
Description

Vector negate function for F16.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[out] dst

Pointer to the output vector

[in] src

Pointer to the input vector

[in] count

Number of elements to be processed
Returns

RISCV_VEC_OK

Note

This function is supported only by toolchains that support hard-float. Additionally, you must apply the -mzfh option in both compiler and linker flags when using this function. For details about the -mzfh linking option, see Linking Options for Newlib and MCUlib Toolchains or Linking Options for Glibc Toolchains.

[in] src

Returns

RISCV_VEC_OK

Note

This function is supported only by toolchains that support hard-float. Additionally, you must apply the -mext-bf16min option in both compiler and linker flags when using this function. For details about the -mext-bf16min linking option, see Linking Options for Newlib and MCUlib Toolchains or Linking Options for Glibc Toolchains.

[in] count

Number of elements to be processed
Returns

RISCV_VEC_OK

Vector Shift Functions

These functions shift each element in a source vector by a constant shift value and store the results one-by-one in a destination vector.

A positive shift value moves elements to the left, while a negative shift value moves them to the right.

The behavior can be defined as follows:

\[ \begin{aligned} & \mathtt{for \ (n = 0; \, \, n < size; \, \, n++)} \\ & \mathtt{\{} \\ & \quad \mathtt{if \ (shift < 0)} \\ & \quad \quad \mathtt{dst[n] = src[n] \, >> \, (-shift);} \\ & \quad \mathtt{else} \\ & \quad \quad \mathtt{dst[n] = src[n] \, << \, (shift);} \\ & \mathtt{\}} \end{aligned} \]

riscv_vec_shift_q31

Declaration
int riscv_vec_shift_q31 (q31_t * dst, q31_t * src, int8_t shift, uint32_t count)
Description

Vector shift function for Q31.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[out] dst

Pointer to the output vector

[in] src

Pointer to the input vector

[in] shift

Signed shift value

[in] count

Number of elements to be processed
Returns

RISCV_VEC_OK

Example
#define count    3
Q31_t src[count] = {...};
q31_t dst[count];
int8_t shift = 1;
riscv_vec_shift_q31 (dst, src, shift, count);

This example also serves as a reference for examples of Q15, Q7, and U8 vector shift functions.

riscv_vec_shift_q15

Declaration
int riscv_vec_shift_q15 (q15_t * dst, q15_t * src, int8_t shift, uint32_t count)
Description

Vector shift function for Q15.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[out] dst

Pointer to the output vector

[in] src

Pointer to the input vector

[in] shift

Signed shift value

[in] count

Number of elements to be processed
Returns

RISCV_VEC_OK

[in] count

Returns

RISCV_VEC_OK

riscv_vec_shift_u8

int riscv_vec_shift_u8 (u8_t * dst, u8_t * src, int8_t shift, uint32_t count)

Bitwise AND Functions

These functions compute the logical bitwise AND values of elements in separate source vectors and store the results one-by-one in a destination vector.

Declaration
int riscv_vec_and_u32 (u32_t * dst, u32_t * src1, u32_t * src2, uint32_t count)
Description

Bitwise AND function for U32.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[out] dst

Pointer to the output vector

[in] src1

Pointer to the first input vector

[in] src2

Pointer to the second input vector

[in] count

Number of elements to be processed
Returns

RISCV_VEC_OK

Declaration
int riscv_vec_and_u16 (u16_t * dst, u16_t * src1, u16_t * src2, uint32_t count)

Elementwise Clipping Functions

These functions constrain the values of elements in a source vector to be within two bounds and store the results one-by-one in a destination vector.

riscv_vec_clip_f32

Declaration
int riscv_vec_clip_f32 (float32_t * dst, float32_t * src, float32_t low, float32_t high, uint32_t count)
Description

Elementwise clip function for F32.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[out] dst

Pointer to the output vector

[in] src

Pointer to the input vector

[in] low

Lower bound

[in] high

Higher bound

[in] count

Number of elements to be processed
Returns

RISCV_VEC_OK

riscv_vec_clip_f16

Declaration
int riscv_vec_clip_f16 (float16_t * dst, float16_t * src, float16_t low, float16_t high, uint32_t count)
Description

Elementwise clipping function for F16.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[out] dst

Pointer to the output vector

[in] src

Pointer to the input vector

[in] low

Lower bound

[in] high

Higher bound

[in] count

Number of elements to be processed
Returns

RISCV_VEC_OK

Note

This function is supported only by toolchains that support hard-float. Additionally, you must apply the -mzfh option in both compiler and linker flags when using this function. For details about the -mzfh linking option, see Linking Options for Newlib and MCUlib Toolchains or Linking Options for Glibc Toolchains.

riscv_vec_clip_bf16

Declaration
int riscv_vec_clip_bf16 (bf16_t * dst, bf16_t * src, bf16_t low, bf16_t high, uint32_t count)
Description

Elementwise clipping function for BF16.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[out] dst

Pointer to the output vector

[in] src

Pointer to the input vector

[in] low

Lower bound

[in] high

Higher bound

[in] count

Number of elements to be processed
Returns

RISCV_VEC_OK

Note

This function is supported only by toolchains that support hard-float. Additionally, you must apply the -mext-bf16min option in both compiler and linker flags when using this function. For details about the -mext-bf16min linking option, see Linking Options for Newlib and MCUlib Toolchains or Linking Options for Glibc Toolchains.

Vector Absolute Difference Functions

These functions compute the absolute difference values of elements in a source vector and store the results one-by-one in a destination vector.

riscv_vec_absdiff_f32

Declaration
void riscv_vec_absdiff_f32 (float32_t * src1, float32_t * src2, float32_t * dst, uint32_t size)
Description

Vector absolute difference function for F32.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in] src1

Pointer to the input first vector

[in] src2

Pointer to the input second vector

[out] dst

Pointer to the output vector

[in] size

Number of elements in the vector
Returns

None

Vector Fixed-Point Division Functions

These functions divide a numerator by a denominator to get a quotient normalized between -1.0 and 1.0. Additionally, a shift left value is output to obtain the unnormalized quotient.

riscv_vec_divide_q31

Declaration
void riscv_vec_divide_q31 (q31_t * numerator, q31_t * denominator, q31_t * quotient, int16_t * shift, uint32_t size)
Description

Vector fixed-point division function for Q31.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in] numerator

Pointer to the input numerator vector

[in] denominator

Pointer to the input denominator vector

[out] quotient

Pointer to the output quotient vector

[out] shift

Pointer to the output shift vector

[in] size

Number of elements in a vector
Returns

None

riscv_vec_divide_q15

Declaration
void riscv_vec_divide_q15 (q15_t * numerator, q15_t * denominator, q15_t * quotient, int16_t * shift, uint32_t size)
Description

Vector fixed-point division function for Q15.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in] numerator

Pointer to the input numerator vector

[in] denominator

Pointer to the input denominator vector

[out] quotient

Pointer to the output quotient vector

[out] shift

Pointer to the output shift vector

[in] size

Number of elements in a vector
Returns

None

Filtering Functions

This section includes the following filtering functions.

Finite Impulse Response (FIR) Filter Functions

These functions can be presented by the following equation:

\[ \mathtt{dst[n] = \sum_{k=0}^{Size} \left( b[k] * src[n-k] \right)} \]

where \(\mathtt{b[k]}\) is the filter coefficient and \(\mathtt{Size}\) is the number of filter coefficients.

VEC Library supports distinct functions and instance structures for the following data types: F32, F16, F64, Q15, Q31, and Q7.

Ensure that you initialize the corresponding instance structures before using the FIR filter functions.

These functions and their instance structures are described in the subsections below.

riscv_vec_fir_f32

Declaration
void riscv_vec_fir_f32 (const riscv_vec_fir_f32_t * instance, float32_t * src, float32_t * dst, uint32_t size)
Description

FIR filter function for F32.

Data Structure and Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

riscv_vec_fir_f32_t

Instance structure of the F32 FIR filter, defined as follows:

typedef struct {
    uint32_t coeff_size;
    float32_t * state;
    float32_t * coeff;
} riscv_vec_fir_f32_t;

where:

coeff_size

Number of coefficients

state

Pointer to the state vector whose size is coeff_size + size - 1

coeff

Pointer to the time reversed coefficient vector whose size is coeff_size

[in] instance

Pointer to the instance structure

[in] src

Pointer to the input vector

[out] dst

Pointer to the output vector

[in] size

Number of samples
Example
#define coeff_size    4
#define size          6
float32_t state[coeff_size + size - 1];
float32_t coeff[coeff_size] = {0.3, -0.1, 0.4, 0.5};
riscv_vec_fir_f32_t instance = {coeff_size, state, coeff};
float32_t src[size] = {0.1, -0.2, 0.2, 0.3, 0.4, 0.1};
float32_t dst[size];
riscv_vec_fir_f32 (&instance, src, dst, size);

This example also serves as a reference for examples of F16, F64, Q15, Q31, and Q7 FIR filter functions.

riscv_vec_fir_f16

Declaration
void riscv_vec_fir_f16 (const riscv_vec_fir_f16_t * instance, float16_t * src, float16_t * dst, uint32_t size)
Description

FIR filter function for F16.

Data Structure and Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

riscv_vec_fir_f16_t

Instance structure of the F16 FIR filter, defined as follows:

typedef struct {
    uint32_t coeff_size;
    float16_t * state;
    float16_t * coeff;
} riscv_vec_fir_f16_t;

where:

coeff_size

Number of coefficients

state

Pointer to the state vector whose size is coeff_size + size - 1

coeff

Pointer to the time reversed coefficient vector whose size is coeff_size

[in] instance

Pointer to the instance structure

[in] src

Pointer to the input vector

[out] dst

Pointer to the output vector

[in] size

Number of samples
Note

This function is supported only by toolchains that support hard-float. Additionally, you must apply the -mzfh option in both compiler and linker flags when using this function. For details about the -mzfh linking option, see Linking Options for Newlib and MCUlib Toolchains or Linking Options for Glibc Toolchains.

    q7_t * state;
    q7_t * coeff;
