riscv_vec_cfir_q31

Declaration
void riscv_vec_cfir_q31 (const riscv_vec_cfir_q31_t * instance, q31_t * src, q31_t * dst, uint32_t size)
Description

Complex FIR filter function for Q31.

Data Structure and Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

riscv_vec_cfir_q31_t

Instance structure of the complex Q31 FIR filter, defined as follows:

 typedef struct {
    uint32_t coeff_size;
    q31_t * state;
    q31_t * coeff;
} riscv_vec_cfir_q31_t;

where:

coeff_size

Number of coefficients

state

Pointer to the state vector whose size is 2 * coeff_size + size - 1

coeff

Pointer to the time reversed coefficient vector whose size is
2 * coeff_size

[in] instance

Pointer to the instance structure

[in] src

Pointer to the input complex vector

[out] dst

Pointer to the output complex vector

[in] size

Number of samples

Least Mean Square (LMS) Filter Functions

These functions are adaptive filters that perform the following equations to update coefficients and minimize the mean square error:

\[ \begin{aligned} \mathtt{y[n]} & = \mathtt{h[0] * x[n] + h[1] * x[n - 1] + \dots + h[L - 1] * y[n - L + 1]} ;\\ \mathtt{e[n]} & = \mathtt{d[n] - y[n]} ;\\ \mathtt{h[k]} & = \mathtt{h[k - 1] + \mu * e[n] * x[n - k]} ; \end{aligned} \]

where:

  • y is the output vector

  • h is the coefficients vector

  • x is the input vector

  • L is the filter order

  • e is the error vector

  • d is the desired vector

  • \(\mathtt{\mu}\) is the step size, which can adjust coefficients

VEC Library supports distinct functions and instance structures for the following data types: F32, Q15, and Q31.

Ensure that you initialize the corresponding instance structures before using the LMS filter functions. The functions and their instance structures are described in the subsections below.

riscv_vec_lms_f32

Declaration
void riscv_vec_lms_f32 (const riscv_vec_lms_f32_t * instance, float32_t * src, float32_t * ref, float32_t * dst, float32_t * err, uint32_t size)
Description

LMS filter function for F32.

Data Structure and Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

riscv_vec_lms_f32_t

Instance structure of the F32 LMS filter, defined as follows:

typedef struct {
    uint32_t coeff_size;
    float32_t * state;
    float32_t * coeff;
    float32_t mu;
} riscv_vec_lms_f32_t;

where:

coeff_size

Number of filter coefficients

state

Pointer to the state vector whose size is coeff_size + size - 1

coeff

Pointer to the time reversed coefficient vector whose size is coeff_size

mu

Step size that can adjust coefficients

[in] instance

Pointer to the instance structure

[in] src

Pointer to the input vector

[in] ref

Pointer to the desired vector

[out] dst

Pointer to the output vector

[out] err

Pointer to the error vector

[in] size

Number of samples
Example
#define coeff_size    5
#define size          6
#define mu            0.05
float32_t state[coeff_size + size - 1] = {0.0};
float32_t coeff[coeff_size] = {0.40, 0.10, 0.24, -0.40, -0.34};
float32_t src[size] = {1.0, 0.5, 0.4, -0.1, -0.1, 0.3};
float32_t ref[size] = {0.1, 0.2, -0.1, -0.02, -0.1, 0.2};
float32_t err[size];
float32_t dst[size];

riscv_vec_lms_f32_t instance = {coeff_size, state, coeff, mu};
riscv_vec_lms_f32 (&instance, src, ref, dst, err, size);

This example also serves as a reference for examples of Q15 and Q31 LMS filter functions.

riscv_vec_lms_q31

Declaration
void riscv_vec_lms_q31 (const riscv_vec_lms_q31_t * instance, q31_t * src, q31_t * ref, q31_t * dst, q31_t * err, uint32_t size)
Description

LMS filter function for Q31.

Data Structure and Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

riscv_vec_lms_q31_t

Instance structure of the Q31 LMS filter, defined as follows:

typedef struct {
    uint32_t coeff_size;
    q31_t * state;
    q31_t * coeff;
    q31_t mu;
    q31_t shift;
} riscv_vec_lms_q31_t;

where:

coeff_size

Number of filter coefficients

state

Pointer to the state vector whose size is coeff_size + size - 1

coeff

Pointer to the time reversed coefficient vector whose size is coeff_size

mu

Step size that can adjust coefficients

shift

Shift bits

[in] instance

Pointer to the instance structure

[in] src

Pointer to the input vector

[in] ref

Pointer to the desired vector

[out] dst

Pointer to the output vector

[out] err

Pointer to the error vector

[in] size

Number of samples

riscv_vec_lms_q15

Declaration
void riscv_vec_lms_q15 (const riscv_vec_lms_q15_t * instance, q15_t * src, q15_t * ref, q15_t * dst, q15_t * err, uint32_t size)
Description

LMS filter function for Q15.

Data Structure and Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

riscv_vec_lms_q15_t

Instance structure of the Q15 LMS filter, defined as follows:

typedef struct {
    uint32_t coeff_size;
    q15_t * state;
    q15_t * coeff;
    q15_t mu;
    q15_t shift;
} riscv_vec_lms_q15_t;

where:

coeff_size

Number of filter coefficients

state

Pointer to the state vector whose size is coeff_size + size - 1

coeff

Pointer to the time reversed coefficient vector whose size is coeff_size

mu

Step size that can adjust coefficients

shift

Shift bits

[in] instance

Pointer to the instance structure

[in] src

Pointer to the input vector

[in] ref

Pointer to the desired vector

[out] dst

Pointer to the output vector

[out] err

Pointer to the error vector

[in] size

Number of samples

Normalized Least Mean Square (NLMS) Filter Functions

These functions are extensions of LMS filter functions. They can be represented by the following equations:

\[ \begin{aligned} \mathtt{y[n]} & = \mathtt{h[0] * x[n] + h[1] * x[n - 1] + \dots + h[L - 1] * y[n - L + 1]} ;\\ \mathtt{e[n]} & = \mathtt{d[n] - y[n]} ;\\ \mathtt{\mu[n]} & = \mathtt{1 / x[n]^2} ;\\ \mathtt{h[n]} & = \mathtt{h[h - 1] + \mu[n] * e[n] * x[n]} ; \end{aligned} \]

where:

  • y is the output vector

  • h is the coefficients vector

  • x is the input vector

  • L is the filter order

  • e is the error vector

  • d is the desired vector

  • \(\mathtt{\mu}\) is the step size, which can adjust coefficients and is related to the normalized input signals

VEC Library supports distinct functions and instance structures for the following data types: F32, Q15, and Q31.

Ensure that you initialize the corresponding instance structures before using the NLMS filter functions. The functions and their instance structures are described in the subsections below.

riscv_vec_nlms_f32

Declaration
void riscv_vec_nlms_f32 (riscv_vec_nlms_f32_t * instance, float32_t * src, float32_t * ref, float32_t * dst, float32_t * err, uint32_t size)
Description

NLMS filter function for F32.

Data Structure and Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

riscv_vec_nlms_f32_t

Instance structure of the F32 NLMS filter, defined as follows:

typedef struct {
    uint32_t coeff_size;
    float32_t * state;
    float32_t * coeff;
    float32_t mu;
    float32_t energy;
} riscv_vec_nlms_f32_t;

where:

coeff_size

Number of filter coefficients

state

Pointer to the state vector whose size is coeff_size + size - 1

coeff

Pointer to the time reversed coefficient vector whose size is coeff_size

mu

Step size that can adjust coefficients

energy

Energy of the previous frame

[in] instance

Pointer to the instance structure

[in] src

Pointer to the input vector

[in] ref

Pointer to the desired vector

[out] dst

Pointer to the output vector

[out] err

Pointer to the error vector

[in] size

Number of samples
Example
#define coeff_size    5
#define size          6
#define mu            0.05
#define energy        0.1
float32_t state[coeff_size + size - 1] = {0.0};
float32_t coeff[coeff_size] = {0.40, 0.10, 0.24, -0.40, -0.34};
float32_t src[size] = {1.0, 0.5, 0.4, -0.1, -0.1, 0.3};
float32_t ref[size] = {0.1, 0.2, -0.1, -0.02, -0.1, 0.2};
float32_t err[size];
float32_t dst[size];

riscv_vec_nlms_f32_t instance = {coeff_size, state, coeff, mu, energy};
riscv_vec_nlms_f32 (&instance, src, ref, dst, err, size);

This example also serves as a reference for examples of Q15 and Q31 NLMS filter functions.

riscv_vec_nlms_q31

Declaration
void riscv_vec_nlms_q31 (riscv_vec_nlms_q31_t * instance, q31_t * src, q31_t * ref, q31_t * dst, q31_t * err, uint32_t size)
Description

NLMS filter function for Q31.

Data Structure and Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

riscv_vec_nlms_q31_t

Instance structure of the Q31 NLMS filter, defined as follows:

typedef struct {
    uint32_t coeff_size;
    q31_t * state;
    q31_t * coeff;
    q31_t mu;
    uint8_t postshift;
    q31_t energy;
    q31_t x0;
} riscv_vec_nlms_q31_t;

where:

coeff_size

Number of filter coefficients

state

Pointer to the state vector whose size is coeff_size + size - 1

coeff

Pointer to the time reversed coefficient vector whose size is coeff_size

mu

Step size that can adjust coefficients

postshift

Shift bits

energy

Energy of the previous frame

x0

Previous input sample

[in] instance

Pointer to the instance structure

[in] src

Pointer to the input vector

[in] ref

Pointer to the desired vector

[out] dst

Pointer to the output vector

[out] err

Pointer to the error vector

[in] size

Number of samples

riscv_vec_nlms_q15

Declaration
void riscv_vec_nlms_q15 (riscv_vec_nlms_q15_t * instance, q15_t * src, q15_t * ref, q15_t * dst, q15_t * err, uint32_t size)
Description

NLMS filter function for Q15.

Data Structure and Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

riscv_vec_nlms_q15_t

Instance structure of the Q15 NLMS filter, defined as follows:

typedef struct {
    uint32_t coeff_size;
    q15_t * state;
    q15_t * coeff;
    q15_t mu;
    uint8_t postshift;
    q15_t energy;
    q15_t x0;
} riscv_vec_nlms_q15_t;

where:

coeff_size

Number of filter coefficients

state

Pointer to the state vector whose size is coeff_size + size - 1

coeff

Pointer to the time reversed coefficient vector whose size is coeff_size

mu

Step size that can adjust coefficients

postshift

Shift bits

energy

Energy of the previous frame

x0

Previous input sample

[in] instance

Pointer to the instance structure

[in] src

Pointer to the input vector

[in] ref

Pointer to the desired vector

[out] dst

Pointer to the output vector

[out] err

Pointer to the error vector

[in] size

Number of samples

Correlation Functions

These functions use two signals to form another signal (also called cross-correlation) mathematically. The mathematical operations of correlation functions are similar to those of convolution functions and can be presented as follows:

\[ \mathtt{dst[n] = \sum_{k=0}^{len1} \left( src1[k] * src2[k - n] \right)} \]

where \(\mathtt{src1}\) and \(\mathtt{src2}\) are input vectors, and their lengths are \(\mathtt{len1}\) and \(\mathtt{len2}\) separately; \(\mathtt{dst}\) is the output vector and its size is \(\mathtt{2 * max (len1, len2) - 1}\).

If the function only calculates with one input signal it is also called auto-correlation which the function can be presented as:

\[ \mathtt{dst[n] = \sum_{k=0}^{len1} \left( src1[k] * src2[k - n] \right)} \]

VEC Library supports distinct functions for the following data types: F32, F16, F64, Q15, Q31, and Q7. These functions are described in the subsections below.

riscv_vec_corr_f32

Declaration
void riscv_vec_corr_f32 (float32_t * src1, uint32_t len1, float32_t * src2, uint32_t len2, float32_t * dst)
Description

Correlation function for F32.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in] src1

Pointer to the first input vector

[in] len1

Length of the first input vector

[in] src2

Pointer to the second input vector

[in] len2

Length of the second input vector

[out] dst

Pointer to the output vector
Example
#define len1    7
#define len2    5
float32_t src1[len1] = {0.3, 0.2, -0.1, 0.2, 0.4, 0.2, -0.1};
float32_t src2[len2] = {-0.1, 0.3, 0.2, -0.2, -0.2};
float32_t dst[2 * len1 - 1];
riscv_vec_corr_f32 (src1, len1, src2, len2, dst);

This example also serves as a reference for examples of F16, F64, Q15, Q31, and Q7 correlation functions.

riscv_vec_corr_f16

Declaration
void riscv_vec_corr_f16 (float16_t * src1, uint32_t len1, float16_t * src2, uint32_t len2, float16_t * dst)
Description

Correlation function for F16.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in] src1

Pointer to the first input vector

[in] len1

Length of the first input vector

[in] src2

Pointer to the second input vector

[in] len2

Length of the second input vector

[out] dst

Pointer to the output vector
Note

This function is supported only by toolchains that support hard-float. Additionally, you must apply the -mzfh option in both compiler and linker flags when using this function. For details about the -mzfh linking option, see Linking Options for Newlib and MCUlib Toolchains or Linking Options for Glibc Toolchains.

riscv_vec_corr_f64

Declaration
void riscv_vec_corr_f64 (float64_t * src1, uint32_t len1, float64_t * src2, uint32_t len2, float64_t * dst)

Correlation function for F64.

[in] src1

Pointer to the first input vector

[in] len1

Length of the first input vector

[in] src2

Pointer to the second input vector

[in] len2

Length of the second input vector

[out] dst

Pointer to the output vector

riscv_vec_corr_q31

[out] dst

Description

Correlation function for Q7.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Pointer to the first input vector

[in] len1

Length of the first input vector

[in] src2

Pointer to the second input vector

[in] len2

Length of the second input vector

[out] dst

Pointer to the output vector

riscv_vec_autocorr_f32

Declaration
void riscv_vec_autocorr_f32 (float32_t * src, uint32_t len, float32_t * dst)
Description

Auto-correlation function for F32.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in] src

Pointer to the input vector

[in] len

Length of the input vector

[out] dst

Pointer to the output vector

Decimation FIR Filter Functions

These functions implement FIR filters with decimation by an integer factor \(\mathtt{M}\). They can be presented by the following equation:

\[ \mathtt{dst[n] = \sum_{k=0}^{Size} \left( b[k] * src[n - k] \right)} \]

where \(\mathtt{b[k]}\) is the filter coefficient, \(\mathtt{src}\) is the input data of the length \(\mathtt{Size}\), and \(\mathtt{dst}\) is the output data of the length \(\mathtt{Size/M}\). Additionally, \(\mathtt{Size}\) must be a multiple of the decimation factor M so that the number of output samples can be an integer.

VEC Library supports decimation FIR filter functions and instance structures for the following data types: F32, Q15, and Q31.

Ensure that you initialize the corresponding instance structures before using the decimation FIR filter functions.

The functions and their instance structures are described in the subsection below.

riscv_vec_dcmfir_f32

Declaration
void riscv_vec_dcmfir_f32 (const riscv_vec_dcmfir_f32_t * instance, float32_t * src, float32_t * dst, uint32_t size)
Description

Decimation FIR filter function for F32.

Data Structure and Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

riscv_vec_dcmfir_f32_t

Instance structure of the F32 decimation FIR filter, defined as follows:

typedef struct {
    uint32_t M;
    uint32_t coeff_size;
    float32_t * coeff;
    float32_t * state;
} riscv_vec_dcmfir_f32_t;

where:

M

Decimation factor

coeff_size

Number of coefficients

coeff

Pointer to the time reversed coefficient vector whose size is coeff_size

state

Pointer to the state vector whose size is coeff_size + size - 1

[in] instance

Pointer to the instance structure

[in] src

Pointer to the input vector

[out] dst

Pointer to the output vector

[in] size

Number of samples
Example

Given an input size of 24, a decimation factor M of 4, and a filter coefficient size of 6, set the instance of the decimation FIR filter as follows:

#define size          24
#define M             4
#define coeff_size    6
float32_t coeff[coeff_size] = {...};
float32_t state[coeff_size + size - 1];
riscv_vec_dcmfir_f32_t instance = {M, coeff_size, coeff, state};
float32_t src[size] = {0.1, -0.2, 0.2, 0.3, 0.4, 0.1, ...};
float32_t dst[size / M];
riscv_vec_dcmfir_f32 (&instance, src, dst, size);

This example also serves as a reference for examples of Q15 and Q31 decimation FIR filter functions.

riscv_vec_dcmfir_q31

Declaration
void riscv_vec_dcmfir_q31 (const riscv_vec_dcmfir_q31_t * instance, q31_t * src, q31_t * dst, uint32_t size)
Description

Decimation FIR filter function for Q31.

Data Structure and Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

riscv_vec_dcmfir_q31_t

instance structure of the Q31 decimation FIR filter, defined as follows:

typedef struct {
    uint32_t M;
    uint32_t coeff_size;
    q31_t * coeff;
    q31_t * state;
} riscv_vec_dcmfir_q31_t;

where:

M

Decimation factor

coeff_size

Number of coefficients

coeff

Pointer to the time reversed coefficient vector whose size is coeff_size

state

Pointer to the state vector whose size is coeff_size + size - 1

[in] instance

Pointer to the instance structure

[in] src

Pointer to the input vector

[out] dst

Pointer to the output vector

[in] size

Number of samples

riscv_vec_dcmfir_q15

Declaration
void riscv_vec_dcmfir_q15 (const riscv_vec_dcmfir_q15_t * instance, q15_t * src, q15_t * dst, uint32_t size)
Description

Decimation FIR filter function for Q15.

Data Structure and Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

riscv_vec_dcmfir_q15_t

Instance structure of the Q15 decimation FIR filter, defined as follows:

typedef struct {
    uint32_t M;
    uint32_t coeff_size;
    q15_t * coeff;
    q15_t * state;
} riscv_vec_dcmfir_q15_t;

where:

M

Decimation factor

coeff_size

Number of coefficients

coeff

Pointer to the time reversed coefficient vector whose size is coeff_size

state

Pointer to the state vector whose size is coeff_size + size - 1

[in] instance

Pointer to the instance structure

[in] src

Pointer to the input vector

[out] dst

Pointer to the output vector

[in] size

Number of samples

Upsampling FIR Filter Functions

These functions upsample incoming signals to generate multirate outputs. They are usually used in audio/sound or images processing, such as increasing the resolution of images or adjusting the audio output sample rate from 16kbps to 32kbps.

VEC Library supports distinct functions and instance structures for the following data types: F32, Q15, and Q31.

Ensure that you initialize the corresponding instance structures before using the upsampling filter functions. The functions and their instance structures are described in the subsections below.

riscv_vec_upsplfir_f32

Declaration
void riscv_vec_upsplfir_f32 (const riscv_vec_upsplfir_f32_t * instance, float32_t * src, float32_t * dst, uint32_t size)
Description

Upsampling FIR filter function for F32.

Data Structure and Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

riscv_vec_upsplfir_f32_t

instance structure of the F32 upsampling FIR filter, defined as follows:

typedef struct {
    uint32_t L;
    uint32_t plen;
    float32_t * coeff;
    float32_t * state;
} riscv_vec_upsplfir_f32_t;

where:

L

Upsampling factor

plen

Number of coefficients

coeff

Pointer to the time reversed coefficient vector whose size is L * plen

state

Pointer to the state vector whose size is plen + size - 1

[in] instance

Pointer to the instance structure

[in] src

Pointer to the input vector

[out] dst

Pointer to the output vector

[in] size

Number of samples
Example
#define L       2
#define plen    4
#define size    6
float32_t state[plen + size - 1] = {0.0};
float32_t coeff[L * plen] = {0.40, 0.10, 0.24, -0.40, 1.0, 0.5, 0.4, -0.1};
float32_t src[size] = {1.0, 0.5, 0.4, -0.1, -0.1, 0.3};
float32_t dst[size * L];
riscv_vec_upsplfir_f32_t instance = {L, plen, state, coeff};
riscv_vec_upsplfir_f32 (&instance, src, dst, size);

This example also serves as a reference for examples of Q15 and Q31 upsampling FIR filter functions.

riscv_vec_upsplfir_q31

Declaration
void riscv_vec_upsplfir_q31 (const riscv_vec_upsplfir_q31_t * instance, q31_t * src, q31_t * dst, uint32_t size)
Description

Upsampling FIR filter function for Q31.

Data Structure and Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

riscv_vec_upsplfir_q31_t

Instance structure of the Q31 upsampling FIR filter, defined as follows:

typedef struct {
    uint32_t L;
    uint32_t plen;
    q31_t * coeff;
    q31_t * state;
} riscv_vec_upsplfir_q31_t;

where:

L

Upsampling factor

plen

Number of coefficients

coeff

Pointer to the time reversed coefficient vector whose size is L * plen

state

Pointer to the state vector whose size is plen + size - 1

[in] instance

Pointer to the instance structure

[in] src

Pointer to the input vector

[out] dst

Pointer to the output vector

[in] size

Number of samples

riscv_vec_upsplfir_q15

Declaration
void riscv_vec_upsplfir_q15 (const riscv_vec_upsplfir_q15_t * instance, q15_t * src, q15_t * dst, uint32_t size)
Description

Upsampling FIR filter function for Q15.

Data Structure and Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

riscv_vec_upsplfir_q15_t

Instance structure of the Q15 upsampling FIR filter, defined as follows:

typedef struct {
    uint32_t L;
    uint32_t plen;
    q15_t * coeff;
    q15_t * state;
} riscv_vec_upsplfir_q15_t;

where:

L

Upsampling factor

plen

Number of coefficients

coeff

Pointer to the time reversed coefficient vector whose size is L * plen

state

Pointer to the state vector whose size is plen + size - 1

[in] instance

Pointer to the instance structure

[in] src

Pointer to the input vector

[out] dst

Pointer to the output vector

[in] size

Number of samples

Lattice FIR Filter Functions

These functions can be represented by the following equations:

\[ \begin{aligned} \mathtt{y_{\scriptscriptstyle{0}}[n]} & = \mathtt{u_{\scriptscriptstyle{0}}[n]} = \mathtt{x[n]} \\ \mathtt{y_{\scriptscriptstyle{z}}[n]} & = \mathtt{y_{\scriptscriptstyle{{z-1}}}[n]} + \mathtt{k_{\scriptscriptstyle{z}} u_{\scriptscriptstyle{{z-1}}}[n-1]} \\ \mathtt{u_{\scriptscriptstyle{z}}[n]} & = \mathtt{k_{\scriptscriptstyle{z}} y_{\scriptscriptstyle{{z-1}}}[n]} + \mathtt{u_{\scriptscriptstyle{{z-1}}}[n-1]} \end{aligned} \]

where \(\mathtt{x}\) is the input, \(\mathtt{y}\) is the output, \(\mathtt{u}\) represents the state of previous inputs, \(\mathtt{0 \leq z < M}\) (with \(\mathtt{M}\) as the stage number), and \(\mathtt{k_{\scriptscriptstyle{z}}}\) denotes the reflection coefficients.

VEC Library supports distinct functions and instance structures for the following data types: F32, Q15, and Q31. Ensure that you initialize the corresponding instance structures before using the lattice FIR filter functions. The functions and their instance structures are described in the subsections below.

riscv_vec_lfir_f32

Declaration
void riscv_vec_lfir_f32 (const riscv_vec_lfir_f32_t * instance, float32_t * src, float32_t * dst, uint32_t size)
Description

Lattice FIR filter function for F32.

Data Structure and Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

riscv_vec_lfir_f32_t

Instance structure of the F32 lattice FIR filter, defined as follows:

typedef struct {
    uint32_t stage;
    float32_t * state;
    float32_t * coeff;
} riscv_vec_lfir_f32_t;

where:

stage

Number of filter stages

state

Pointer to the state vector whose size is stage

coeff

Pointer to the time reversed coefficient vector whose size is stage

[in] instance

Pointer to the instance structure

[in] src

Pointer to the input vector

[out] dst

Pointer to the output vector

[in] size

Number of samples
Example

Given a filter length of 6 and an input size of 8, set the instance of the lattice FIR filter as follows:

#define M       6
#define size    8
float32_t state[M];
float32_t coeff[M] = {...};
float32_t src[size] = {...};
float32_t dst[size];
riscv_vec_lfir_f32_t instance = {M, state, coeff};
riscv_vec_lfir_f32 (&instance, src, dst, size);

This example also serves as a reference for examples of Q15 and Q31 lattice FIR filter functions.

riscv_vec_lfir_q31

Declaration
void riscv_vec_lfir_q31 (const riscv_vec_lfir_q31_t * instance, q31_t * src, q31_t * dst, uint32_t size)
Description

Lattice FIR filter function for Q31.

Data Structure and Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

riscv_vec_lfir_q31_t

Instance structure of the Q31 lattice FIR filter, defined as follows:

typedef struct {
    uint32_t stage;
    q31_t * state;
    q31_t * coeff;
} riscv_vec_lfir_q31_t;

where:

stage

Number of filter stages

state

Pointer to the state vector whose size is stage

coeff

[in] instance

[in] src

[out] dst

[in] size

Number of samples

riscv_vec_lfir_q15

void riscv_vec_lfir_q15 (const riscv_vec_lfir_q15_t * instance, q15_t * src, q15_t * dst, uint32_t size)

Instance structure of the Q15 lattice FIR filter, defined as follows:

typedef struct {
    uint32_t stage;
    q15_t * state;
    q15_t * coeff;

where:

coeff

[in] instance

Pointer to the instance structure

[in] src

Pointer to the input vector

[out] dst

Pointer to the output vector

[in] size

Number of samples

Sparse FIR Filter Functions

These functions are FIR filters in which most coefficients are zero. Because of this, sparse FIR filters retain only the non-zero coefficients and skip the multiplication operations involving signal and zero coefficients.

VEC Library supports distinct functions and instance structures for the following data types: F32, Q15, Q31, and Q7. Ensure that you initialize the corresponding instance structures before using the sparse FIR filter functions. The functions and their instance structures are described in the subsections below.

riscv_vec_spafir_f32

Declaration
void riscv_vec_spafir_f32 (riscv_vec_spafir_f32_t * instance, float32_t * src, float32_t * dst, float32_t * buf, uint32_t size)
Description

Sparse FIR filter function for F32.

Data Structure and Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

riscv_vec_spafir_f32_t

Instance structure of the F32 sparse FIR filter, defined as follows:

typedef struct {
    uint16_t coeff_size;
    uint16_t index;
    float32_t * state;
    float32_t * coeff;
    uint16_t delay;
    int32_t * nezdelay;
} riscv_vec_spafir_f32_t;

where:

coeff_size

Number of filter coefficients

index

Index of the state buffer

state

Pointer to the state vector whose size is delay + size

coeff

Pointer to the coefficient vector whose size is coeff_size

delay

Maximum value in the nezdelay vector

nezdelay

Vector that stores non-zero coefficients and the size is coeff_size

[in] instance

Pointer to the instance structure

[in] src

Pointer to the input vector

[out] dst

Pointer to the output vector

[in] buf

Pointer to the temporary vector

[in] size

Number of samples
Note

The size of the temporary buffer should be equal to size, which represents the size of the input vector.

Example

The following formula represents the example:

\[ \begin{aligned} \mathtt{y(n)} & = \mathtt{coeff(0) * x(n - nezdelay(0))} + \mathtt{coeff(1) * x(n - ne2delay(1))} \, + \\ & \quad \, \, \mathtt{coeff(2) * x(n - nezdelay(2))} + \mathtt{coeff(3) * x(n - nezdelay(3))} \end{aligned} \]

 

#define coeff_size    4
#define index         1
#define size          6
int32_t nezdelay[coeff_size] = {3, 0, 2, 1}
#define delay         3

float32_t state[delay + size] = {0.0};
float32_t coeff[coeff_size] = {0.40, 0.10, 0.24, -0.40};
float32_t src[size] = {1.0, 0.5, 0.4, -0.1, -0.1, 0.3};
float32_t buf[size];
float32_t dst[size];

riscv_vec_spafir_f32_t instance = {coeff_size, index, state, coeff, delay, nezdelay};
riscv_vec_spafir_f32(&instance, src, dst, buf, size);

This example also serves as a reference for examples of Q15, Q31, and Q7 sparse FIR filter functions.

riscv_vec_spafir_q31

Declaration
void riscv_vec_spafir_q31 (riscv_vec_spafir_q31_t * instance, q31_t * src, q31_t * dst, q31_t * buf, uint32_t size)
Description

Sparse FIR filter function for Q31.

Data Structure and Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

riscv_vec_spafir_q31_t

Instance structure of the Q31 sparse FIR filter, defined as follows:

typedef struct {
    uint16_t coeff_size;
    uint16_t index;
    q31_t * state;
    q31_t * coeff;
    uint16_t delay;
    int32_t * nezdelay;
} riscv_vec_spafir_q31_t;

where:

coeff_size

Number of filter coefficients

index

Index of the state buffer

state

Pointer to the state vector whose size is delay + size

coeff

Pointer to the coefficient vector whose size is coeff_size

delay

Maximum value in the nezdelay vector

nezdelay

Vector that stores non-zero coefficients and the size is coeff_size

[in] instance

Pointer to the instance structure

[in] src

Pointer to the input vector

[out] dst

Pointer to the output vector

[in] buf

Pointer to the temporary vector

[in] size

Number of samples

riscv_vec_spafir_q15

Declaration
void riscv_vec_spafir_q15 (riscv_vec_spafir_q15_t * instance, q15_t * src, q15_t * dst, q15_t * buf, q15_t * buf2, uint32_t size)
Description

Sparse FIR filter function for Q15.

Data Structure and Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

riscv_vec_spafir_q15_t

Instance structure of the Q15 sparse FIR filter, defined as follows:

typedef struct {
    uint16_t coeff_size;
    uint16_t index;
    q15_t * state;
    q15_t * coeff;
    uint16_t delay;
    int32_t * nezdelay;
} riscv_vec_spafir_q15_t;

where:

coeff_size

Number of filter coefficients

index

Index of the state buffer

state

Pointer to the state vector whose size is delay + size

coeff

Pointer to the coefficient vector whose size is coeff_size

delay

Maximum value in the nezdelay vector

nezdelay

Vector that stores non-zero coefficients and the size is coeff_size

[in] instance

Pointer to the instance structure

[in] src

Pointer to the input vector

[out] dst

Pointer to the output vector

[in] buf

Pointer to the temporary vector

[in] buf2

Pointer to the second temporary vector

[in] size

Number of samples

riscv_vec_spafir_q7

Declaration
void riscv_vec_spafir_q7 (riscv_vec_spafir_q7_t * instance, q7_t * src, q7_t * dst, q7_t * buf, q7_t * buf2, uint32_t size)
Description

Sparse FIR filter function for Q7.

Data Structure and Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

riscv_vec_spafir_q7_t

Instance structure of the Q7 sparse FIR filter, defined as follows:

typedef struct {
    uint16_t coeff_size;
    uint16_t index;
    q7_t * state;
    q7_t * coeff;
    uint16_t delay;
    int32_t * nezdelay;
} riscv_vec_spafir_q7_t;

where:

coeff_size

Number of filter coefficients

index

Index of the state buffer

state

Pointer to the state vector whose size is delay + size

coeff

Pointer to the coefficient vector whose size is coeff_size

delay

Maximum value in the nezdelay vector

nezdelay

Vector that stores non-zero coefficients and the size is coeff_size

[in] instance

Pointer to the instance structure

[in] src

Pointer to the input vector

[out] dst

Pointer to the output vector

[in] buf

Pointer to the temporary vector

[in] buf2

Pointer to the second temporary vector

[in] size

Number of samples

Lattice Infinite Impulse Response (IIR) Filter Functions

These functions can be represented as follows:

\[ \begin{aligned} \mathtt{y_{\scriptscriptstyle{0}}[n]} & = \mathtt{x[n]} \\ \mathtt{y_{\scriptscriptstyle{z-1}}[n]} & = \mathtt{y_{\scriptscriptstyle{z}}[n] - k_{\scriptscriptstyle{z}} * u_{\scriptscriptstyle{z-1}}[n-1]} \\ \mathtt{u_{\scriptscriptstyle{z}}[n]} & = \mathtt{k_{\scriptscriptstyle{z}}} * \mathtt{y_{\scriptscriptstyle{{z-1}}}[n]} + \mathtt{u_{\scriptscriptstyle{z-1}}[n-1]} \\ \mathtt{w[n]} & = \mathtt{v_{\scriptscriptstyle{N}} * u_{\scriptscriptstyle{N}}[n] + v_{\scriptscriptstyle{N-1}} * u_{\scriptscriptstyle{N-1}}[n] + \dots + v_{\scriptscriptstyle{0}} * u_{\scriptscriptstyle{0}}[n]} \end{aligned} \]

where \(\mathtt{N}\) is the number of states and \(\mathtt{z = N \, , \, N - 1 \, , \, \dots \, , \, 1}\), coefficients \(\mathtt{k = {\{r_{\scriptscriptstyle{N}} \, , \, r_{\scriptscriptstyle{N-1}} \, , \, \dots \, , \, r_{\scriptscriptstyle{1}}}}\}\), \(\mathtt{v_{\scriptscriptstyle{N}}}\) is the ladder coefficients, and \(\mathtt{u}\) is the state.

VEC Library supports functions and instance structures for the following data types: F32, Q15, and Q31. Ensure that you initialize the corresponding instance structures before using the lattice IIR filter functions. The functions and their instance structures are described in the subsections below.

riscv_vec_liir_f32

Declaration
void riscv_vec_liir_f32 (const riscv_vec_liir_f32_t * instance, float32_t * src, float32_t * dst, uint32_t size)
Description

Lattice IIR filter function for F32.

Data Structure and Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

riscv_vec_liir_f32_t

Instance structure of the F32 lattice IIR filter, defined as follows:

typedef struct {
    uint32_t nstage;
    float32_t * state;
    float32_t * rcoeff;
   float32_t * lcoeff;
} riscv_vec_liir_f32_t;

where:

nstage

Number of filter stages

state

Pointer to the state vector whose size is nstage + size

rcoeff

Pointer to the time reversed reflection coefficient vector whose size is nstage

lcoeff

Pointer to the time reversed ladder coefficient vector whose size is nstage + 1

[in] instance

Pointer to the instance structure

[in] src

Pointer to the input vector

[out] dst

Pointer to the output vector

[in] size

Number of samples
Example
#define size      8
#define nstage    6
float32_t state[nstage + size];
float32_t rcoeff[nstage] = {...};
float32_t lcoeff[nstage + 1] = {...};
riscv_vec_liir_f32_t instance = {nstage, state, rcoeff, lcoeff}.
float32_t src[size] = {...};
float32_t dst[size];
riscv_vec_liir_f32 (&instance, src, dst, size);

This example also serves as a reference for examples of Q15 and Q31 lattice IIR filter functions.

riscv_vec_liir_q31

Declaration
void riscv_vec_liir_q31 (const riscv_vec_liir_q31_t * instance, q31_t * src, q31_t * dst, uint32_t size)
Description

Lattice IIR filter function for Q31.

Data Structure and Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

riscv_vec_liir_q31_t

Instance structure of the Q31 lattice IIR filter, defined as follows:

typedef struct {
    uint32_t nstage;
    q31_t * state;
    q31_t * rcoeff;
   q31_t * lcoeff;
} riscv_vec_liir_q31_t;

where:

nstage

Number of filter stages

state

Pointer to the state vector whose size is nstage + size

rcoeff

Pointer to the time reversed reflection coefficient vector whose size is nstage

lcoeff

Pointer to the time reversed ladder coefficient vector whose size is nstage + 1

[in] instance

Pointer to the instance structure

[in] src

Pointer to the input vector

[out] dst

Pointer to the output vector

[in] size

Number of samples

riscv_vec_liir_q15

Declaration
void riscv_vec_liir_q15 (const riscv_vec_liir_q15_t * instance, q15_t * src, q15_t * dst, uint32_t size)
Description

Lattice IIR filter function for Q15.

Data Structure and Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

riscv_vec_liir_q15_t

Instance structure of the Q15 lattice IIR filter, defined as follows:

typedef struct {
    uint32_t nstage;
    q15_t * state;
    q15_t * rcoeff;
    q15_t * lcoeff;
} riscv_vec_liir_q15_t;

where:

nstage

Number of filter stages

state

Pointer to the state vector whose size is nstage + size

rcoeff

Pointer to the time reversed reflection coefficient vector whose size is nstage

lcoeff

Pointer to the time reversed ladder coefficient vector whose size is nstage + 1

[in] instance

Pointer to the instance structure

[in] src

Pointer to the input vector

[out] dst

Pointer to the output vector

[in] size

Number of samples

Multichannel Biquadratic Cascade (BQM) Filter Direct Form I (DF1) Functions

These functions implement a biquadratic filter in direct form I (DF1), where each stage is implemented as an individual infinite impulse response (IIR) filter, as described by the following equation:

\[ \mathtt{dst[n] = b0 * src[n] + b1 * src[n-1] + b2 * src[n-2] + a1 * dst[n-1] + a2 * dst[n-2]} ; \]

In the equation, five coefficients (\(\mathtt{b0}\), \(\mathtt{b1}\), \(\mathtt{b2}\), \(\mathtt{a1}\), and \(\mathtt{a2}\)) are used per stage. The coefficients \(\mathtt{b0}\), \(\mathtt{b1}\), and \(\mathtt{b2}\) determine the feedforward coefficients, while the coefficients \(\mathtt{a1}\) and \(\mathtt{a2}\) determine the feedback coefficients. Each stage has its own set of unique coefficients.

The input and output signals are interleaved for multichannel data. For example, if channel = 3, the src data is arranged in the following format and the output is arranged in the same layout:

\[ \begin{aligned} \mathtt{\{ ch1\_src[0] \, , \, ch2\_src[0] \, , \, ch3\_src[0] \, , \, ch1\_src[1] \, , \, ch2\_src[1] \, , } \\ \mathtt{ch3\_src[1] \, , \, \dots \, , \, ch1\_src[n - 1] \, , \, ch2\_src[n - 1] \, , \, ch3\_src[n - 1] \}} \end{aligned} \]

To ensure correct results, you must initialize the structure with the corresponding initialization function (e.g., riscv_vec_bqm_df1_init_f32), which allocates memory to store the arranged coefficients and sets zeros in the state buffer. After executing the BQM DF1 Filter function, release the allocated memory using the associated free function (e.g., riscv_vec_bqm_df1_free_f32).

VEC Library supports distinct functions and instance structures for the following data types: single- and half-precision floating-point, Q31, and Q15. These functions and their instance structures are described in the subsections below.

riscv_vec_bqm_df1_init_f32

Declaration
void riscv_vec_bqm_df1_init_f32 (riscv_vec_bqm_df1_f32_t * instance, uint32_t nstage, float32_t * state, float32_t * coeff, uint32_t nch)
Description

BQM DF1 filter initialize function for F32.

Data Structure and Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

riscv_vec_bqm_df1_f32_t

Instance structure of the F32 BQM DF1 filter, defined as follows:

typedef struct {
    uint32_t nstage;
    uint32_t nchannel;
    float32_t * state;
    float32_t * coeff;
} riscv_vec_bqm_df1_f32_t;

where:

nstage

Number of filter stages

nchannel

Number of channels

state

Pointer to the state vector whose size is 4 * nstage * nchannel

coeff

Pointer to the coefficient vector whose size is 5 * nstage * nchannel

[in, out] instance

Pointer to the instance structure

[in] nstage

Number of filter stages

[in] state

Pointer to the state buffer

[in] coeff

Pointer to the input coefficient vector

[in] nch

Number of channels
Note

This function allocates a temporary buffer to store the rearranged coefficient vector for optimized efficiency, which size is 5 * nstage * nchannel * sizeof(float32_t).

riscv_vec_bqm_df1_init_f16

Declaration
void riscv_vec_bqm_df1_init_f16 (riscv_vec_bqm_df1_f16_t * instance, uint32_t nstage, float16_t * state, float16_t * coeff, uint32_t nch)
Description

BQM DF1 filter initialize function for F16.

Data Structure and Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

riscv_vec_bqm_df1_f16_t

Instance structure of the F16 BQM DF1 filter, defined as follows:

typedef struct {
    uint32_t nstage;
    uint32_t nchannel;
    float16_t * state;
    float16_t * coeff;
} riscv_vec_bqm_df1_f16_t;

where:

nstage

Number of filter stages

nchannel

Number of channels

state

Pointer to the state vector whose size is 4 * nstage * nchannel

coeff

Pointer to the coefficient vector whose size is 5 * nstage * nchannel

[in, out] instance

Pointer to the instance structure

[in] nstage

Number of filter stages

[in] state

Pointer to the state buffer

[in] coeff

Pointer to the input coefficient vector

[in] nch

Number of channels
Note

  • This function allocates a temporary buffer to store the rearranged coefficient vector for optimized efficiency, which size is 5 * nstage * nchannel * sizeof(float16_t).

  • This function is supported only by toolchains that support hard-float. Additionally, you must apply the -mzfh option in both compiler and linker flags when using this function. For details about the -mzfh linking option, see Linking Options for Newlib and MCUlib Toolchains or Linking Options for Glibc Toolchains.

Declaration
void riscv_vec_bqm_df1_init_q31 (riscv_vec_bqm_df1_q31_t * instance, uint32_t nstage, q31_t * state, q31_t * coeff, int8_t shift, uint32_t nch)

nchannel

Number of channels

coeff

Pointer to the coefficient vector whose size is 5 * nstage * nchannel

shift

Shift bits

Pointer to the instance structure

[in] nstage

Number of filter stages

[in] state

Pointer to the state buffer

[in] coeff

Pointer to the input coefficient vector

[in] shift

Shift bits

[in] nch

Multichannel Biquadratic Cascade (BQM) Filter Direct Form II Transposed (DF2T) Functions

These functions implement a biquadratic filter in direct form II transposed (DF2T), where each stage is implemented as an individual infinite impulse response (IIR) filter, as described by the following equation:

\[ \begin{aligned} & \mathtt{for \, \, (n = 0; \, \, n < size; \, \, n++)} \\ & \quad \quad \mathtt{out[n] = b0 * in[n] + d0;} \\ & \quad \quad \mathtt{d0 = b1 * in[n] + a1 * out[n] + d1;} \\ & \quad \quad \mathtt{d1 = b2 * in[n] + a2 * out[n];} \end{aligned} \]

In the equation, five coefficients (\(\mathtt{b0}\), \(\mathtt{b1}\), \(\mathtt{b2}\), \(\mathtt{a1}\), and \(\mathtt{a2}\)) and two state variables (\(\mathtt{d0}\) and \(\mathtt{d1}\)) are used per stage. Each stage has its own set of unique coefficients.

The input and output signals are interleaved for multichannel data. For example, if channel = 3, the src data is arranged in the following format and the output is arranged in the same layout:

\[ \begin{aligned} \mathtt{\{ ch1\_src[0] \, , \, ch2\_src[0] \, , \, ch3\_src[0] \, , \, ch1\_src[1] \, , \, ch2\_src[1] \, , } \\ \mathtt{ch3\_src[1] \, , \, \dots \, , \, ch1\_src[n - 1] \, , \, ch2\_src[n - 1] \, , \, ch3\_src[n - 1] \}} \end{aligned} \]

To ensure correct results, you must initialize the structure with the corresponding initialization function (e.g., riscv_vec_bqm_df2T_init_f32), which allocates memory to store the arranged coefficients and sets zeros in the state buffer. After executing the BQM DF2T Filter function, release the allocated memory using the associated free function (e.g., riscv_vec_bqm_df2T_free_f32).

VEC Library supports distinct functions and instance structures for the following data types: single-, half-, double-precision floating-point, and Q31. These functions and their instance structures are described in the subsections below.

riscv_vec_bqm_df2T_init_f32

Declaration
void riscv_vec_bqm_df2T_init_f32 (riscv_vec_bqm_df2T_f32_t * instance, uint32_t nstage, float32_t * state, float32_t * coeff, uint32_t nch)
Description

BQM DF2T filter initialize function for F32.

Data Structure and Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

riscv_vec_bqm_df2T_f32_t

Instance structure of the F32 BQM DF2T filter, defined as follows:

typedef struct {
    uint32_t nstage;
    uint32_t nchannel;
    float32_t * state;
    float32_t * coeff;
} riscv_vec_bqm_df2T_f32_t;

where:

nstage

Number of filter stages

nchannel

Number of channels

state

Pointer to the state vector whose size is 2 * nstage * nchannel

coeff

Pointer to the coefficient vector whose size is 5 * nstage * nchannel

[in, out] instance

Pointer to the instance structure

[in] nstage

Number of filter stages

[in] state

Pointer to the state buffer

[in] coeff

Pointer to the input coefficient vector

[in] nch

Number of channels
Note

This function allocates a temporary buffer to store the rearranged coefficient vector for optimized efficiency, which size is 5 * nstage * nchannel * sizeof(float32_t).

riscv_vec_bqm_df2T_init_f16

Declaration
void riscv_vec_bqm_df2T_init_f16 (riscv_vec_bqm_df2T_f16_t * instance, uint32_t nstage, float16_t * state, float16_t * coeff, uint32_t nch)
Description

Data Structure and Parameters

Parameter Description

    uint32_t nstage;

    float16_t * state;
    float16_t * coeff;
} riscv_vec_bqm_df2T_f16_t;

where:

nstage

Number of filter stages

nchannel

Number of channels

state

Pointer to the state vector whose size is 2 * nstage * nchannel

coeff

Pointer to the coefficient vector whose size is 5 * nstage * nchannel

[in, out] instance

Pointer to the instance structure

[in] nstage

Number of filter stages

[in] state

Pointer to the state buffer

[in] coeff

Pointer to the input coefficient vector

[in] nch

Number of channels
Note

  • This function allocates a temporary buffer to store the rearranged coefficient vector for optimized efficiency, which size is 5 * nstage * nchannel * sizeof(float16_t).

  • This function is supported only by toolchains that support hard-float. Additionally, you must apply the -mzfh option in both compiler and linker flags when using this function. For details about the -mzfh linking option, see Linking Options for Newlib and MCUlib Toolchains or Linking Options for Glibc Toolchains.

Number of channels
Note

This function allocates a temporary buffer to store the rearranged coefficient vector for optimized efficiency, which size is 5 * nstage * nchannel * sizeof(q31_t).

riscv_vec_bqm_df2T_f32

Declaration
void riscv_vec_bqm_df2T_f32 (const riscv_vec_bqm_df2T_f32_t * instance, float32_t * src, float32_t * dst, uint32_t size)
Description

BQM DF2T filter function for F32.

Data Structure and Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

riscv_vec_bqm_df2T_f32_t

Instance structure of the F32 BQM DF2T filter, defined as follows:

typedef struct {
    uint32_t nstage;
    uint32_t nchannel;
    float32_t * state;
    float32_t * coeff;
} riscv_vec_bqm_df2T_f32_t;

where:

nstage

Number of filter stages of one channel

nchannel

Number of channels

state

Pointer to the state vector whose size is 2 * nstage * nchannel

coeff

Pointer to the coefficient vector whose size is 5 * nstage * nchannel

[in] instance

Pointer to the instance structure

[in] src

Pointer to the input vector

[out] dst

Pointer to the output vector

[in] size

Number of samples

riscv_vec_bqm_df2T_f16

Declaration
void riscv_vec_bqm_df2T_f16 (const riscv_vec_bqm_df2T_f16_t * instance, float16_t * src, float16_t * dst, uint32_t size)
Description

BQM DF2T filter function for F16.

Data Structure and Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

riscv_vec_bqm_df2T_f16_t

Instance structure of the F16 BQM DF2T filter, defined as follows:

typedef struct {
    uint32_t nstage;
    uint32_t nchannel;
    float16_t * state;
    float16_t * coeff;
} riscv_vec_bqm_df2T_f16_t;

where:

nstage

Number of filter stages of one channel

nchannel

Number of channels

state

Pointer to the state vector whose size is 2 * nstage * nchannel

coeff

Pointer to the coefficient vector whose size is 5 * nstage * nchannel

[in] instance

Pointer to the instance structure

[in] src

Pointer to the input vector

[out] dst

Pointer to the output vector

[in] size

Number of samples
Note

This function is supported only by toolchains that support hard-float. Additionally, you must apply the -mzfh option in both compiler and linker flags when using this function. For details about the -mzfh linking option, see Linking Options for Newlib and MCUlib Toolchains or Linking Options for Glibc Toolchains.

riscv_vec_bqm_df2T_f64

Data Structure and Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

riscv_vec_bqm_df2T_q31_t

Instance structure of the Q31 BQM DF2T filter, defined as follows:

typedef struct {
    uint32_t nstage;
    uint32_t nchannel;
    q31_t * state;
    q31_t * coeff;
    int8_t shift;
} riscv_vec_bqm_df2T_q31_t;

where:

nstage

Number of filter stages

nchannel

Number of channels

state

Pointer to the state vector whose size is 2 * nstage * nchannel

coeff

Pointer to the coefficient vector whose size is 5 * nstage * nchannel

shift

Shift bits

[in] instance

Pointer to the instance structure

[in] src

Pointer to the input vector

[out] dst

Pointer to the output vector

[in] size

Number of samples

Convolution Functions

These functions combine two signals into one signal mathematically. The convolution equation can be presented as follows:

\[ \mathtt{ dst[n] = \sum_{k=0}^{len1} (src1[k] * src2[n - k]) } \]

where the size of \(\mathtt{src1[n]}\) is \(\mathtt{len1}\), the size of \(\mathtt{src2[n]}\) is \(\mathtt{len2}\), and the size of \(\mathtt{dst[n]}\) is \(\mathtt{len1 + len2 - 1}\).

Given a starting index and a specified size, partial convolution functions perform convolution on a portion of two signals. The result is stored in the destination vector within the range
\(\mathtt{[startindex \, , \, \dots \, , \, startindex + size - 1 ]}\). Thus, if the partial convolution result falls outside the range \(\mathtt{[0 \, , \, \dots \, , \, len1 + len2 - 2]}\), the function will return RISCV_VEC_FAIL to indicate an argument error.

VEC Library supports distinct functions for the following data type: single-precision floating-point. These functions are described in the subsections below.

riscv_vec_conv_f32

Declaration
void riscv_vec_conv_f32 (float32_t * src1, uint32_t len1, float32_t * src2, uint32_t len2, float32_t * dst)
Description

Convolution function for F32.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in] src1

Pointer to the first input vector

[in] len1

Length of the first input vector

[in] scr2

Pointer to the second input vector

[in] len2

Length of the second input vector

[out] dst

Pointer to the output vector

riscv_vec_conv_q31

Declaration
void riscv_vec_conv_q31 (q31_t * src1, uint32_t len1, q31_t * src2, uint32_t len2, q31_t * dst)
Description

Convolution function for Q31.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in] src1

Pointer to the first input vector

[in] len1

Length of the first input vector

[in] scr2

Pointer to the second input vector

[in] len2

Length of the second input vector

[out] dst

Pointer to the output vector

riscv_vec_conv_q15

riscv_vec_conv_partial_f32

Declaration
int32_t riscv_vec_conv_partial_f32 (float32_t * src1, uint32_t len1, float32_t * src2, uint32_t len2, float32_t * dst, uint32_t startindex, uint32_t size)
Description

Partial convolution function for F32.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in] src1

Pointer to the first input vector

[in] len1

Length of the first input vector

[in] scr2

Pointer to the second input vector

[in] len2

Length of the second input vector

[out] dst

Pointer to the output vector

[in] startindex

Starting index of the partial convolution

[in] size

Length of the partial convolution
Returns

  • RISCV_VEC_FAIL if startindex + size is greater than len1 + len2 - 1

  • RISCV_VEC_OK if successful

riscv_vec_conv_partial_q31

Declaration

  • RISCV_VEC_OK if successful

Image Functions

This section includes the following image functions and their corresponding data structures.

Data Structures in Image Functions

This section describes the data structures used in image functions.

struct riscv_vec_img_f32_t

The structure of F32 image vectors is defined as follows:

typedef struct
{
    float32_t * data;
    u32_t height;
    u32_t width;
    u32_t channels;
} riscv_vec_img_f32_t;

where:

data

Pointer to the image data

height

Height of the image

width

Width of the image

channels

Channels of the image

struct riscv_vec_img_s16_t

The structure of S16 image vectors is defined as follows:

typedef struct
{
    s16_t * data;
    u32_t height;
    u32_t width;
    u32_t channels;
} riscv_vec_img_s16_t;

where:

data

Pointer to the image data

height

Height of the image

width

Width of the image

channels

Channels of the image

struct riscv_vec_img_s8_t

The structure of S8 image vectors is defined as follows:

typedef struct
{
    s8_t * data;
    u32_t height;
    u32_t width;
    u32_t channels;
} riscv_vec_img_s8_t;

where:

data

Pointer to the image data

height

Height of the image

width

Width of the image

channels

Channels of the image

struct riscv_vec_img_u16_t

The structure of U16 image vectors is defined as follows:

typedef struct
{
    u16_t * data;
    u32_t height;
    u32_t width;
    u32_t channels;
} riscv_vec_img_u16_t;

where:

data

Pointer to the image data

height

Height of the image

width

Width of the image

channels

Channels of the image

struct riscv_vec_img_u8_t

The structure of U8 image vectors is defined as follows:

typedef struct
{
    u8_t * data;
    u32_t height;
    u32_t width;
    u32_t channels;
} riscv_vec_img_u8_t;

where:

data

Pointer to the image data

height

Height of the image

width

Width of the image

channels

Channels of the image

enum riscv_vec_img_border

The enum of the image boarder type is defined as follows:

typedef enum
{
    RISCV_VEC_IMG_BORDER_REFLECT101 = 0;
    RISCV_VEC_IMG_BORDER_CONSTANT   = 1;

} riscv_vec_img_border;

where:

RISCV_VEC_IMG_BORDER_REFLECT101

fedcba|abcdefgh|hgfedc

RISCV_VEC_IMG_BORDER_CONSTANT

000000|abcdefgh|000000

struct riscv_vec_point_t

The structure of XY points is defined as follows:

typedef struct
{
    int x;
    int y;
} riscv_vec_point_t;

where:

x

X of structure

y

Y of structure

Image Resize Functions

These functions resize an image using the specified algorithm.

The riscv_vec_img_resize_u8 function supports RGBA, RGB, and GRAY formats based on to the input image structure’s channels field, and allows selection of the interpolation mode through riscv_vec_img_interp_mode of enum type.

typedef enum
{
    RISCV_VEC_INTER_NEAREST         = 0,
    RISCV_VEC_INTER_LINEAR          = 1,
    RISCV_VEC_INTER_CUBIC           = 2,
    RISCV_VEC_INTER_NEAREST_EXACT   = 3
} riscv_vec_img_interp_mode;

The riscv_vec_img_resize_bilinear_rgba_u8 function is a specialized optimization for RGBA images using the bilinear interpolation algorithm. It offers better performance and comparable accuracy to the NE10 function.

riscv_vec_img_resize_u8

Declaration
riscv_vec_status riscv_vec_img_resize_u8 (riscv_vec_img_u8_t img_src, riscv_vec_img_u8_t img_dst, riscv_vec_img_interp_mode interp_mode)
Description

Image resize function for U8.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in] img_src

Input image structure

[out] img_dst

Output image structure

[in] interp_mode

Interpolation algorithm mode
Note

This function allocates two temporary buffers. One buffer stores the index for the calculated resize dimension, with a size of (4 * dst_width + dst_height) * 12. The other buffer reserves indices of rows that may be reused, with a size of 8 * dst_width_align16 where dst_width_align16 is 16-byte aligned version of dst_width.

Example
#define src_width     2
#define src_height    2
#define dst_width     4
#define dst_height    4
#define rgb_channel   3

u8_t src[rgb_channel * src_width * src_height] = {...};
u8_t dst[rgb_channel * dst_width * dst_height];
riscv_vec_img_u8_t img_src, img_dst;

img_src.data = src;
img_src.width = src_width;
img_src.height = src_height;
img_src.channels = rgb_channel;
img_dst.data = dst;
img_dst.width = dst_width;
img_dst.height = dst_height;
img_dst.channels = rgb_channel;

riscv_vec_img_resize_u8 (img_src, img_dst, RISCV_VEC_INTER_CUBIC);

riscv_vec_img_resize_bilinear_rgba_u8

Declaration
void riscv_vec_img_resize_bilinear_rgba_u8 (u8_t * dst, u32_t dst_width, u32_t dst_height, u8_t * src, u32_t src_width, u32_t src_height, u32_t src_stride)
Description

Image resize function for RGBA bilinear U8.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[out] dst

Pointer to the output vector

[in] dst_width

Number of width in the output vector

[in] dst_height

Number of height in the output vector

[in] src

Pointer to the input vector

[in] src_width

Number of width in the input vector

[in] src_height

Number of height in the input vector

[in] src_stride

Stride of the input vector
Note

This function allocates two temporary buffers. One buffer stores the index for the calculated resize dimension, with a size of (4 * dst_width + dst_height) * 12. The other buffer reserves indices of rows that may be reused, with a size of 8 * dst_width_align16 where dst_width_align16 is 16-byte aligned version of dst_width.

Example
#define src_width     2
#define src_height    2
#define dst_width     4
#define dst_height    4
#define src_stride    0

u8_t src[4 * src_width * src_height] = {...};
u8_t dst[4 * dst_width * dst_height];
riscv_vec_img_resize_bilinear_rgba_u8 (dst, dst_width, dst_height, src, src_width, src_height, src_stride);

Image filter2D Functions

These functions apply a 2D filter to images using the input image data and kernel data.

riscv_vec_img_filter2D_f32

Declaration
void riscv_vec_img_filter2D_f32 (riscv_vec_img_f32_t img_src, riscv_vec_img_f32_t img_kernel, riscv_vec_img_f32_t img_dst, riscv_vec_point_t anchor, double delta, riscv_vec_img_border type)
Description

Image filter2D function for F32.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in] img_src

Input image structure

[in] img_kernel

Input kernel structure

[out] img_dst

Output image structure

[in] anchor

Anchor of the kernel. Each element has a data type of riscv_vec_point_t.

[in] delta

Added value of the output image

[in] type

Extrapolation method for image border

riscv_vec_img_filter2D_s16

Declaration
void riscv_vec_img_filter2D_s16 (riscv_vec_img_s16_t img_src, riscv_vec_img_s16_t img_kernel, riscv_vec_img_s16_t img_dst, riscv_vec_point_t anchor, double delta, riscv_vec_img_border type)

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

Input image structure

[in] img_kernel

Input kernel structure

[out] img_dst

Output image structure

[in] anchor

Anchor of the kernel. Each element has a data type of riscv_vec_point_t.

[in] delta

Added value of the output image

[in] type

Extrapolation method for image border

Image Sobel Functions

These functions calculate the image Sobel of the input image data.

riscv_vec_img_sobel_f32

Declaration
void riscv_vec_img_sobel_f32 (riscv_vec_img_f32_t img_src, riscv_vec_img_f32_t img_dst, int dx, int dy, int kernel_size, double scale, double delta, riscv_vec_img_border type)
Description

Image Sobel function for F32.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in] img_src

Input image structure

[out] img_dst

Output image structure

[in] dx

Order of the derivative X

[in] dx

Order of the derivative Y

[in] kernal_size

Size of the extended Sobel kernel; it must be 1, 3, 5, or 7.

[in] scale

Scale factor for the computed derivative values

[in] delta

Added value of the output image

[in] type

Extrapolation method for image border

riscv_vec_img_sobel_s16

Declaration
void riscv_vec_img_sobel_s16 (riscv_vec_img_s16_t img_src, riscv_vec_img_s16_t img_dst, int dx, int dy, int kernel_size, double scale, double delta, riscv_vec_img_border type)
Description

Image Sobel function for S16.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in] img_src

Input image structure

[out] img_dst

Output image structure

[in] dx

Order of the derivative X

[in] dx

Order of the derivative Y

[in] kernal_size

Size of the extended Sobel kernel; it must be 1, 3, 5, or 7.

[in] scale

Scale factor for the computed derivative values

[in] delta

Added value of the output image

[in] type

Extrapolation method for image border

riscv_vec_img_sobel_u8_s16

Declaration
void riscv_vec_img_sobel_u8_s16 (riscv_vec_img_u8_t img_src, riscv_vec_img_s16_t img_dst, int dx, int dy, int kernel_size, double scale, double delta, riscv_vec_img_border type)
Description

Image Sobel function with S16 output for U8.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in] img_src

Input image structure

[out] img_dst

Output image structure

[in] dx

Order of the derivative X

[in] dx

Order of the derivative Y

[in] kernal_size

Size of the extended Sobel kernel; it must be 1, 3, 5, or 7.

[in] scale

Scale factor for the computed derivative values

[in] delta

Added value of the output image

[in] type

Extrapolation method for image border

riscv_vec_img_sobel_u8_s8

Declaration
void riscv_vec_img_sobel_u8_s8 (riscv_vec_img_u8_t img_src, riscv_vec_img_s8_t img_dst, int dx, int dy, int kernel_size, double scale, double delta, riscv_vec_img_border type)
Description

Image Sobel function with S8 output for U8.

[out] img_dst

Output image structure

Order of the derivative X

[in] kernal_size

[in] scale

[in] delta

Added value of the output image

[in] type

Image Gaussian Blur Functions

These functions apply a Gaussian filter to blur images.

riscv_vec_img_gaussianBlur_f32

Declaration
void riscv_vec_img_gaussianBlur_f32 (riscv_vec_img_f32_t img_src, riscv_vec_img_f32_t img_dst, riscv_vec_point_t ksize, double sigmaX, double sigmaY, riscv_vec_img_border type)
Description

Image Gaussian blur function for F32.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in] img_src

Input image structure

[out] img_dst

Output image structure

[in] ksize

Gaussian kernel size. Each element has a data type of riscv_vec_point_t.
ksize.width and ksize.height can differ but they both must be positive and odd.

[in] sigmaX

Gaussian kernel standard deviation in X direction

[in] sigmaY

Gaussian kernel standard deviation in Y direction

[in] type

Image extrapolation border method

riscv_vec_img_gaussianBlur_s16

Declaration
void riscv_vec_img_gaussianBlur_s16 (riscv_vec_img_s16_t img_src, riscv_vec_img_s16_t img_dst, riscv_vec_point_t ksize, double sigmaX, double sigmaY, riscv_vec_img_border type)
Description

Image Gaussian blur function for S16.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in] img_src

Input image structure

[out] img_dst

Output image structure

[in] ksize

Gaussian kernel size. Each element has a data type of riscv_vec_point_t.
ksize.width and ksize.height can differ but they both must be positive and odd.

[in] sigmaX

Gaussian kernel standard deviation in X direction

[in] sigmaY

Gaussian kernel standard deviation in Y direction

[in] type

Extrapolation method for image border

riscv_vec_img_gaussianBlur_s8

Declaration
void riscv_vec_img_gaussianBlur_s8 (riscv_vec_img_s8_t img_src, riscv_vec_img_s8_t img_dst, riscv_vec_point_t ksize, double sigmaX, double sigmaY, riscv_vec_img_border type)

Input image structure

[out] img_dst

Output image structure

[in] ksize

Gaussian kernel size. Each element has a data type of riscv_vec_point_t.
ksize.width and ksize.height can differ but they both must be positive and odd.

[in] sigmaX

[in] sigmaY

[in] type

Image Median Blur Functions

These functions apply a median filter to blur images.

riscv_vec_img_medianBlur_f32

Declaration
riscv_vec_status riscv_vec_img_medianBlur_f32 (riscv_vec_img_f32_t img_src, riscv_vec_img_f32_t img_dst, uint32_t ksize)
Description

Image median blur function for F32.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in] img_src

Input image structure

[out] img_dst

Output image structure

[in] ksize

Size of the median kernel; only 3 and 5 are supported.
Returns

  • RISCV_VEC_INPUT_PARAM_ERROR if the input ksize is not equal to 3 or 5, or ksize is greater than or equal to img_src.height and img_src.width.

  • RISCV_VEC_MALLOC_FAIL if allocation fails

  • RISCV_VEC_SUCCESS if successful

riscv_vec_img_medianBlur_u16

Declaration
riscv_vec_status riscv_vec_img_medianBlur_u16 (riscv_vec_img_u16_t img_src, riscv_vec_img_u16_t img_dst, uint32_t ksize)
Description

Image median blur function for U16.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in] img_src

Input image structure

[out] img_dst

Output image structure

[in] ksize

Size of the median kernel; only 3 and 5 are supported.
Returns

  • RISCV_VEC_INPUT_PARAM_ERROR if the input ksize is not equal to 3 or 5, or ksize is greater than or equal to img_src.height and img_src.width.

  • RISCV_VEC_MALLOC_FAIL if allocation fails

  • RISCV_VEC_SUCCESS if successful

riscv_vec_img_medianBlur_u8

Declaration
riscv_vec_status riscv_vec_img_medianBlur_u8 (riscv_vec_img_u8_t img_src, riscv_vec_img_u8_t img_dst, uint32_t ksize)
Description

Image median blur function for U8.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in] img_src

Input image structure

[out] img_dst

Output image structure

[in] ksize

Size of the median kernel; it must be odd and greater than 1.
Returns

  • RISCV_VEC_INPUT_PARAM_ERROR if the input ksize is not an odd number and is greater than 1, or ksize is greater than or equal to img_src.height and img_src.width.

  • RISCV_VEC_MALLOC_FAIL if allocation fails

  • RISCV_VEC_SUCCESS if successful

Image Box Filter Functions

These functions apply a normalized box filter to blur images.

riscv_vec_img_boxFilter_f32

Declaration
void riscv_vec_img_boxFilter_f32 (riscv_vec_img_f32_t img_src, riscv_vec_img_f32_t img_dst, riscv_vec_point_t ksize, riscv_vec_point_t anchor, uint8_t normalize, riscv_vec_img_border type)
Description

Image box filter function for F32.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in] img_src

Input image structure

[out] img_dst

Output image structure

[in] ksize

Blurring kernel size. Each element has a data type of riscv_vec_point_t.

[in] anchor

Anchor of the kernel. Each element has a data type of riscv_vec_point_t.

[in] normalize

Specifies whether the kernel is normalized by its area
(1 = yes, 0 = no)

[in] type

Extrapolation method for image border

riscv_vec_img_boxFilter_s16

Declaration
void riscv_vec_img_boxFilter_s16 (riscv_vec_img_s16_t img_src, riscv_vec_img_s16_t img_dst, riscv_vec_point_t ksize, riscv_vec_point_t anchor, uint8_t normalize, riscv_vec_img_border type)

Image box filter function for S16.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in] img_src

Input image structure

[out] img_dst

Output image structure

[in] ksize

Blurring kernel size. Each element has a data type of riscv_vec_point_t.

[in] anchor

Anchor of the kernel. Each element has a data type of riscv_vec_point_t.

[in] normalize

Specifies whether the kernel is normalized by its area
(1 = yes, 0 = no)

[in] type

Extrapolation method for image border

riscv_vec_img_boxFilter_u8

Declaration
void riscv_vec_img_boxFilter_u8 (riscv_vec_img_u8_t img_src, riscv_vec_img_u8_t img_dst, riscv_vec_point_t ksize, riscv_vec_point_t anchor, uint8_t normalize, riscv_vec_img_border type)

[in] anchor

Anchor of the kernel. Each element has a data type of riscv_vec_point_t.

[in] normalize

Specifies whether the kernel is normalized by its area
(1 = yes, 0 = no)

[in] type

Image Bilateral Functions

These functions apply a bilateral filter to images.

riscv_vec_img_bilateral_f32

Declaration
riscv_vec_status riscv_vec_img_bilateral_f32 (riscv_vec_img_f32_t img_src, riscv_vec_img_f32_t img_dst, int32_t d, double sigma_color, double sigma_space, riscv_vec_img_border type)
Description

Image bilateral function for F32.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in] img_src

Input image structure

[out] img_dst

Output image structure

[in] d

Diameter of each pixel neighborhood that is used during filtering

[in] sigma_color

Filter sigma in the color space

[in] sigma_space

Filter sigma in the coordinate space

[in] type

Extrapolation method for image border
Returns

  • RISCV_VEC_INPUT_PARAM_ERROR if the input d/2 is greater than or equal to min(img_src.height, img_src.width)

  • RISCV_VEC_MALLOC_FAIL if allocation fails

  • RISCV_VEC_SUCCESS if successful

riscv_vec_img_bilateral_u8

Declaration
riscv_vec_status riscv_vec_img_bilateral_u8 (riscv_vec_img_u8_t img_src, riscv_vec_img_u8_t img_dst, int32_t d, double sigma_color, double sigma_space, riscv_vec_img_border type)
Description

Image bilateral function for U8.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in] img_src

Input image structure

[out] img_dst

Output image structure

[in] d

Diameter of each pixel neighborhood that is used during filtering

[in] sigma_color

Filter sigma in the color space

[in] sigma_space

Filter sigma in the coordinate space

[in] type

Extrapolation method for image border
Returns

  • RISCV_VEC_INPUT_PARAM_ERROR if the input d/2 is greater than or equal to min(img_src.height, img_src.width)

  • RISCV_VEC_MALLOC_FAIL if allocation fails

  • RISCV_VEC_SUCCESS if successful

Image Color Conversion Function

This function converts an image from one color space to another. VEC Library supports the following conversion code as riscv_vec_img_color_cvt of enum type.

typedef enum {
       RISCV_VEC_COLOR_YUV2RGB_NV12  = 90,
       RISCV_VEC_COLOR_YUV2BGR_NV12  = 91,
       RISCV_VEC_COLOR_YUV2RGB_NV21  = 92,
       RISCV_VEC_COLOR_YUV2BGR_NV21  = 93,
       RISCV_VEC_COLOR_YUV2RGBA_NV12 = 94,
       RISCV_VEC_COLOR_YUV2BGRA_NV12 = 95,
       RISCV_VEC_COLOR_YUV2RGBA_NV21 = 96,
       RISCV_VEC_COLOR_YUV2BGRA_NV21 = 97,
       RISCV_VEC_COLOR_YUV2RGB_YV12 = 98,
       RISCV_VEC_COLOR_YUV2BGR_YV12 = 99,
       RISCV_VEC_COLOR_YUV2RGB_IYUV = 100,
       RISCV_VEC_COLOR_YUV2BGR_IYUV = 101,
       RISCV_VEC_COLOR_YUV2RGBA_YV12 = 102,
       RISCV_VEC_COLOR_YUV2BGRA_YV12 = 103,
       RISCV_VEC_COLOR_YUV2RGBA_IYUV = 104,
       RISCV_VEC_COLOR_YUV2BGRA_IYUV = 105
} riscv_vec_img_color_cvt;

riscv_vec_img_cvtColor_u8

Declaration
q31_t riscv_vec_img_cvtColor_u8 (riscv_vec_img_u8_t img_src, riscv_vec_img_f32_t img_dst, riscv_vec_img_color_cvt type)
Description

Image color conversion function for U8.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in] img_src

Input image structure

[out] img_dst

Output image structure

[in] type

Image color conversion code
Returns

  • RISCV_VEC_FAIL if conversion fails

  • RISCV_VEC_OK if successful

Row-Major Matrix Functions

VEC Library supports accessing matrix elements in row-major order and provides functions prefixed with riscv_vec_rmmat.

For row-major matrix functions, matrices are represented as regular MATm*n with m rows and n columns, stored in vectors in row-major order. The size of a vector equals the total number of elements in the matrix (i.e., size = m * n).

Row-Major Matrix Addition Functions

These functions add the corresponding elements from two source matrices and store the results one-by-one in the destination matrix in row-major order.

riscv_vec_rmmat_add_f32

Declaration
int riscv_vec_rmmat_add_f32 (const float32_t * src1, const float32_t * src2, float32_t * dst, uint32_t row, uint32_t col)
Description

Row-major matrix addition function for F32.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in] src1

Pointer to the first input matrix

[in] src2

Pointer to the second input matrix

[out] dst

Pointer to the output matrix

[in] row

Number of rows in a matrix

[in] col

Number of columns in a matrix
Returns

RISCV_VEC_OK

Example

The following equation shows the addition of two matrices and the results.

\[ \begin{bmatrix} \mathtt{0.1} & \mathtt{0.4} \\ \mathtt{-0.2} & \mathtt{0.1} \end{bmatrix} + \begin{bmatrix} \mathtt{-0.2} & \mathtt{-0.1} \\ \mathtt{0.3} & \mathtt{0.5} \end{bmatrix} = \begin{bmatrix} \mathtt{-0.1} & \mathtt{0.3} \\ \mathtt{0.1} & \mathtt{0.6} \end{bmatrix} \]

 

The code example with this function is as follows:

#define row    2
#define col    2
float32_t src1[row * col] = {0.1, 0.4, -0.2, 0.1};
float32_t src2[row * col] = {-0.2, -0.1, 0.3, 0.5};
float32_t dst[row * col];
riscv_vec_rmmat_add_f32 (src1, src2, dst, row, col);

This example also serves as a reference for examples of F16, F64, Q15, and Q31 row-major matrix addition functions.

riscv_vec_rmmat_add_f16

Declaration
int riscv_vec_rmmat_add_f16 (const float16_t * src1, const float16_t * src2, float16_t * dst, uint32_t row, uint32_t col)
Description

Row-major matrix addition function for F16.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in] src1

Pointer to the first input matrix

[in] src2

Pointer to the second input matrix

[out] dst

Pointer to the output matrix

[in] row

Number of rows in a matrix

[in] col

Number of columns in a matrix
Returns

RISCV_VEC_OK

Note

This function is supported only by toolchains that support hard-float. Additionally, you must apply the -mzfh option in both compiler and linker flags when using this function. For details about the -mzfh linking option, see Linking Options for Newlib and MCUlib Toolchains or Linking Options for Glibc Toolchains.

riscv_vec_rmmat_add_f64

Declaration
int riscv_vec_rmmat_add_f64 (const float64_t * src1, const float64_t * src2, float64_t * dst, uint32_t row, uint32_t col)
Description

Row-major matrix addition function for F64.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in] src1

Pointer to the first input matrix

[in] src2

Pointer to the second input matrix

[out] dst

Pointer to the output matrix

[in] row

Number of rows in a matrix

[in] col

Number of columns in a matrix
Returns

RISCV_VEC_OK

riscv_vec_rmmat_add_q31

Declaration
int riscv_vec_rmmat_add_q31 (const q31_t * src1, const q31_t * src2, q31_t * dst, uint32_t row, uint32_t col)
Description

Row-major matrix addition function for Q31.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Pointer to the first input matrix

[in] src2

[out] dst

Number of rows in a matrix

[in] col

Number of columns in a matrix
Returns

RISCV_VEC_OK

int riscv_vec_rmmat_add_q15 (const q15_t * src1, const q15_t * src2, q15_t * dst, uint32_t row, uint32_t col)
Description

Row-major matrix addition function for Q15.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in] src1

Pointer to the first input matrix

[in] src2

Pointer to the second input matrix

[out] dst

Pointer to the output matrix

[in] row

Number of rows in a matrix

[in] col

Number of columns in a matrix
Returns

RISCV_VEC_OK

Row-Major Matrix Subtraction Functions

These functions subtract two matrices of the same dimensions and store the results in the destination matrix in row-major order.

riscv_vec_rmmat_sub_f32

Declaration
int riscv_vec_rmmat_sub_f32 (const float32_t * src1, const float32_t * src2, float32_t * dst, uint32_t row, uint32_t col)
Description

Row-major matrix subtraction function for F32.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in] src1

Pointer to the first input matrix

[in] src2

Pointer to the second input matrix

[out] dst

Pointer to the output matrix

[in] row

Number of rows in a matrix

[in] col

Number of columns in a matrix
Returns

RISCV_VEC_OK

Example

The following equation shows the subtraction of two matrices and the results.

\[ \begin{bmatrix} \mathtt{0.1} & \mathtt{0.4} \\ \mathtt{-0.2} & \mathtt{0.1} \end{bmatrix} - \begin{bmatrix} \mathtt{-0.2} & \mathtt{-0.1} \\ \mathtt{0.3} & \mathtt{0.5} \end{bmatrix} = \begin{bmatrix} \mathtt{0.3} & \mathtt{0.5} \\ \mathtt{-0.5} & \mathtt{-0.4} \end{bmatrix} \]

 

The code example with this function is as follows:

#define row    2
#define col    2
float32_t src1[row * col] = {0.1, 0.4, -0.2, 0.1};
float32_t src2[row * col] = {-0.2, -0.1, 0.3, 0.5};
float32_t dst[row * col];
riscv_vec_rmmat_sub_f32 (src1, src2, dst, row, col);

This example also serves as a reference for examples of F16, F64, Q15, and Q31 row-major matrix subtraction functions.

riscv_vec_rmmat_sub_f16

Declaration
int riscv_vec_rmmat_sub_f16 (const float16_t * src1, const float16_t * src2, float16_t * dst, uint32_t row, uint32_t col)
Description

Row-major matrix subtraction function for F16.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in] src1

Pointer to the first input matrix

[in] src2

Pointer to the second input matrix

[out] dst

Pointer to the output matrix

[in] row

Number of rows in a matrix

[in] col

Number of columns in a matrix
Returns

RISCV_VEC_OK

Note

This function is supported only by toolchains that support hard-float. Additionally, you must apply the -mzfh option in both compiler and linker flags when using this function. For details about the -mzfh linking option, see Linking Options for Newlib and MCUlib Toolchains or Linking Options for Glibc Toolchains.

riscv_vec_rmmat_sub_f64

Declaration
int riscv_vec_rmmat_sub_f64 (const float64_t * src1, const float64_t * src2, float64_t * dst, uint32_t row, uint32_t col)

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

Pointer to the first input matrix

[in] src2

Pointer to the second input matrix

[out] dst

Pointer to the output matrix

Number of rows in a matrix

[in] col

Number of columns in a matrix
Returns

RISCV_VEC_OK

Parameters

[in] col

Returns

RISCV_VEC_OK

riscv_vec_rmmat_sub_q15

Declaration
int riscv_vec_rmmat_sub_q15 (const q15_t * src1, const q15_t * src2, q15_t * dst, uint32_t row, uint32_t col)
Description

Row-major matrix subtraction function for Q15.

Parameters

[in] src1

Pointer to the first input matrix

[in] src2
