[out] dst

Pointer to the output matrix

[in] row

Number of rows in a matrix

[in] col

Number of columns in a matrix
Returns

RISCV_VEC_OK

Row-Major Matrix Multiplication Functions

These functions perform the multiplication of two source matrices and store the results in the destination matrix in row-major order.

riscv_vec_rmmat_mul_f32

Declaration
int riscv_vec_rmmat_mul_f32 (const float32_t * src1, const float32_t * src2, float32_t * dst, uint32_t row, uint32_t col, uint32_t col2)
Description

Row-major matrix multiplication function for F32.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in] src1

Pointer to the first input matrix

[in] src2

Pointer to the second input matrix

[out] dst

Pointer to the output matrix

[in] row

Number of rows in the first input matrix

[in] col

Number of columns in the first input matrix

[in] col2

Number of columns in the second input matrix
Returns

  • RISCV_VEC_OK if successful

  • RISCV_VEC_FAIL if allocation fails

Note

If col2 exceeds 1024, the function allocates a 64 KB temporary buffer (calculated as sizeof(float32_t) * 128 * 128) to reduce data cache (D-Cache) misses and improve performance. If there is not enough memory available for the allocation, the function returns RISCV_VEC_FAIL to indicate an error.

Example

The following equation shows the multiplication of two matrices:

\[ \mathtt{ A_{\scriptscriptstyle 2,3} * B_{\scriptscriptstyle 3,2} = C_{\scriptscriptstyle 2,2} } \]
 

Given each element with a value, the result is like:

\[ \begin{bmatrix} \mathtt{0.1} & \mathtt{-0.1} & \mathtt{0.1} \\ \mathtt{0.2} & \mathtt{-0.2} & \mathtt{0.3} \end{bmatrix} * \begin{bmatrix} \mathtt{0.2} & \mathtt{0.2} \\ \mathtt{-0.1} & \mathtt{0.3} \\ \mathtt{-0.7} & \mathtt{-0.2} \end{bmatrix} = \begin{bmatrix} \mathtt{-0.04} & \mathtt{-0.03} \\ \mathtt{-0.15} & \mathtt{-0.08} \end{bmatrix} \]

 

and can be presented in code with this function as follows:

#define Arow    2
#define Acol    3
#define Bcol    2
float32_t src1[Arow * Acol] = {0.1, -0.1, 0.1, 0.2, -0.2, 0.3};
float32_t src2[Acol * Bcol] = {0.2, 0.2, -0.1, 0.3, -0.7, -0.2};
float32_t dst[Arow * Bcol];
riscv_vec_rmmat_mul_f32 (src1, src2, dst, Arow, Acol, Bcol);

This example also serves as a reference for examples of F16 and F64 row-major matrix multiplication functions.

riscv_vec_rmmat_mul_f16

Declaration
int riscv_vec_rmmat_mul_f16 (const float16_t * src1, const float16_t * src2, float16_t * dst, uint32_t row, uint32_t col, uint32_t col2)
Description

Row-major matrix multiplication function for F16.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in] src1

Pointer to the first input matrix

[in] src2

Pointer to the second input matrix

[out] dst

Pointer to the output matrix

[in] row

Number of rows in the first input matrix

[in] col

Number of columns in the first input matrix

[in] col2

Number of columns in the second input matrix
Returns

  • RISCV_VEC_OK if successful

  • RISCV_VEC_FAIL if allocation fails

Note

  • This function is supported only by toolchains that support hard-float. Additionally, you must apply the -mzfh option in both compiler and linker flags when using this function. For details about the -mzfh linking option, see Linking Options for Newlib and MCUlib Toolchains or Linking Options for Glibc Toolchains.

  • If col2 exceeds 1024, the function allocates a 128 KB temporary buffer (calculated as sizeof(float16_t) * 256 * 256) to reduce D-Cache misses and improve performance. If there is not enough memory available for the allocation, the function returns RISCV_VEC_FAIL to indicate an error.

riscv_vec_rmmat_mul_bf16

Declaration
int riscv_vec_rmmat_mul_bf16 (const bf16_t * src1, const bf16_t * src2, bf16_t * dst, uint32_t row, uint32_t col, uint32_t col2)
Description

Row-major matrix multiplication function for BF16.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in] src1

Pointer to the first input matrix

[in] src2

Pointer to the second input matrix

[out] dst

Pointer to the output matrix

[in] row

Number of rows in the first input matrix

[in] col

Number of columns in the first input matrix

[in] col2

Number of columns in the second input matrix
Returns

  • RISCV_VEC_OK if successful

  • RISCV_VEC_FAIL if allocation fails

Note

  • This function is supported only by toolchains that support hard-float. Additionally, you must apply the -mext-bf16min option in both compiler and linker flags when using this function. For details about the -mext-bf16min linking option, see Linking Options for Newlib and MCUlib Toolchains or Linking Options for Glibc Toolchains.

  • If col2 exceeds 1024, the function allocates a 128 KB temporary buffer (calculated as sizeof(bf16_t) * 256 * 256) to reduce D-Cache misses and improve performance. If there is not enough memory available for the allocation, the function returns RISCV_VEC_FAIL to indicate an error.

riscv_vec_rmmat_mul_f64

Declaration
int riscv_vec_rmmat_mul_f64 (const float64_t * src1, const float64_t * src2, float64_t * dst, uint32_t row, uint32_t col, uint32_t col2)
Description

Row-major matrix multiplication function for F64.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in] src1

Pointer to the first input matrix

[in] src2

Pointer to the second input matrix

[out] dst

Pointer to the output matrix

[in] row

Number of rows in the first input matrix

[in] col

Number of columns in the first input matrix

[in] col2

Number of columns in the second input matrix
Returns

  • RISCV_VEC_OK if successful

  • RISCV_VEC_FAIL if allocation fails

Note

If col2 exceeds 512, the function allocates a 128 KB temporary buffer (calculated as sizeof(float64_t) * 128 * 128) to reduce D-Cache misses and improve performance. If there is not enough memory available for the allocation, the function returns RISCV_VEC_FAIL to indicate an error.

riscv_vec_rmmat_mul_q15

Declaration
int riscv_vec_rmmat_mul_q15 (const q15_t * src1, const q15_t * src2, q15_t * dst, uint32_t row, uint32_t col, uint32_t col2)
Description

Row-major matrix multiplication function for Q15.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in] src1

Pointer to the first input matrix

[in] src2

Pointer to the second input matrix

[out] dst

Pointer to the output matrix

[in] row

Number of rows in the first input matrix

[in] col

Number of columns in the first input matrix

[in] col2

Number of columns in the second input matrix
Returns

  • RISCV_VEC_OK if successful

  • RISCV_VEC_FAIL if allocation fails

Note

This function allocates a temporary buffer (calculated as sizeof(q63_t) * row * col2) to store the intermediate calculation. If col2 exceeds 2048, the function allocates a 32 KB temporary buffer (calculated as sizeof(q15_t) * 128 * 128) to reduce D-Cache misses and improve performance. If there is not enough memory available for the allocation, the function returns RISCV_VEC_FAIL to indicate an error.

riscv_vec_rmmat_mul_q15_q63

Declaration
int riscv_vec_rmmat_mul_q15_q63 (const q15_t * src1, const q15_t * src2, q63_t * dst, uint32_t row, uint32_t col, uint32_t col2)
Description

Row-major matrix multiplication function that multiplies two Q15 matrices and stores the results in a Q63 matrix.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in] src1

Pointer to the first input matrix

[in] src2

Pointer to the second input matrix

[out] dst

Pointer to the output matrix

[in] row

Number of rows in the first input matrix

[in] col

Number of columns in the first input matrix

[in] col2

Number of columns in the second input matrix
Returns

  • RISCV_VEC_OK if successful

  • RISCV_VEC_FAIL if allocation fails

Note

If col2 exceeds 2048, the function allocates a 32 KB temporary buffer (calculated as sizeof(q15_t) * 128 * 128) to reduce D-Cache misses and improve performance. If there is not enough memory available for the allocation, the function returns RISCV_VEC_FAIL to indicate an error.

riscv_vec_rmmat_mul_q7

Declaration
int riscv_vec_rmmat_mul_q7 (const q7_t * src1, const q7_t * src2, q7_t * dst, uint32_t row, uint32_t col, uint32_t col2)
Description

Row-major matrix multiplication function for Q7.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in] src1

Pointer to the first input matrix

[in] src2

Pointer to the second input matrix

[out] dst

Pointer to the output matrix

[in] row

Number of rows in the first input matrix

[in] col

Number of columns in the first input matrix

[in] col2

Number of columns in the second input matrix
Returns

  • RISCV_VEC_OK if successful

  • RISCV_VEC_FAIL if allocation fails

Note

This function allocates a temporary buffer (calculated as sizeof(q31_t) * row * col2) to store the intermediate calculation. If col2 exceeds 4096, this function allocates a 64 KB temporary buffer (calculated as sizeof(q7_t) * 256 * 256) to reduce D-Cache misses and improve performance. If there is not enough memory available for the allocation, the function returns RISCV_VEC_FAIL to indicate an error.

Declaration

riscv_vec_rmmat_mul_vxm_q7

[out] dst

[in] col

Number of columns in the input vector

[in] col2

Number of columns in the input matrix

Row-Major Matrix Scale Functions

These functions multiply a matrix by a constant scaling value and store the results in the destination matrix in row-major order.

riscv_vec_rmmat_scale_f32

Declaration
int riscv_vec_rmmat_scale_f32 (const float32_t * src, float32_t scale, float32_t * dst, uint32_t row, uint32_t col)
Description

Row-major matrix scale function for F32.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in] src

Pointer to the input matrix

[in] scale

Constant scaling value

[out] dst

Pointer to the output matrix

[in] row

Number of rows in a matrix

[in] col

Number of columns in a matrix
Returns

  • RISCV_VEC_OK if successful

  • RISCV_VEC_FAIL if row or col is zero

Example

Given a matrix and a scale value 0.2, the matrix scale equation is as follows:

\[ \begin{bmatrix} \mathtt{0.1} & \mathtt{0.4} \\ \mathtt{-0.2} & \mathtt{0.1} \end{bmatrix} * \mathtt{scale} = \begin{bmatrix} \mathtt{0.02} & \mathtt{0.08} \\ \mathtt{-0.04} & \mathtt{0.02} \end{bmatrix} \]

and its code example is like:

#define row    2
#define col    2
float32_t src[row * col] = {0.1, 0.4, -0.2, 0.1};
float32_t scale = 0.2;
float32_t dst[row * col];
riscv_vec_mat_scale_f32 (src1, scale, dst, row, col);

This example also serves as a reference for examples of F16, Q15, and Q31 row-major matrix scale functions.

riscv_vec_rmmat_scale_f16

Declaration
int riscv_vec_rmmat_scale_f16 (const float16_t * src, float16_t scale, float16_t * dst, uint32_t row, uint32_t col)
Description

Row-major matrix scale function for F16.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in] src

Pointer to the input matrix

[in] scale

Constant scaling value

[out] dst

Pointer to the output matrix

[in] row

Number of rows in a matrix

[in] col

Number of columns in a matrix
Returns

  • RISCV_VEC_OK if successful

  • RISCV_VEC_FAIL if row or col is zero

Note

This function is supported only by toolchains that support hard-float. Additionally, you must apply the -mzfh option in both compiler and linker flags when using this function. For details about the -mzfh linking option, see Linking Options for Newlib and MCUlib Toolchains or Linking Options for Glibc Toolchains.

riscv_vec_rmmat_scale_f64

Declaration
int riscv_vec_rmmat_scale_f64 (const float64_t * src, float64_t scale, float64_t * dst, uint32_t row, uint32_t col)

Pointer to the input matrix

Pointer to the output matrix

[in] col

Number of columns in a matrix
Returns

  • RISCV_VEC_OK if successful

  • RISCV_VEC_FAIL if row or col is zero

Pointer to the input matrix

[in] shift

[out] dst

Pointer to the output matrix

[in] col

Number of columns in a matrix
Returns

  • RISCV_VEC_OK if successful

  • RISCV_VEC_FAIL if row or col is zero

Constant fractional scaling value

[in] shift

Shift bits

[out] dst

Pointer to the output matrix

[in] row

Number of rows in a matrix

[in] col

Number of columns in a matrix
Returns

  • RISCV_VEC_OK if successful

  • RISCV_VEC_FAIL if row or col is zero

Row-Major Matrix Transpose Functions

These functions transpose a matrix and store the results in the destination matrix in row-major order.

riscv_vec_rmmat_trans_f32

Declaration
int riscv_vec_rmmat_trans_f32 (const float32_t * src, float32_t * dst, uint32_t row, uint32_t col)
Description

Row-major matrix transpose function for F32.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in] src

Pointer to the input matrix

[out] dst

Pointer to the output matrix

[in] row

Number of rows in a matrix

[in] col

Number of columns in a matrix
Returns

  • RISCV_VEC_OK if successful

  • RISCV_VEC_FAIL if row or col is zero

Example

Given an equation of matrix transposing like below:

\[ \mathtt{ \begin{bmatrix} \mathtt{0.1} & \mathtt{-0.1} & \mathtt{0.1} \\ \mathtt{0.2} & \mathtt{-0.2} & \mathtt{0.3} \end{bmatrix} }^{\scriptscriptstyle{T}} = \mathtt{ \begin{bmatrix} \mathtt{0.1} & \mathtt{0.2} \\ \mathtt{-0.1} & \mathtt{-0.2} \\ \mathtt{0.1} & \mathtt{0.3} \end{bmatrix} } \]

and its code example is as follows:

#define row    2
#define col    3
float32_t src[row * col] = {0.1, -0.1, 0.1, 0.2, -0.2, 0.3};
float32_t dst[col * row];
riscv_vec_mat_trans_f32 (src, dst, row, col);

This example also serves as a reference for examples of F16, F64, Q15, Q31, Q7, and U8 row-major matrix transpose functions.

riscv_vec_rmmat_trans_f16

Declaration
int riscv_vec_rmmat_trans_f16 (const float16_t * src, float16_t * dst, uint32_t row, uint32_t col)
Description

Row-major matrix transpose function for F16.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in] src

Pointer to the input matrix

[out] dst

Pointer to the output matrix

[in] row

Number of rows in a matrix

[in] col

Number of columns in a matrix
Returns

  • RISCV_VEC_OK if successful

  • RISCV_VEC_FAIL if row or col is zero

Note

This function is supported only by toolchains that support hard-float. Additionally, you must apply the -mzfh option in both compiler and linker flags when using this function. For details about the -mzfh linking option, see Linking Options for Newlib and MCUlib Toolchains or Linking Options for Glibc Toolchains.

  • RISCV_VEC_OK if successful

  • RISCV_VEC_FAIL if row or col is zero

Returns

  • RISCV_VEC_FAIL if row or col is zero

Row-Major Matrix Cholesky Decomposition Functions

These functions perform the Cholesky decomposition of an input matrix and store the results in a destination matrix. They return RISCV_VEC_FAIL if the decomposition fails.

The Cholesky decomposition of a matrix \(\mathtt{A}\) is a factorization in the following form:

\[ \mathtt{A = LL^{\scriptscriptstyle T}} \]

where \(\mathtt{L}\) is the destination matrix and is a real lower triangular matrix with positive diagonal entries.

VEC Library supports distinct functions for row-major matrices (both real and complex) in the following data types: F32, F16, and F64.

VEC Library also supports a batch version of the F32 row-major complex matrix Cholesky decomposition function, where the input and output consist of multiple continuous batches of row * col matrices.

riscv_vec_rmmat_cholesky_f32

Declaration
int riscv_vec_rmmat_cholesky_f32 (float32_t * src, float32_t * dst, uint32_t row, uint32_t col)
Description

Row-major matrix Cholesky decomposition function for F32.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in] src

Pointer to the input matrix

[out] dst

Pointer to the output matrix

[in] row

Number of rows in a matrix

[in] col

Number of columns in a matrix
Returns

  • RISCV_VEC_OK if successful

  • RISCV_VEC_FAIL if decomposition fails

riscv_vec_rmmat_cholesky_f16

Declaration
int riscv_vec_rmmat_cholesky_f16 (float16_t * src, float16_t * dst, uint32_t row, uint32_t col)
Description

Row-major matrix Cholesky decomposition function for F16.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in] src

Pointer to the input matrix

[out] dst

Pointer to the output matrix

[in] row

Number of rows in a matrix

[in] col

Number of columns in a matrix
Returns

  • RISCV_VEC_OK if successful

  • RISCV_VEC_FAIL if decomposition fails

Note

This function is supported only by toolchains that support hard-float. Additionally, you must apply the -mzfh option in both compiler and linker flags when using this function. For details about the -mzfh linking option, see Linking Options for Newlib and MCUlib Toolchains or Linking Options for Glibc Toolchains.

riscv_vec_rmmat_cholesky_f64

Declaration
int riscv_vec_rmmat_cholesky_f64 (float64_t * src, float64_t * dst, uint32_t row, uint32_t col)

[out] dst

[in] col

Returns

  • RISCV_VEC_OK if successful

  • RISCV_VEC_FAIL if decomposition fails

riscv_vec_rmcmat_cholesky_f32

Declaration
int riscv_vec_rmcmat_cholesky_f32 (float32_t * src, float32_t * dst, uint32_t row, uint32_t col)

int riscv_vec_rmcmat_cholesky_f64 (float64_t * src, float64_t * dst, uint32_t row, uint32_t col)

[out] dst

Returns

  • RISCV_VEC_FAIL if decomposition fails

riscv_vec_rmcmat_cholesky_batch_f32

Declaration
int riscv_vec_rmcmat_cholesky_batch_f32 (const float32_t * src_in, float32_t * dst_out, uint32_t row, uint32_t col, int batch)
Description

Row-major complex matrix Cholesky decomposition batch function for F32.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in] src_in

Pointer to the input complex matrix

[out] dst_out

Pointer to the output complex matrix

[in] row

Number of rows in a complex matrix

[in] col

Number of columns in a complex matrix

[in] batch

Number of input complex matrices
Returns

  • RISCV_VEC_OK if successful

  • RISCV_VEC_FAIL if decomposition fails

Note

This function allocates a temporary buffer (calculated as sizeof(float32_t) * row * col * batch) to improve performance. If there is not enough memory available for the allocation, the function returns RISCV_VEC_FAIL to indicate an error.

Row-Major Matrix LDLT Decomposition Functions

These functions perform the LDLT decomposition of an input matrix and store the results in the destination matrices. They return RISCV_VEC_FAIL if the decomposition fails.

The LDLT decomposition of a matrix \(\mathtt{A}\) is a factorization in the following form:

\[ \mathtt{PAP^{\scriptscriptstyle T}} = \mathtt{LDL^{\scriptscriptstyle T}} \]

where \(\mathtt{P}\) is the destination permutation vector, \(\mathtt{L}\) is the destination matrix and is a real lower unit triangular matrix, and \(\mathtt{D}\) is the destination diagonal matrix.

VEC Library supports distinct functions for row-major matrices in the following data types: F32 and F64.

riscv_vec_rmmat_ldlt_f32

Declaration
int riscv_vec_rmmat_ldlt_f32 (float32_t * src, float32_t * dstl, float32_t * dstd, uint16_t * pp, uint32_t row, uint32_t col)
Description

Row-major matrix LDLT decomposition function for F32.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in] src

Pointer to the input matrix

[out] dstl

Pointer to the output lower triangular matrix

[out] dstd

Pointer to the output lower diagonal matrix

[out] pp

Pointer to the output permutation vector

[in] row

Number of rows in a matrix

[in] col

Number of columns in a matrix
Returns

  • RISCV_VEC_OK if successful

  • RISCV_VEC_FAIL if decomposition fails

riscv_vec_rmmat_ldlt_f64

Declaration
int riscv_vec_rmmat_ldlt_f64 (float64_t * src, float64_t * dstl, float64_t * dstd, uint16_t * pp, uint32_t row, uint32_t col)
Description

Row-major matrix LDLT decomposition function for F64.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in] src

Pointer to the input matrix

[out] dstl

Pointer to the output lower triangular matrix

[out] dstd

Pointer to the output lower diagonal matrix

[out] pp

Pointer to the output permutation vector

[in] row

Number of rows in a matrix

[in] col

Number of columns in a matrix
Returns

  • RISCV_VEC_OK if successful

  • RISCV_VEC_FAIL if decomposition fails

Row-Major Matrix Solve Lower Triangular Functions

These functions perform a lower triangular decomposition on the input matrix and store the results in the destination matrix in row-major order.

The lower triangular decomposition is solved in the following form:

\[ \mathtt{Lx = A} \]

That is, the destination matrix \(\mathtt{x}\) can be obtained if given the input matrix \(\mathtt{A}\) and the lower triangular matrix \(\mathtt{L}\).

VEC Library supports distinct functions for the following data types: F32, F16, and F64.

riscv_vec_rmmat_solve_lt_f32

Declaration
int riscv_vec_rmmat_solve_lt_f32 (float32_t * lt, float32_t * A, float32_t * dst, uint32_t row, uint32_t col)
Description

Row-major matrix solve lower triangular function for F32.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in] lt

Pointer to the input lower triangular matrix

[in] A

Pointer to the input matrix

[out] dst

Pointer to the output matrix

[in] row

Number of rows in a matrix

[in] col

Number of columns in a matrix
Returns

  • RISCV_VEC_OK if successful

  • RISCV_VEC_FAIL if decomposition fails

riscv_vec_rmmat_solve_lt_f16

Declaration
int riscv_vec_rmmat_solve_lt_f16 (float16_t * lt, float16_t * A, float16_t * dst, uint32_t row, uint32_t col)
Description

Row-major matrix solve lower triangular function for F16.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in] lt

Pointer to the input lower triangular matrix

[in] A

Pointer to the input matrix

[out] dst

Pointer to the output matrix

[in] row

Number of rows in a matrix

[in] col

Number of columns in a matrix
Returns

  • RISCV_VEC_OK if successful

  • RISCV_VEC_FAIL if decomposition fails

Note

This function is supported only by toolchains that support hard-float. Additionally, you must apply the -mzfh option in both compiler and linker flags when using this function. For details about the -mzfh linking option, see Linking Options for Newlib and MCUlib Toolchains or Linking Options for Glibc Toolchains.

riscv_vec_rmmat_solve_lt_f64

Declaration
int riscv_vec_rmmat_solve_lt_f64 (float64_t * lt, float64_t * A, float64_t * dst, uint32_t row, uint32_t col)
Description

Row-major matrix solve lower triangular function for F64.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in] lt

Pointer to the input lower triangular matrix

[in] A

Pointer to the input matrix

[out] dst

Pointer to the output matrix

[in] row

Number of rows in a matrix

[in] col

Number of columns in a matrix
Returns

  • RISCV_VEC_OK if successful

  • RISCV_VEC_FAIL if decomposition fails

Row-Major Matrix Solve Upper Triangular Functions

These functions perform an upper triangular decomposition on the input matrix and stores the results in the destination matrix in row-major order.

The upper triangular decomposition is solved in the following form:

\[ \mathtt{Ux = A} \]

That is, the destination matrix \(\mathtt{x}\) can be obtained if given the input matrix \(\mathtt{A}\) and upper triangular matrix \(\mathtt{U}\).

VEC Library supports distinct functions for the following data types: F32, F16, and F64.

riscv_vec_rmmat_solve_ut_f32

Declaration
int riscv_vec_rmmat_solve_ut_f32 (float32_t * lt, float32_t * A, float32_t * dst, uint32_t row, uint32_t col)
Description

Row-major matrix solve upper triangular function for F32.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in] lt

Pointer to the input upper triangular matrix

[in] A

Pointer to the input matrix

[out] dst

Pointer to the output matrix

[in] row

Number of rows in a matrix

[in] col

Number of columns in a matrix
Returns

  • RISCV_VEC_OK if successful

  • RISCV_VEC_FAIL if decomposition fails

riscv_vec_rmmat_solve_ut_f16

Declaration
int riscv_vec_rmmat_solve_ut_f16 (float16_t * lt, float16_t * A, float16_t * dst, uint32_t row, uint32_t col)
Description

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

[in] col

  • RISCV_VEC_FAIL if decomposition fails

For details about the -mzfh linking option, see Linking Options for Newlib and MCUlib Toolchains or Linking Options for Glibc Toolchains.

Number of rows in a matrix

[in] col

Number of columns in a matrix
Returns

  • RISCV_VEC_OK if successful

  • RISCV_VEC_FAIL if decomposition fails

Row-Major Matrix Inverse Functions

Row-major matrix inverse functions return the inverse of a square matrix in row-major order. Since a square matrix has equal dimensions in both horizontal and vertical directions, the function accepts a single parameter (e.g., size) to specify the number of rows and columns. This not only prevents receiving different values for rows and columns but also slightly improves performance.

Matrix inverse functions use Gauss-Jordan elimination to find the inverse of a matrix. First, the output matrix is initialized with 0s and 1s to form an identity matrix. Then, elementary row operations are applied simultaneously to both input and output matrices, transforming the input matrix into an identity matrix.

If the original input matrix is invertible, the function transforms the output matrix into its inverse and returns RISCV_VEC_OK. The behavior can be defined as follows:

\[ \mathtt{ \left[ A \mid I \right] \xrightarrow{} \text{elementary row operations} \xrightarrow{} \left[ I \mid A^{\scriptstyle -1} \right] } \]

where \(\mathtt{A}\) is the input matrix and \(\mathtt{A^{\scriptstyle -1}}\) is its inverse matrix. Additionally, \(\mathtt{I}\) is an identity matrix generated in the output matrix before elementary row operations and found in the input matrix after the operations.

If the pivot value is zero during elementary row operations, the function searches for a non-zero pivot in the subsequent rows. Once it is found, it swaps the two rows and continues with the elementary row operations until the input matrix is transformed into an identity matrix. If no non-zero pivot is available, the function returns RISCV_VEC_FAIL, indicating that the input matrix is singular.

riscv_vec_rmmat_inv_f32

Declaration
int riscv_vec_rmmat_inv_f32 (float32_t * src, float32_t * dst, uint32_t size)
Description

Row-major matrix inverse function for F32.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in] src

Pointer to the input matrix

[out] dst

Pointer to the output matrix

[in] size

Number of rows/columns in a matrix (i.e., size = rows = columns)
Returns

  • RISCV_VEC_OK if successful

  • RISCV_VEC_FAIL if size is zero or a non-zero pivot is unavailable

Note

  • If the returned value is RISCV_VEC_OK, the input matrix is invertible and has been transformed into an identity matrix. If the returned value is RISCV_VEC_FAIL, the input matrix is singular.

  • Regardless of the returned value, both the input and output matrices are modified when the matrix inverse function is executed.

riscv_vec_rmmat_inv_f16

Declaration
int riscv_vec_rmmat_inv_f16 (float16_t * src, float16_t * dst, uint32_t size)
Description

Row-major matrix inverse function for F16.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in] src

Pointer to the input matrix

[out] dst

Pointer to the output matrix

[in] size

Number of rows/columns in a matrix (i.e., size = rows = columns)
Returns

  • RISCV_VEC_OK if successful

  • RISCV_VEC_FAIL if size is zero or a non-zero pivot is unavailable

Note

  • If the returned value is RISCV_VEC_OK, the input matrix is invertible and has been transformed into an identity matrix. If the returned value is RISCV_VEC_FAIL, the input matrix is singular.

  • Regardless of the returned value, both the input and output matrices are modified when the matrix inverse function is executed.

  • This function is supported only by toolchains that support hard-float. Additionally, you must apply the -mzfh option in both compiler and linker flags when using this function. For details about the -mzfh linking option, see Linking Options for Newlib and MCUlib Toolchains or Linking Options for Glibc Toolchains.

  • If the returned value is RISCV_VEC_OK, the input matrix is invertible and has been transformed into an identity matrix. If the returned value is RISCV_VEC_FAIL, the input matrix is singular.

  • Regardless of the returned value, both the input and output matrices are modified when the matrix inverse function is executed.

Row-Major Complex Matrix Transpose Functions

These functions transpose a complex matrix and store the results in a destination complex matrix in row-major order.

riscv_vec_rmcmat_trans_f32

Declaration
int riscv_vec_rmcmat_trans_f32 (const float32_t * src, float32_t * dst, uint32_t row, uint32_t col)

Parameters

Parameter Description

[in] src

Pointer to the input complex matrix

[out] dst

Pointer to the output complex matrix

[in] row

Number of rows in a complex matrix

[in] col

Number of columns in a complex matrix
Returns

  • RISCV_VEC_OK if successful

  • RISCV_VEC_FAIL if row or col is zero

Row-Major Matrix General Matrix Multiplication (GEMM) Functions

These functions compute the multiplication of two source matrices in the following form and store the results in a destination matrix, also in row-major order:

\[ \mathtt{C = \alpha A B + \beta C} \]

where \(\mathtt{\alpha}\) and \(\mathtt{\beta}\) are constant scalars.

The ordinary matrix multiplication (see associated functions in Row-Major Matrix Multiplication Functions) can be performed by setting \(\mathtt{\alpha}\) to one and \(\mathtt{\beta}\) to zero.

riscv_vec_rmmat_gemm_f32

Declaration
int riscv_vec_rmmat_gemm_f32 (const float32_t * src1, const float32_t * src2, float32_t * dst, const float32_t alpha, const float32_t beta, uint32_t row, uint32_t col, uint32_t col2)
Description

Row-major matrix GEMM function for F32.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in] src1

Pointer to the first input matrix

[in] src2

Pointer to the second input matrix

[out] dst

Pointer to the output matrix

[in] alpha

Constant alpha value

[in] beta

Constant beta value

[in] row

Number of rows in the first input matrix

[in] col

Number of columns in the first input matrix

[in] col2

Number of columns in the second input matrix
Returns

  • RISCV_VEC_OK if successful

  • RISCV_VEC_FAIL if allocation fails

Note

If col2 exceeds 1024, the function allocates a 64 KB temporary buffer (calculated as sizeof(float32_t) * 128 * 128) to reduce D-Cache misses and improve performance. If there is not enough memory available for the allocation, the function returns RISCV_VEC_FAIL to indicate an error.

riscv_vec_rmmat_gemm_q15

Declaration
int riscv_vec_rmmat_gemm_q15 (const q15_t * src1, const q15_t * src2, q15_t * dst, const q15_t alpha, const q15_t beta, uint32_t row, uint32_t col, uint32_t col2, int32_t shift)
Description

Row-major matrix GEMM function for Q15.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in] src1

Pointer to the first input matrix

[in] src2

Pointer to the second input matrix

[out] dst

Pointer to the output matrix

[in] alpha

Constant alpha value

[in] beta

Constant beta value

[in] row

Number of rows in the first input matrix

[in] col

Number of columns in the first input matrix

[in] col2

Number of columns in the second input matrix

[in] shift

Signed shift value
Returns

  • RISCV_VEC_OK if successful

  • RISCV_VEC_FAIL if allocation fails

Note

This function allocates a temporary buffer (calculated as sizeof(q63_t) * row * col2) for storing intermediate calculations. If col2 exceeds 2048, the function allocates a 32 KB temporary buffer (calculated as sizeof(q15_t) * 128 * 128) to reduce D-Cache misses and improve performance. If there is not enough memory available for the allocation, the function returns RISCV_VEC_FAIL to indicate an error.

  • RISCV_VEC_FAIL if allocation fails

Note

If col2 exceeds 256, the function allocates a 64 KB temporary buffer (calculated as sizeof(float64_t) * 64 * 64 * 2) to reduce D-Cache misses and improve performance. If there is not enough memory available for the allocation, the function returns RISCV_VEC_FAIL to indicate an error.

riscv_vec_rmcmat_mul_q15

Declaration
int riscv_vec_rmcmat_mul_q15 (const q15_t * src1, const q15_t * src2, q15_t * dst, uint32_t row, uint32_t col, uint32_t col2)
Description

Row-major complex matrix multiplication function for Q15.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in] src1

Pointer to the first input complex matrix

[in] src2

Pointer to the second input complex matrix

[out] dst

Pointer to the output complex matrix

[in] row

Number of rows in the first input complex matrix

[in] col

Number of columns in the first input complex matrix

[in] col2

Number of columns in the second input complex matrix
Returns

  • RISCV_VEC_OK if successful

  • RISCV_VEC_FAIL if allocation fails

Note

This function allocates a temporary buffer (calculated as sizeof(q63_t) * row * col2 * 2) to store the intermediate calculation. If col2 exceeds 128, the function allocates a 64 KB temporary buffer (calculated as sizeof(q15_t) * 128 * 128 * 2) to reduce D-Cache misses and improve performance. If there is not enough memory available for the allocation, the function returns RISCV_VEC_FAIL to indicate an error.

Row-Major Complex Matrix General Matrix Multiplication (CGEMM) Functions

These functions compute the multiplication of two source complex matrices in the following form and store the results in a destination complex matrix, also in row-major order:

\[ \mathtt{C = \alpha A B + \beta C} \]

where \(\mathtt{\alpha}\) and \(\mathtt{\beta}\) are constant scalars.

The ordinary matrix multiplication (see associated functions in Row-Major Complex Matrix Multiplication Functions) can be performed by setting \(\mathtt{\alpha}\) to one and \(\mathtt{\beta}\) to zero.

riscv_vec_rmcmat_gemm_f32

Declaration
int riscv_vec_rmcmat_gemm_f32 (const float32_t * src1, const float32_t * src2, float32_t * dst, float32_t alpha, float32_t beta, uint32_t row, uint32_t col, uint32_t col2)

Row-Major Matrix Outer Product Function

This function computes the multiplication of two source vectors and stores the results in a destination matrix.

The following matrix shows the multiplication of vector \(\mathtt{A}\) by vector \(\mathtt{B}\), in which vector \(\mathtt{A}\) has three rows and vector \(\mathtt{B}\) has four columns.

\[ \begin{bmatrix} \mathtt{A_{\scriptscriptstyle 11}} \\ \mathtt{A_{\scriptscriptstyle 21}} \\ \mathtt{A_{\scriptscriptstyle 31}} \end{bmatrix} * \begin{bmatrix} \mathtt{B_{\scriptscriptstyle 11}} & \mathtt{B_{\scriptscriptstyle 12}} & \mathtt{B_{\scriptscriptstyle 13}} & \mathtt{B_{\scriptscriptstyle 14}} \end{bmatrix} = \begin{bmatrix} \mathtt{A_{\scriptscriptstyle 11} * B_{\scriptscriptstyle 11}} & \mathtt{A_{\scriptscriptstyle 11} * B_{\scriptscriptstyle 12}} & \mathtt{A_{\scriptscriptstyle 11} * B_{\scriptscriptstyle 13}} & \mathtt{A_{\scriptscriptstyle 11} * B_{\scriptscriptstyle 14}} \\ \mathtt{A_{\scriptscriptstyle 21} * B_{\scriptscriptstyle 11}} & \mathtt{A_{\scriptscriptstyle 21} * B_{\scriptscriptstyle 12}} & \mathtt{A_{\scriptscriptstyle 21} * B_{\scriptscriptstyle 13}} & \mathtt{A_{\scriptscriptstyle 21} * B_{\scriptscriptstyle 14}} \\ \mathtt{A_{\scriptscriptstyle 31} * B_{\scriptscriptstyle 11}} & \mathtt{A_{\scriptscriptstyle 31} * B_{\scriptscriptstyle 12}} & \mathtt{A_{\scriptscriptstyle 31} * B_{\scriptscriptstyle 13}} & \mathtt{A_{\scriptscriptstyle 31} * B_{\scriptscriptstyle 14}} \end{bmatrix} \]

The outer product can be treated as a matrix multiplication where the source matrices \(\mathtt{A_{\scriptscriptstyle ij}}\) and \(\mathtt{B_{\scriptscriptstyle jk}}\) have the constraint that \(\mathtt{j}\) must be 1, as shown below.

\[ \mathtt{ C_{\scriptscriptstyle ik} = A_{\scriptscriptstyle ij} * B_{\scriptscriptstyle jk} } \]

where \(\mathtt{j = 1}\).

VEC Library only supports the function for the Q31 data type.

riscv_vec_rmmat_oprod_q31

Declaration
void riscv_vec_rmmat_oprod_q31 (const q31_t * src1, const q31_t * src2, q31_t * dst, uint32_t size1, uint32_t size2)
Description

Row-major matrix outer product for Q31.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in] src1

Pointer to the first input matrix with a size of size1 * 1

[in] src2

Pointer to the second input matrix with a size of 1 * size2

[out] dst

Pointer to the output matrix with a size of size1 * size2

[in] size1

Number of rows in the first input matrix

[in] size2

Number of columns in the second input matrix
Note

This function multiplies a one-column matrix with size1 rows, src1[size1, 1], with a one-row matrix with size2 columns, src2[1, size2], and stores the results in a matrix with size1 rows and size2 columns, dst[size1, size2]. It achieves better efficiency for vector-wise matrix multiplication compared to regular matrix multiplication.

Row-Major Matrix Multiplies Vector Functions

These functions compute the multiplication of a matrix and a vector and store the results in a destination vector.

According to the definition of matrix multiplication, the number of elements in the multiplier vector must be identical with the number of columns in the multiplicand matrix.

VEC Library supports distinct functions for the following data types: single- and half-precision floating-point, Q31, Q15, and Q7. These functions are described in the subsections below.

riscv_vec_rmmat_mul_mxv_f32

Declaration
void riscv_vec_rmmat_mul_mxv_f32 (const float32_t * src1, const float32_t * src2, float32_t * dst, uint32_t row, uint32_t col)
Description

Row-major matrix multiplies vector function for F32.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in] src1

Pointer to an input matrix

[in] src2

Pointer to an input vector

[out] dst

Pointer to the output vector

[in] row

Number of rows in the matrix

[in] col

Number of columns in the input matrix and the input vector size

riscv_vec_rmmat_mul_mxv_f16

For details about the -mzfh linking option, see Linking Options for Newlib and MCUlib Toolchains or Linking Options for Glibc Toolchains.

Row-Major Matrix Householder Transform Functions

These functions perform the Householder transform of a vector \(\mathtt{x}\), producing a vector \(\mathtt{v}\) with \(\mathtt{\|v\| = 1}\) and a scalar \(\mathtt{\beta}\), such that \(\mathtt{H = I - \beta vv^{\scriptstyle T}}\) and \(\mathtt{Hx = \|x\|_{2}e_{1}}\).

In this case, \(\mathtt{H}\) is an orthogonal matrix and a hyperplane reflection, transforming \(\mathtt{x}\) into a vector proportional to \(\mathtt{e_{\scriptscriptstyle 1}}\), which has the following coordinates:

\[ \begin{pmatrix} \mathtt{1} \\ \mathtt{0} \\ \mathtt{\vdots} \end{pmatrix} \]

If \(\mathtt{x}\) is already proportional to \(\mathtt{e_{\scriptscriptstyle 1}}\), the matrix \(\mathtt{H}\) will be the identity matrix.

The Householder transform functions also help detect whether \(\mathtt{x}\) is already proportional to \(\mathtt{e_{\scriptscriptstyle 1}}\).

Give \(\mathtt{x}\) in the form:

\[ \mathtt{x = \begin{pmatrix} \mathtt{x_{0}} \\ \mathtt{xr} \end{pmatrix}} \]

where \(\mathtt{xr}\) is a vector, the algorithm computes the norm squared of \(\mathtt{xr}\) using \(\mathtt{\|xr\|^{\scriptstyle 2}}\). This value is compared to a threshold, which is provided as an argument to the function. If the value is less than the threshold, the algorithm returns 0 for \(\mathtt{\beta}\) and the householder vector, indicating that \(\mathtt{x}\) is already proportional to \(\mathtt{e_{\scriptscriptstyle 1}}\).

VEC Library supports distinct functions for the following data types: single-, half-, and double-precision floating-point. These functions are described in the subsections below.

riscv_vec_rmmat_householder_f32

Declaration
float32_t riscv_vec_rmmat_householder_f32 (const float32_t * src, const float32_t threshold, uint32_t size, float32_t * dst)
Description

Row-major matrix Householder transform function for F32.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in] src

Pointer to the input vector

[in] threshold

Norm2 threshold

[in] size

Number of size in a vector

[out] dst

Pointer to the output vector
Returns

The scaling factor beta

riscv_vec_rmmat_householder_f16

Declaration
float16_t riscv_vec_rmmat_householder_f16 (const float16_t * src, const float16_t threshold, uint32_t size, float16_t * dst)
Description

Row-major matrix Householder transform function for F16.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in] src

Pointer to the input vector

[in] threshold

Norm2 threshold

[in] size

Number of size in a vector

[out] dst

Pointer to the output vector
Returns

The scaling factor beta

Note

This function is supported only by toolchains that support hard-float. Additionally, you must apply the -mzfh option in both compiler and linker flags when using this function. For details about the -mzfh linking option, see Linking Options for Newlib and MCUlib Toolchains or Linking Options for Glibc Toolchains.

riscv_vec_rmmat_householder_f64

Declaration
float64_t riscv_vec_rmmat_householder_f64 (const float64_t * src, const float64_t threshold, uint32_t size, float64_t * dst)
Description

Row-major matrix Householder transform function for F64.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in] src

Pointer to the input vector

[in] threshold

Norm2 threshold

[in] size

Number of size in a vector

[out] dst

Pointer to the output vector
Returns

The scaling factor beta

Row-Major Matrix QR Decomposition Functions

These functions perform the QR decomposition of a matrix \(\mathtt{M}\) using the Householder algorithm, \(\mathtt{M = QR}\), where \(\mathtt{Q}\) is an orthogonal matrix and \(\mathtt{R}\) is an upper triangular matrix.

The returned value for \(\mathtt{R}\) has the structure:

\[ \begin{pmatrix} \mathtt{r_{\scriptscriptstyle{11}}} & \mathtt{r_{\scriptscriptstyle{12}}} & \dots & \mathtt{r_{\scriptscriptstyle{1n}}} \\ \mathtt{v_{\scriptscriptstyle{12}}} & \mathtt{r_{\scriptscriptstyle{22}}} & \dots & \mathtt{r_{\scriptscriptstyle{2n}}} \\ \mathtt{v_{\scriptscriptstyle{13}}} & \mathtt{v_{\scriptscriptstyle{23}}} & \dots & \mathtt{r_{\scriptscriptstyle{3n}}} \\ \vdots & \vdots & \ddots & \vdots \\ \mathtt{v_{\scriptscriptstyle{1m}}} & \mathtt{v_{\scriptscriptstyle{2(m-1)}}} & \dots & \mathtt{r_{\scriptscriptstyle{mn}}} \end{pmatrix} \]

where the first Householder reflector is as follows:

\[ \mathtt{ v_{\scriptscriptstyle{1}} = \begin{pmatrix} \mathtt{1} \\ \mathtt{v_{\scriptscriptstyle{12}}} \\ \vdots \\ \mathtt{v_{\scriptscriptstyle{1m}}} \end{pmatrix} } \]

The function returns a vector \(\mathtt{\tau}\) that contains the scaling factor for reflectors.

The Householder matrix is given by \(\mathtt{H_{\scriptscriptstyle{1}}}\), in which:

\[ \mathtt{ H_{\scriptscriptstyle{1}} = I - \mathtt{\tau_{\scriptscriptstyle{1}}} \mathtt{v_{\scriptscriptstyle{1}}} \mathtt{v_{\scriptscriptstyle{1}}^{\scriptscriptstyle{T}}} } \]

The computation of the matrix \(\mathtt{Q}\) is optional. That is, the matrix \(\mathtt{Q}\) can be the product of the Householder matrices \(\mathtt{(Q = H_{1} \, \, H_{2} \, \, \dots \, \, H_{n})}\) or not computed.

The matrix \(\mathtt{R}\) is the returned value for \(\mathtt{R}\) without the Householder reflectors:

\[ \begin{pmatrix} \mathtt{r_{\scriptscriptstyle{11}}} & \mathtt{r_{\scriptscriptstyle{12}}} & \dots & \mathtt{r_{\scriptscriptstyle{1n}}} \\ \mathtt{0} & \mathtt{r_{\scriptscriptstyle{22}}} & \dots & \mathtt{r_{\scriptscriptstyle{2n}}} \\ \mathtt{0} & \mathtt{v_{\scriptscriptstyle{22}}} & \dots & \mathtt{r_{\scriptscriptstyle{3n}}} \\ \vdots & \vdots & \ddots & \vdots \\ \mathtt{0} & \mathtt{0} & \dots & \mathtt{r_{\scriptscriptstyle{mn}}} \end{pmatrix} \]

VEC Library supports distinct functions for the following data types: single-, half-, and double-precision floating-point. These functions are described in the subsections below.

riscv_vec_rmmat_qr_f32

Declaration
int riscv_vec_rmmat_qr_f32 (const float32_t * src, const float32_t threshold, float32_t * dstR, float32_t * dstQ, float32_t * tau, float32_t * pTmpA, float32_t * pTmpB, const uint32_t row, const uint32_t col)
Description

Row-major matrix QR decomposition function for F32.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in] src

Pointer to the input matrix whose size is row * col

[in] threshold

Norm2 threshold

[out] dstR

Pointer to the output matrix \(\mathtt{R}\) whose size is row * col

[out] dstQ

Pointer to the output matrix \(\mathtt{Q}\) whose size is row * row
(can be NULL)

[out] tau

Pointer to the householder scaling factor whose size is col

[in] pTmpA

Pointer to the temporary vector whose size is row

[in] pTmpB

Pointer to the temporary vector whose size is row

[in] row

Number of rows in a matrix

[in] col

Number of columns in a matrix
Returns

  • RISCV_VEC_OK if successful

  • RISCV_VEC_FAIL if decomposition fails

Note

  • The function performs the QR decomposition of a row * col matrix with row ≥ col.

  • The dstQ parameter can be a NULL pointer. If it is NULL, the parameter is ignored, and the output matrix \(\mathtt{Q}\) will not be computed.

riscv_vec_rmmat_qr_f16

Declaration
int riscv_vec_rmmat_qr_f16 (const float16_t * src, const float16_t threshold, float16_t * dstR, float16_t * dstQ, float16_t * tau, float16_t * pTmpA, float16_t * pTmpB, const uint32_t row, const uint32_t col)
Description

Row-major matrix QR decomposition function for F16.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in] src

Pointer to the input matrix whose size is row * col

[in] threshold

Norm2 threshold

[out] dstR

Pointer to the output matrix \(\mathtt{R}\) whose size is row * col

[out] dstQ

Pointer to the output matrix \(\mathtt{Q}\) whose size is row * row
(can be NULL)

[out] tau

Pointer to the householder scaling factor whose size is col

[in] pTmpA

Pointer to the temporary vector whose size is row

[in] pTmpB

Pointer to the temporary vector whose size is row

[in] row

Number of rows in a matrix

[in] col

Number of columns in a matrix
Returns

  • RISCV_VEC_OK if successful

  • RISCV_VEC_FAIL if decomposition fails

Note

  • The function performs the QR decomposition of a row * col matrix with row ≥ col.

  • The dstQ parameter can be a NULL pointer. If it is NULL, the parameter is ignored, and the output matrix \(\mathtt{Q}\) will not be computed.

  • This function is supported only by toolchains that support hard-float. Additionally, you must apply the -mzfh option in both compiler and linker flags when using this function. For details about the -mzfh linking option, see Linking Options for Newlib and MCUlib Toolchains or Linking Options for Glibc Toolchains.

riscv_vec_rmmat_qr_f64

Declaration
int riscv_vec_rmmat_qr_f64 (const float64_t * src, const float64_t threshold, float64_t * dstR, float64_t * dstQ, float64_t * tau, float64_t * pTmpA, float64_t * pTmpB, const uint32_t row, const uint32_t col)
Description

Row-major matrix QR decomposition function for F64.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in] src

Pointer to the input matrix whose size is row * col

[in] threshold

Norm2 threshold

[out] dstR

Pointer to the output R matrix whose size is row * col

[out] dstQ

Pointer to the output Q matrix whose size is row * row
(can be NULL)

[out] tau

Pointer to the householder scaling factor whose size is col

[in] pTmpA

Pointer to the temporary vector whose size is row

[in] pTmpB

Pointer to the temporary vector whose size is row

[in] row

Number of rows in a matrix

[in] col

Number of columns in a matrix
Returns

  • RISCV_VEC_OK if successful

  • RISCV_VEC_FAIL if decomposition fails

Note

  • The function performs the QR decomposition of a row * col matrix with row ≥ col.

  • The dstQ parameter can be a NULL pointer. If it is NULL, the parameter is ignored, and the output matrix \(\mathtt{Q}\) will not be computed.

Row-Major Matrix General Matrix Vector Multiplication (GEMV) Functions

These functions compute the multiplication of a matrix and a vector in the following form and store the results in a destination vector.

\[ \mathtt{C = \alpha A B + \beta C} \]

where \(\mathtt{\alpha}\) and \(\mathtt{\beta}\) are constant scalars.

The ordinary matrix multiplies vector (see associated functions in Row-Major Matrix Multiplies Vector Functions) can be performed by setting \(\mathtt{\alpha}\) to one and \(\mathtt{\beta}\) to zero.

riscv_vec_rmmat_gemv_f32

Declaration
void riscv_vec_rmmat_gemv_f32 (const float32_t * src1, const float32_t * src2, float32_t * dst, const float32_t alpha, const float32_t beta, uint32_t row, uint32_t col)
Description

Row-major matrix GEMV function for F32.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in] src1

Pointer to an input matrix

[in] src2

Pointer to an input vector

[out] dst

Pointer to the output vector

[in] alpha

Constant alpha value

[in] beta

Constant beta value

[in] row

Number of rows in the matrix

[in] col

Number of columns in the input matrix and the input vector size

riscv_vec_rmmat_gemv_f16

Declaration
void riscv_vec_rmmat_gemv_f16 (const float16_t * src1, const float16_t * src2, float16_t * dst, const float16_t alpha, const float16_t beta, uint32_t row, uint32_t col)
Description

Row-major matrix GEMV function for F16.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in] src1

Pointer to an input matrix

[in] src2

Pointer to an input vector

[out] dst

Pointer to the output vector

[in] alpha

Constant alpha value

[in] beta

Constant beta value

[in] row

Number of rows in the matrix

[in] col

Number of columns in the input matrix and the input vector size
Note

This function is supported only by toolchains that support hard-float. Additionally, you must apply the -mzfh option in both compiler and linker flags when using this function. For details about the -mzfh linking option, see Linking Options for Newlib and MCUlib Toolchains or Linking Options for Glibc Toolchains.

riscv_vec_rmmat_gemv_q31

void riscv_vec_rmmat_gemv_q31 (const q31_t * src1, const q31_t * src2, q31_t * dst, const q31_t alpha, const q31_t beta, uint32_t row, uint32_t col)

[in] col

Column-Major Matrix Functions

VEC Library also supports accessing matrix elements in column-major order, with functions prefixed as riscv_vec_cmmat.

It provides column-major matrix operations such as addition, subtraction, multiplication, determinant, identity, transpose, and inverse for three matrix types: MAT2x2, MAT3x3, and MAT4x4.

In these functions, matrices are stored as vectors in column-major order, and the count parameter specifies the number of matrices to process. The data structures for these matrix types are described in Data Structures for Column-Major Matrix Functions.

Data Structures for Column-Major Matrix Functions

This section describes the data structures used in column-major matrix functions.

struct riscv_vec_cmmat2x2_f32_t

The structure of the floating-point 2x2 column-major matrix (MAT2x2) is defined as follows:

typedef struct
{
    riscv_vec_f32x2_t c1;
    riscv_vec_f32x2_t c2;
} riscv_vec_cmmat2x2_f32_t;

where:

c1

Represents column1 of the 2x2 matrix, consisting of two F32 elements

c2

Represents column2 of the 2x2 matrix, consisting of two F32 elements

struct riscv_vec_cmmat3x3_f32_t

The structure of the floating-point 3x3 column-major matrix (MAT3x3) is defined as follows:

typedef struct
{
    riscv_vec_f32x3_t c1;
    riscv_vec_f32x3_t c2;
         riscv_vec_f32x3_t c3;
} riscv_vec_cmmat3x3_f32_t;

where:

c1

Represents column1 of the 3x3 matrix, consisting of three F32 elements

c2

Represents column2 of the 3x3 matrix, consisting of three F32 elements

c3

Represents column3 of the 3x3 matrix, consisting of three F32 elements

struct riscv_vec_cmmat4x4_f32_t

The structure of the floating-point column-major 4x4 matrix (MAT4x4) is defined as follows:

typedef struct
{
    riscv_vec_f32x4_t c1;
    riscv_vec_f32x4_t c2;
         riscv_vec_f32x4_t c3;
         riscv_vec_f32x4_t c4;
} riscv_vec_cmmat4x4_f32_t;

where:

c1

Represents column1 of the 4x4 matrix, consisting of four F32 elements

c2

Represents column2 of the 4x4 matrix, consisting of four F32 elements

c3

Represents column3 of the 4x4 matrix, consisting of four F32 elements

c4

Represents column4 of the 4x4 matrix, consisting of four F32 elements

Column-Major Matrix Addition Functions

These functions add corresponding elements from two source matrices and store the results one-by-one in a destination matrix, also in column-major order.

riscv_vec_cmmat2x2_add_f32

Declaration
int riscv_vec_cmmat2x2_add_f32 (riscv_vec_cmmat2x2_f32_t * dst, riscv_vec_cmmat2x2_f32_t * src1, riscv_vec_cmmat2x2_f32_t * src2, uint32_t count)
Description

Column-major matrix addition function for MAT2x2.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[out] dst

Pointer to the output matrix

[in] src1

Pointer to the first input matrix

[in] src2

Pointer to the second input matrix

[in] count

Number of matrices to be processed. Each matrix has a data type of riscv_vec_cmmat2x2_f32_t.
Returns

RISCV_VEC_OK

Example

The following equations show the addition of two MAT2x2 matrices and the results.

\[ \begin{bmatrix} \mathtt{0.1} & \mathtt{0.4} \\ \mathtt{-0.2} & \mathtt{0.1} \end{bmatrix} + \begin{bmatrix} \mathtt{-0.2} & \mathtt{-0.1} \\ \mathtt{0.3} & \mathtt{0.5} \end{bmatrix} = \begin{bmatrix} \mathtt{-0.1} & \mathtt{0.3} \\ \mathtt{0.1} & \mathtt{0.6} \end{bmatrix}, \quad \begin{bmatrix} \mathtt{0.3} & \mathtt{0.4} \\ \mathtt{0.2} & \mathtt{0.2} \end{bmatrix} + \begin{bmatrix} \mathtt{-0.2} & \mathtt{0.1} \\ \mathtt{0.3} & \mathtt{-0.3} \end{bmatrix} = \begin{bmatrix} \mathtt{0.1} & \mathtt{0.5} \\ \mathtt{0.5} & \mathtt{-0.1} \end{bmatrix} \]

 

The code example with this function is as follows:

#define count    2
riscv_vec_cmmat2x2_f32_t src1[count] = {
{{0.1, -0.2}, {0.4, 0.1}}, {{0.3, 0.2}, {0.4, 0.2}}
};
riscv_vec_cmmat2x2_f32_t src2[count] = {
{{-0.2, 0.3}, {-0.1, 0.5}}, {{-0.2, 0.3}, {0.1, -0.3}}
};
riscv_vec_cmmat2x2_f32_t dst[count];
riscv_vec_cmmat2x2_add_f32 (dst, src1, src2, count);

This example also serves as a reference for examples of MAT3x3 and MAT4x4 column-major matrix addition functions.

riscv_vec_cmmat3x3_add_f32

Declaration
int riscv_vec_cmmat3x3_add_f32 (riscv_vec_cmmat3x3_f32_t * dst, riscv_vec_cmmat3x3_f32_t * src1, riscv_vec_cmmat3x3_f32_t * src2, uint32_t count)
Description

Column-major matrix addition function for MAT3x3.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[out] dst

Pointer to the output matrix

[in] src1

Pointer to the first input matrix

[in] src2

Pointer to the second input matrix

[in] count

Number of matrices to be processed. Each matrix has a data type of riscv_vec_cmmat3x3_f32_t.
Returns

RISCV_VEC_OK

riscv_vec_cmmat4x4_add_f32

Declaration
int riscv_vec_cmmat4x4_add_f32 (riscv_vec_cmmat4x4_f32_t * dst, riscv_vec_cmmat4x4_f32_t * src1, riscv_vec_cmmat4x4_f32_t * src2, uint32_t count)
Description

Column-major matrix addition function for MAT4x4.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[out] dst

Pointer to the output matrix

[in] src1

Pointer to the first input matrix

[in] src2

Pointer to the second input matrix

[in] count

Number of matrices to be processed. Each matrix has a data type of riscv_vec_cmmat4x4_f32_t.
Returns

RISCV_VEC_OK

Column-Major Matrix Subtraction Functions

These functions subtract two matrices of the same dimensions and store the results in a destination matrix, also in column-major order.

riscv_vec_cmmat2x2_sub_f32

Declaration
int riscv_vec_cmmat2x2_sub_f32 (riscv_vec_cmmat2x2_f32_t * dst, riscv_vec_cmmat2x2_f32_t * src1, riscv_vec_cmmat2x2_f32_t * src2, uint32_t count)
Description

Column-major matrix subtraction function for MAT2x2.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[out] dst

Pointer to the output matrix

[in] src1

Pointer to the first input matrix

[in] src2

Pointer to the second input matrix

[in] count

Number of matrices to be processed. Each matrix has a data type of riscv_vec_cmmat2x2_f32_t.
Returns

RISCV_VEC_OK

Example

The following equation shows the subtraction of two MAT2x2 matrices and the results.

\[ \begin{bmatrix} \mathtt{0.1} & \mathtt{0.4} \\ \mathtt{-0.2} & \mathtt{0.1} \end{bmatrix} - \begin{bmatrix} \mathtt{-0.2} & \mathtt{-0.1} \\ \mathtt{0.3} & \mathtt{0.5} \end{bmatrix} = \begin{bmatrix} \mathtt{0.3} & \mathtt{0.5} \\ \mathtt{-0.5} & \mathtt{-0.4} \end{bmatrix}, \quad \begin{bmatrix} \mathtt{0.3} & \mathtt{0.4} \\ \mathtt{0.2} & \mathtt{0.2} \end{bmatrix} - \begin{bmatrix} \mathtt{-0.2} & \mathtt{0.1} \\ \mathtt{0.3} & \mathtt{-0.3} \end{bmatrix} = \begin{bmatrix} \mathtt{0.5} & \mathtt{0.3} \\ \mathtt{-0.1} & \mathtt{0.5} \end{bmatrix} \]

 

The code example with this function is as follows:

#define count    2
riscv_vec_cmmat2x2_f32_t src1[count] = {
{{0.1, -0.2}, {0.4, 0.1}}, {{0.3, 0.2}, {0.4, 0.2}}
};
riscv_vec_cmmat2x2_f32_t src2[count] = {
{{-0.2, 0.3}, {-0.1, 0.5}}, {{-0.2, 0.3}, {0.1, -0.3}}
};
riscv_vec_cmmat2x2_f32_t dst[count];
riscv_vec_cmmat2x2_sub_f32 (dst, src1, src2, count);

This example also serves as a reference for examples of MAT3x3 and MAT4x4 column-major matrix subtraction functions.

riscv_vec_cmmat3x3_sub_f32

Declaration
int riscv_vec_cmmat3x3_sub_f32 (riscv_vec_cmmat3x3_f32_t * dst, riscv_vec_cmmat3x3_f32_t * src1, riscv_vec_cmmat3x3_f32_t * src2, uint32_t count)
Description

Column-major matrix subtraction function for MAT3x3.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[out] dst

Pointer to the output matrix

[in] src1

Pointer to the first input matrix

[in] src2

Pointer to the second input matrix

[in] count

Number of matrices to be processed. Each matrix has a data type of riscv_vec_cmmat3x3_f32_t.
Returns

RISCV_VEC_OK

riscv_vec_cmmat4x4_sub_f32

Declaration
int riscv_vec_cmmat4x4_sub_f32 (riscv_vec_cmmat4x4_f32_t * dst, riscv_vec_cmmat4x4_f32_t * src1, riscv_vec_cmmat4x4_f32_t * src2, uint32_t count)

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

[out] dst

Pointer to the output matrix

[in] src1

Pointer to the first input matrix

[in] src2

Pointer to the second input matrix

[in] count

Number of matrices to be processed. Each matrix has a data type of riscv_vec_cmmat4x4_f32_t.
Returns

RISCV_VEC_OK

Column-Major Matrix Multiplication Functions

These functions compute the multiplication of two source matrices and store the results in a destination matrix, also in column-major order.

riscv_vec_cmmat2x2_mul_f32

Declaration
int riscv_vec_cmmat2x2_mul_f32 (riscv_vec_cmmat2x2_f32_t * dst, riscv_vec_cmmat2x2_f32_t * src1, riscv_vec_cmmat2x2_f32_t * src2, uint32_t count)
Description

Column-major matrix multiplication function for MAT2x2.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[out] dst

Pointer to the output matrix

[in] src1

Pointer to the first input matrix

[in] src2

Pointer to the second input matrix

[in] count

Number of matrices to be processed. Each matrix has a data type of riscv_vec_cmmat2x2_f32_t.
Returns

RISCV_VEC_OK

Example

The following example code presents the multiplication of four MAT2x2 matrices with this function.

#define count    4
riscv_vec_cmmat2x2_f32_t src1[count] = {...};
riscv_vec_cmmat2x2_f32_t src2[count] = {...};
riscv_vec_cmmat2x2_f32_t dst[count];
riscv_vec_cmmat2x2_mul_f32 (dst, src1, src2, count);

This example also serves as a reference for examples of MAT3x3 and MAT4x4 column-major matrix multiplication functions.

riscv_vec_cmmat3x3_mul_f32

int riscv_vec_cmmat3x3_mul_f32 (riscv_vec_cmmat3x3_f32_t * dst, riscv_vec_cmmat3x3_f32_t * src1, riscv_vec_cmmat3x3_f32_t * src2, uint32_t count)

riscv_vec_cmmat2x2_mulc_mxv_f32

Declaration
int riscv_vec_cmmat2x2_mulc_mxv_f32 (riscv_vec_f32x2_t * dst, const riscv_vec_cmmat2x2_f32_t * cst, riscv_vec_f32x2_t * src, uint32_t count)
Description

Constant column-major MAT2x2 multiply vector function.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[out] dst

Pointer to the output matrix

[in] cst

Pointer to the constant matrix

[in] src

Pointer to the input matrix

[in] count

Number of elements to be processed. Each element has a data type of riscv_vec_f32x2_t.
Returns

RISCV_VEC_OK

Example

Given the count as 4, the example code with this function is as follows:

#define count    4

const riscv_vec_cmmat2x2_f32_t cst = {...};
riscv_vec_f32x2_t src[count] = {...};
riscv_vec_f32x2_t dst[count];
riscv_vec_cmmat2x2_mulc_mxv_f32 (dst, &cst, src, count);

This example also serves as a reference for examples of constant column-major MAT3x3 and MAT4x4 multiply vector functions.

Column-Major Matrix Determinant Functions

These functions compute the determinant of a source matrix and store the results in a destination matrix, also in column-major order.

riscv_vec_cmmat2x2_det_f32

Declaration
int riscv_vec_cmmat2x2_det_f32 (float32_t * dst, riscv_vec_cmmat2x2_f32_t * src, uint32_t count)
Description

Column-major matrix determinant function for MAT2x2.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[out] dst

Pointer to the output matrix

[in] src

Pointer to the input matrix

[in] count

Number of matrices to be processed. Each matrix has a data type of riscv_vec_cmmat2x2_f32_t.
Returns

RISCV_VEC_OK

Example

The following equation shows the determinant of two MAT2x2 matrices and the results.

\[ \mathtt{ \left| \begin{matrix} \mathtt{0.1} & \mathtt{0.4} \\ \mathtt{-0.2} & \mathtt{0.1} \end{matrix} \right| = \mathtt{0.09}, \quad \left| \begin{matrix} \mathtt{0.3} & \mathtt{0.4} \\ \mathtt{0.2} & \mathtt{0.2} \end{matrix} \right| = \mathtt{-0.02} } \]

 

The code example with this function is as follows:

#define count    2
riscv_vec_cmmat2x2_f32_t src[count] = {
{{0.1, -0.2}, {0.4, 0.1}}, {{0.3, 0.2}, {0.4, 0.2}}
};
float32_t dst[count];
riscv_vec_cmmat2x2_det_f32 (dst, src, count);

This example also serves as a reference for examples of MAT3x3 and MAT4x4 column-major matrix determinant functions.

riscv_vec_cmmat3x3_det_f32

Declaration
int riscv_vec_cmmat3x3_det_f32 (float32_t * dst, riscv_vec_cmmat3x3_f32_t * src, uint32_t count)
Description

Column-major matrix determinant function for MAT3x3.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[out] dst

Pointer to the output matrix

[in] src

Pointer to the input matrix

[in] count

Number of matrices to be processed. Each matrix has a data type of riscv_vec_cmmat3x3_f32_t.
Returns

RISCV_VEC_OK

riscv_vec_cmmat4x4_det_f32

Declaration
int riscv_vec_cmmat4x4_det_f32 (float32_t * dst, riscv_vec_cmmat4x4_f32_t * src, uint32_t count)
Description

Column-major matrix determinant function for MAT4x4.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[out] dst

Pointer to the output matrix

[in] src

Pointer to the input matrix

[in] count

Number of matrices to be processed. Each matrix has a data type of riscv_vec_cmmat4x4_f32_t.
Returns

RISCV_VEC_OK

Column-Major Matrix Identity Functions

These functions create an identity matrix and store the results in a destination matrix in column-major order.

riscv_vec_cmmat2x2_identity_f32

Declaration
int riscv_vec_cmmat2x2_identity_f32 (riscv_vec_cmmat2x2_f32_t * dst, uint32_t count)
Description

Column-major matrix identity function for MAT2x2.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[out] dst

Pointer to the output matrix

[in] count

Number of matrices to be processed. Each matrix has a data type of riscv_vec_cmmat2x2_f32_t.
Returns

RISCV_VEC_OK

Example

The following example code demonstrates how to use this function to write two MAT2x2 identity matrices.

#define count    2
riscv_vec_cmmat2x2_f32_t dst[count];
riscv_vec_cmmat2x2_identity_f32 (dst, count);

This example also serves as a reference for examples of MAT3x3 and MAT4x4 column-major identity matrix functions.

riscv_vec_cmmat3x3_identity_f32

Declaration
int riscv_vec_cmmat3x3_identity_f32 (riscv_vec_cmmat3x3_f32_t * dst, uint32_t count)
Description

Column-major matrix identity function for MAT3x3.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[out] dst

Pointer to the output matrix

[in] count

Number of matrices to be processed. Each matrix has a data type of riscv_vec_cmmat3x3_f32_t.
Returns

RISCV_VEC_OK

riscv_vec_cmmat4x4_identity_f32

Declaration
int riscv_vec_cmmat4x4_identity_f32 (riscv_vec_cmmat4x4_f32_t * dst, uint32_t count)
Description

Column-major matrix identity function for MAT4x4.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[out] dst

Pointer to the output matrix

[in] count

Number of matrices to be processed. Each matrix has a data type of riscv_vec_cmmat4x4_f32_t.
Returns

RISCV_VEC_OK

Column-Major Matrix Transpose Functions

These functions transpose a matrix and store the results in a destination matrix, also in column-major order.

riscv_vec_cmmat2x2_trans_f32

Declaration
int riscv_vec_cmmat2x2_trans_f32 (riscv_vec_cmmat2x2_f32_t * dst, riscv_vec_cmmat2x2_f32_t * src, uint32_t count)
Description

Column-major matrix transpose function for MAT2x2.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[out] dst

Pointer to the output matrix

[in] src

Pointer to the input matrix

[in] count

Number of matrices to be processed. Each matrix has a data type of riscv_vec_cmmat2x2_f32_t.
Returns

RISCV_VEC_OK

Example

The following equation shows the matrix transpose of two MAT2x2 matrices and the results.

\[ \begin{bmatrix} \mathtt{0.1} & \mathtt{0.4} \\ \mathtt{-0.2} & \mathtt{0.1} \end{bmatrix}^\mathtt{{\scriptscriptstyle{T}}} = \begin{bmatrix} \mathtt{0.1} & \mathtt{-0.2} \\ \mathtt{0.4} & \mathtt{0.1} \end{bmatrix}, \quad \begin{bmatrix} \mathtt{0.3} & \mathtt{0.4} \\ \mathtt{0.2} & \mathtt{0.2} \end{bmatrix}^\mathtt{{\scriptscriptstyle{T}}} = \begin{bmatrix} \mathtt{0.3} & \mathtt{0.2} \\ \mathtt{0.4} & \mathtt{0.2} \end{bmatrix} \]

 

The code example with this function is as follows:

#define count    2
riscv_vec_cmmat2x2_f32_t src[count] = {
{{0.1, -0.2}, {0.4, 0.1}}, {{0.3, 0.2}, {0.4, 0.2}}
};
riscv_vec_cmmat2x2_f32_t dst[count];
riscv_vec_cmmat2x2_trans_f32 (dst, src, count);

This example also serves as a reference for examples of MAT3x3 and MAT4x4 column-major matrix transpose functions.

riscv_vec_cmmat3x3_trans_f32

Declaration
int riscv_vec_cmmat3x3_trans_f32 (riscv_vec_cmmat3x3_f32_t * dst, riscv_vec_cmmat3x3_f32_t * src, uint32_t count)
Description

Column-major matrix transpose function for MAT3x3.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[out] dst

Pointer to the output matrix

[in] src

Pointer to the input matrix

[in] count

Number of matrices to be processed. Each matrix has a data type of riscv_vec_cmmat3x3_f32_t.
Returns

RISCV_VEC_OK

riscv_vec_cmmat4x4_trans_f32

Declaration
int riscv_vec_cmmat4x4_trans_f32 (riscv_vec_cmmat4x4_f32_t * dst, riscv_vec_cmmat4x4_f32_t * src, uint32_t count)
Description

Column-major matrix transpose function for MAT4x4.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[out] dst

Pointer to the output matrix

[in] src

Pointer to the input matrix

[in] count

Number of matrices to be processed. Each matrix has a data type of riscv_vec_cmmat4x4_f32_t.
Returns

RISCV_VEC_OK

Column-Major Matrix Inverse Functions

These functions return the inverse of a square matrix in column-major order.

riscv_vec_cmmat2x2_inv_f32

Declaration
int riscv_vec_cmmat2x2_inv_f32 (riscv_vec_cmmat2x2_f32_t * dst, riscv_vec_cmmat2x2_f32_t * src, uint32_t count)
Description

Column-major matrix inverse function for MAT2x2.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[out] dst

Pointer to the output matrix

[in] src

Pointer to the input matrix

[in] count

Number of matrices to be processed. Each matrix has a data type of riscv_vec_cmmat2x2_f32_t.
Returns

RISCV_VEC_OK

Example

The following equation shows the matrix transpose of two MAT2x2 matrices and the results.

\[ \begin{bmatrix} \mathtt{0.1} & \mathtt{0.4} \\ \mathtt{-0.2} & \mathtt{0.1} \end{bmatrix}^\mathtt{{\scriptscriptstyle{-1}}} = \begin{bmatrix} \mathtt{1.1111} & \mathtt{-4.4444} \\ \mathtt{2.2222} & \mathtt{1.1111} \end{bmatrix}, \quad \begin{bmatrix} \mathtt{0.3} & \mathtt{0.4} \\ \mathtt{0.2} & \mathtt{0.2} \end{bmatrix}^\mathtt{{\scriptscriptstyle{-1}}} = \begin{bmatrix} \mathtt{-10} & \mathtt{20} \\ \mathtt{10} & \mathtt{-15} \end{bmatrix} \]

 

The code example with this function is as follows:

#define count    2
riscv_vec_cmmat2x2_f32_t src[count] = {
{{0.1, -0.2}, {0.4, 0.1}}, {{0.3, 0.2}, {0.4, 0.2}}
};
riscv_vec_cmmat2x2_f32_t dst[count];
riscv_vec_cmmat2x2_inv_f32 (dst, src, count);

This example also serves as a reference for examples of MAT3x3 and MAT4x4 column-major matrix inverse functions.

riscv_vec_cmmat3x3_inv_f32

Declaration
int riscv_vec_cmmat3x3_inv_f32 (riscv_vec_cmmat3x3_f32_t * dst, riscv_vec_cmmat3x3_f32_t * src, uint32_t count)
Description

Column-major matrix inverse function for MAT3x3.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[out] dst

Pointer to the output matrix

[in] src

Pointer to the input matrix

[in] count

Number of matrices to be processed. Each matrix has a data type of riscv_vec_cmmat3x3_f32_t.
Returns

RISCV_VEC_OK

riscv_vec_cmmat4x4_inv_f32

Declaration
int riscv_vec_cmmat4x4_inv_f32 (riscv_vec_cmmat4x4_f32_t * dst, riscv_vec_cmmat4x4_f32_t * src, uint32_t count)
Description

Column-major matrix inverse function for MAT4x4.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[out] dst

Pointer to the output matrix

[in] src

Pointer to the input matrix

[in] count

Number of matrices to be processed. Each matrix has a data type of riscv_vec_cmmat4x4_f32_t.
Returns

RISCV_VEC_OK

Transform Functions

This section includes the following transform functions and their corresponding data structures.

Data Structures for Transform Functions

This section describes the data structures used in transform functions.

struct riscv_vec_cpx_f32_t

The structure of F32 complex vectors is defined as follows:

typedef struct
{
    float32_t r;
    float32_t i;
} riscv_vec_cpx_f32_t;

where:

r

Real part of an F32 complex number

i

Imaginary part of an F32 complex number

struct riscv_vec_cfft_state_f32_t

The structure of F32 CFFT states is defined as follows:

typedef struct
{
    q31_t nfft;
    q31_t * factors;
    riscv_vec_cpx_f32_t * twiddles;
    riscv_vec_cpx_f32_t * buffer;
    riscv_vec_cpx_f32_t * last_twiddles;
    q31_t is_forward_scaled;
    q31_t is_backward_scaled;
} riscv_vec_cfft_state_f32_t;

where:

nfft

Input elements

factors

Pointer to the factors vector

twiddles

Pointer to the twiddles vector, which has a data type of riscv_vec_cpx_f32_t

buffer

Pointer to the scratch buffer, which has a data type of riscv_vec_cpx_f32_t

last_twiddles

Pointer to the last twiddles vector, which has a data type of riscv_vec_cpx_f32_t

is_forward_scaled

Scale value of CFFT

is_backward_scaled

Scale value of CIFFT

struct riscv_vec_rfft_state_f32_t

The structure of F32 RFFT states is defined as follows:

typedef struct
{
    riscv_vec_cpx_f32_t * buffer;
    q31_t ncfft;
    q31_t * factors;
    riscv_vec_cpx_f32_t * twiddles;
    riscv_vec_cpx_f32_t * super_twiddles;
} riscv_vec_rfft_state_f32_t;

where:

buffer

Pointer to the scratch buffer, which has a data type of riscv_vec_cpx_f32_t

ncfft

Input elements

factors

Pointer to the factors vector

twiddles

Pointer to the twiddles vector, which has a data type of riscv_vec_cpx_f32_t

super_twiddles

Pointer to the super twiddles vector, which has a data type of riscv_vec_cpx_f32_t

struct riscv_vec_dct_state_f32_t

The structure of F32 DCT states is defined as follows:

typedef struct
{
    uint32_t n;
    float32_t * cos_table;
    float32_t * sin_table;
    float32_t nfactor;
    riscv_vec_cpx_f32_t * rfft_out;
    riscv_vec_rfft_cfg_f32_t rfft_cfg;
} riscv_vec_dct_state_f32_t;

where:

n

Input elements

cos_table

Pointer to the cosine table

sin_table

Pointer to the sine table

nfactor

Represents the factor of n in DCT

rfft_out

RFFT output, which has a data type of riscv_vec_cpx_f32_t

rfft_cfg

RFFT structure configuration

struct riscv_vec_dct4_state_f32_t

The structure of F32 DCT4 states is defined as follows:

typedef struct
{
    uint32_t n;
    float32_t * cos_table;
    float32_t * sin_table;
    float32_t * cos_table2;
    float32_t * sin_table2;
    float32_t nfactor;
    riscv_vec_cpx_f32_t * rfft_out;
    riscv_vec_rfft_cfg_f32_t rfft_cfg;
} riscv_vec_dct4_state_f32_t;

where:

n

Input elements

cos_table

Pointer to the cosine table

sin_table

Pointer to the sine table

cos_table2

Pointer to the cosine table2

sin_table2

Pointer to the sine table2

nfactor

Represents the factor of n in DCT

rfft_out

RFFT output, which has a data type of riscv_vec_cpx_f32_t

rfft_cfg

RFFT structure configuration

struct riscv_vec_mfcc_state_f32_t

The structure of F32 MFCC states is defined as follows:

typedef struct
{
    float32_t * dct_coefs;
    float32_t * filter_coefs;
    float32_t * window_coefs;
    uint32_t * filter_pos;
    uint32_t * filter_len;
    uint32_t fft_len;
    uint32_t n_mel_filters;
    uint32_t n_dct_out;
    riscv_vec_rfft_cfg_f32_t rfft_cfg;
} riscv_vec_mfcc_state_f32_t;

where:

dct_coefs

Pointer to the internal DCT coefficients

filter_coefs

Pointer to the internal Mel filter coefficients

window_coefs

Pointer to the window coefficients

filter_pos

Pointer to the internal Mel filter positions

filter_len

Pointer to the internal Mel filter lengths

fft_len

FFT length

n_mel_filters

Number of Mel filters

n_dct_out

Number of DCT outputs

rfft_cfg

RFFT structure configuration

struct riscv_vec_cfft2d_state_f32_t

The structure of F32 CFFT2D states is defined as follows:

typedef struct
{
    q31_t m;
    q31_t n;
    q31_t * factors_m;
    q31_t * factors_n;
    riscv_vec_cpx_f32_t * twiddles_m;
    riscv_vec_cpx_f32_t * twiddles_n;
    riscv_vec_cpx_f32_t * buffer_1d;
    riscv_vec_cpx_f32_t * buffer_2d;
    q31_t is_forward_scaled;
    q31_t is_backward_scaled;
} riscv_vec_cfft2d_state_f32_t;

where:

m

Input m-dimension

n

Input n-dimension

factors_m

Pointer to the factors vector of m-dimension

factors_n

Pointer to the factors vector of n-dimension

twiddles_m

Pointer to the twiddles vector of m-dimension, which has a data type of riscv_vec_cpx_f32_t

twiddles_n

Pointer to the twiddles vector of n-dimension, which has a data type of riscv_vec_cpx_f32_t

buffer_1d

Pointer to the scratch buffer of 1d-fft, which has a data type of riscv_vec_cpx_f32_t

buffer_2d

Pointer to the scratch buffer of transpose using, which has a data type of riscv_vec_cpx_f32_t

is_forward_scaled

Scale value of CFFT2D

is_backward_scaled

Scale value of CIFFT2D

struct riscv_vec_rfft2d_state_f32_t

The structure of F32 RFFT2D states is defined as follows:

typedef struct
{
    riscv_vec_cpx_f32_t * buffer_1d;
    riscv_vec_cpx_f32_t * tmp_1d_input;
    riscv_vec_cpx_f32_t * tmp_split;
    riscv_vec_cpx_f32_t * buffer_2d;
    q31_t m;
    q31_t ncfft;
    q31_t * factors_m;
    q31_t * factors_n;
    riscv_vec_cpx_f32_t * twiddles_m;
    riscv_vec_cpx_f32_t * twiddles_n;
    riscv_vec_cpx_f32_t * super_twiddles;
} riscv_vec_rfft2d_state_f32_t;

where:

buffer_1d

Pointer to the scratch buffer of 1d-fft, which has a data type of riscv_vec_cpx_f32_t

tmp_1d_input

Pointer to the temporary buffer, which has a data type of riscv_vec_cpx_f32_t

tmp_split

Pointer to the temporary split buffer, which has a data type of riscv_vec_cpx_f32_t

buffer_2d

Pointer to the scratch buffer of transpose using, which has a data type of riscv_vec_cpx_f32_t

m

Input m-dimension

ncfft

Input n-dimension

factors_m

Pointer to the factors vector of m-dimension

factors_n

Pointer to the factors vector of n-dimension

super_twiddles

Pointer to the supper twiddles vector, which has a data type of riscv_vec_cpx_f32_t

struct riscv_vec_cpx_f16_t

The structure of F16 complex vectors is defined as follows:

typedef struct
{
    float16_t r;
    float16_t i;
} riscv_vec_cpx_f16_t;

where:

r

Real part of an F16 complex number

i

Imaginary part of an F16 complex number

struct riscv_vec_cfft_state_f16_t

The structure of F16 CFFT states is defined as follows:

typedef struct
{
    q31_t nfft;
    q31_t * factors;
    riscv_vec_cpx_f16_t * twiddles;
    riscv_vec_cpx_f16_t * buffer;
    riscv_vec_cpx_f16_t * last_twiddles;
    q31_t is_forward_scaled;
    q31_t is_backward_scaled;
} riscv_vec_cfft_state_f16_t;

where:

nfft

Input elements

factors

Pointer to the factors vector

twiddles

Pointer to the twiddles vector, which has a data type of riscv_vec_cpx_f16_t

buffer

Pointer to the scratch buffer, which has a data type of riscv_vec_cpx_f16_t

last_twiddles

Pointer to the last twiddles vector, which has a data type of riscv_vec_cpx_f16_t

is_forward_scaled

Scale value of CFFT

is_backward_scaled

Scale value of CIFFT

struct riscv_vec_rfft_state_f16_t

The structure of F16 RFFT states is defined as follows:

typedef struct
{
    riscv_vec_cpx_f16_t * buffer;
    q31_t ncfft;
    q31_t * factors;
    riscv_vec_cpx_f16_t * twiddles;
    riscv_vec_cpx_f16_t * super_twiddles;

Pointer to the scratch buffer, which has a data type of riscv_vec_cpx_f16_t

Input elements

factors

Pointer to the factors vector

twiddles

Pointer to the twiddles vector, which has a data type of riscv_vec_cpx_f16_t

super_twiddles

Pointer to the super twiddles vector, which has a data type of riscv_vec_cpx_f16_t

struct riscv_vec_mfcc_state_f16_t

The structure of F16 MFCC states is defined as follows:

typedef struct
{
    float16_t * dct_coefs;
    float16_t * filter_coefs;
    float16_t * window_coefs;
    uint32_t * filter_pos;
    uint32_t * filter_len;
    uint32_t fft_len;
    uint32_t n_mel_filters;
    uint32_t n_dct_out;
    riscv_vec_rfft_cfg_f16_t rfft_cfg;
} riscv_vec_mfcc_state_f16_t;

where:

dct_coefs

Pointer to the internal DCT coefficients

filter_coefs

Pointer to the internal Mel filter coefficients

window_coefs

Pointer to the window coefficients

filter_pos

Pointer to the internal Mel filter positions

filter_len

Pointer to the internal Mel filter lengths

fft_len

FFT length

Number of Mel filters

Number of DCT outputs
