Parameter Description

[out] dst

Pointer to the output complex vector

[in] src1

Pointer to the first input complex vector

[in] src2

Pointer to the second input complex vector

[in] size

Number of complex elements in a vector
Returns

None

Note

The values written in the destination vector are in Q13 format.

Complex Conjugate Functions

These functions calculate the conjugation values of complex numbers in a source vector and store the results in a destination vector.

The behavior can be defined as follows:

\[ \begin{aligned} & \mathtt{for \ (n = 0; \, \, n < size; \, \, n++)} \\ & \quad \quad \mathtt{dst[2 * n] = src[2 * n];} \\ & \quad \quad \mathtt{dst[2 * n + 1] = -src[2 * n + 1];} \end{aligned} \]

VEC Library supports distinct functions for the following data types: F32, F16, and Q15. These functions are described in the subsections below.

riscv_vec_cconj_f32

Declaration
void riscv_vec_cconj_f32 (float32_t * dst, float32_t * src, uint32_t size)
Description

Complex conjugate function for F32.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[out] dst

Pointer to the output complex vector

[in] src

Pointer to the input complex vector

[in] size

Number of complex elements in a vector
Returns

None

Example

Given a set of complex vectors containing three complex elements like {3 + 4i, 4 - 7i, -3 + 5i}, the complex conjugation is as follows:

//Complex vectors are arranged with real and
//imaginary parts interleaved
#define size    3
float32_t src[2 * size] = {3.0, 4.0, 4.0, -7.0, -3.0, 5.0};
float32_t dst[2 * size];
riscv_vec_cconj_f32 (dst, src, size);

This example also serves as a reference for examples of F16 and Q15 complex conjugate functions.

riscv_vec_cconj_f16

Declaration
void riscv_vec_cconj_f16 (float16_t * dst, float16_t * src, uint32_t size)
Description

Complex conjugate function for F16.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[out] dst

Pointer to the output complex vector

[in] src

Pointer to the input complex vector

[in] size

Number of complex elements in a vector
Returns

None

Note

This function is supported only by toolchains that support hard-float. Additionally, you must apply the -mzfh option in both compiler and linker flags when using this function. For details about the -mzfh linking option, see Linking Options for Newlib and MCUlib Toolchains or Linking Options for Glibc Toolchains.

riscv_vec_cconj_q31

Declaration
void riscv_vec_cconj_q31 (q31_t * dst, q31_t * src, uint32_t size)
Description

Complex conjugate function for Q31.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[out] dst

Pointer to the output complex vector

[in] src

Pointer to the input complex vector

[in] size

Number of complex elements in a vector
Returns

None

Note

If negating the input imaginary part where the value is INT32_MIN (0x80000000), the output imaginary part will be INT32_MAX (0x7FFFFFFF) after complex conjugation.

riscv_vec_cconj_q15

Declaration
void riscv_vec_cconj_q15 (q15_t * dst, q15_t * src, uint32_t size)
Description

Complex conjugate function for Q15.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[out] dst

Pointer to the output complex vector

[in] src

Pointer to the input complex vector

[in] size

Number of complex elements in a vector
Returns

None

Note

If negating the input imaginary part where the value is INT16_MIN (0x8000), the output imaginary part will be INT16_MAX (0x7FFF) after complex conjugation.

Complex Magnitude Functions

These functions compute the magnitude of a complex vector.

The behavior can be defined as follows:

\[ \begin{aligned} & \mathtt{for \ (n = 0; \, n < size; \, n++)} \\ & \quad \quad \mathtt{dst[n] = \sqrt{src[2 * n]^2 + src[2 * n + 1]^2};} \end{aligned} \]

VEC Library supports distinct functions for the following data types: F32, F16, and Q15. These functions are described in the subsections below.

riscv_vec_cmag_f32

Declaration
void riscv_vec_cmag_f32 (float32_t * dst, float32_t * src, uint32_t size)
Description

Complex magnitude function for F32.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[out] dst

Pointer to the output complex vector

[in] src

Pointer to the input complex vector

[in] size

Number of complex elements in a vector
Returns

None

Example

Given a set of complex vectors containing three complex elements like {3 + 4i, 4 - 7i, -3 + 5i}, the complex magnitude is as follows:

#define size    3
float32_t src[2 * size] = {3.0, 4.0, 4.0, -7.0, -3.0, 5.0};
float32_t dst[2 * size];
riscv_vec_cmag_f32 (dst, src, size);

This example also serves as a reference for examples of F16 and Q15 complex magnitude functions.

riscv_vec_cmag_f16

Declaration
void riscv_vec_cmag_f16 (float16_t * dst, float16_t * src, uint32_t size)

Pointer to the output complex vector

[in] src

Pointer to the input complex vector

[in] size

Number of complex elements in a vector
Returns

None

Note

This function is supported only by toolchains that support hard-float. Additionally, you must apply the -mzfh option in both compiler and linker flags when using this function. For details about the -mzfh linking option, see Linking Options for Newlib and MCUlib Toolchains or Linking Options for Glibc Toolchains.

void riscv_vec_cmag_q31 (q31_t * dst, q31_t * src, uint32_t size)

Complex magnitude function for Q31.

Pointer to the output complex vector

[in] src

Pointer to the input complex vector

Number of complex elements in a vector

riscv_vec_cmag_hp_q15

Declaration
void riscv_vec_cmag_hp_q15 (q15_t * dst, q15_t * src, uint32_t size)
Description

Complex magnitude higher precision function for Q15.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[out] dst

Pointer to the output complex vector

[in] src

Pointer to the input complex vector

[in] size

Number of complex elements in a vector
Returns

None

Note

The values written into the destination vector are in Q14 format. When compared with riscv_vec_cmag_q15, this function delivers higher precision at the cost of slower performance.

Complex Magnitude-Squared Functions

These functions compute the magnitude squared of complex numbers in a complex vector.

The behavior can be defined as follows:

\[ \begin{aligned} & \mathtt{for \ (n = 0; \, n < size; \, n++)} \\ & \quad \quad \mathtt{dst[n] = src[2 * n]^2 + src[2 * n + 1]^2;} \end{aligned} \]

VEC Library supports complex magnitude-squared functions for the following data types: F32, F16, and Q15. These functions are described in the subsections below.

riscv_vec_cmag_sqr_f32

Declaration
void riscv_vec_cmag_sqr_f32 (float32_t * dst, float32_t * src, uint32_t size)
Description

Complex magnitude-squared function for F32.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[out] dst

Pointer to the output complex vector

[in] src

Pointer to the input complex vector

[in] size

Number of complex elements in a vector
Returns

None

Example

Given a set of complex vectors containing three complex elements like {3 + 4i, 4 - 7i, -3 + 5i}, the complex magnitude-squared is as follows:

#define size    3
float32_t src[2 * size] = {3.0, 4.0, 4.0, -7.0, -3.0, 5.0};
float32_t dst[2 * size];
riscv_vec_cmag_sqr_f32 (dst, src, size);

This example also serves as a reference for examples of F16 and Q15 complex magnitude-squared functions.

riscv_vec_cmag_sqr_f16

Declaration

Complex magnitude-squared function for F16.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[out] dst

Pointer to the output complex vector

[in] src

Pointer to the input complex vector

[in] size

Number of complex elements in a vector
Returns

None

Note

This function is supported only by toolchains that support hard-float. Additionally, you must apply the -mzfh option in both compiler and linker flags when using this function. For details about the -mzfh linking option, see Linking Options for Newlib and MCUlib Toolchains or Linking Options for Glibc Toolchains.

riscv_vec_cmag_sqr_f64

[in] src

Description

Complex magnitude-squared function for Q31.

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[out] dst

Pointer to the output complex vector

[in] src

Pointer to the input complex vector

[in] size

Number of complex elements in a vector
Returns

None

Note

The values written in the destination vector are in Q29 format.

riscv_vec_cmag_sqr_q15

Declaration
void riscv_vec_cmag_sqr_q15 (q15_t * dst, q15_t * src, uint32_t size)
Description

Complex magnitude-squared function for Q15.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[out] dst

Pointer to the output complex vector

[in] src

Pointer to the input complex vector

[in] size

Number of complex elements in a vector
Returns

None

Note

The values written in the destination vector are in Q13 format.

Complex Dot Product Functions

These functions calculate the dot product of two complex vectors and store the results in a destination vector.

VEC Library provides two types of complex dot product functions.

The first type of complex dot product functions includes riscv_vec_cdprod_f32, riscv_vec_cdprod_f16, riscv_vec_cdprod_q31, and riscv_vec_cdprod_q15. Their behavior can be described as follows:

\[ \begin{aligned} & \mathtt{for \ (n = 0; \, \, n < size; \, \, n++)} \\ & \quad \quad \mathtt{a = src1[2 * n];} \\ & \quad \quad \mathtt{b = src1[2 * n + 1];} \\ & \quad \quad \mathtt{c = src2[2 * n];} \\ & \quad \quad \mathtt{d = src2[2 * n + 1];} \\ & \quad \quad \mathtt{dst[2 * n] = a * c + b * d;} \\ & \quad \quad \mathtt{dst[2 * n + 1] = a * d - b * c;} \end{aligned} \]

The second type of complex dot product functions, named as complex dot product type 2 functions, includes riscv_vec_cdprod_typ2_f32, riscv_vec_cdprod_typ2_f16, riscv_vec_cdprod_typ2_q31, and riscv_vec_cdprod_typ2_q15. Their behavior can be described as follows:

\[ \begin{aligned} & \mathtt{for \ (n = 0; \, \, n < size; \, \, n++)} \\ & \quad \quad \mathtt{a = src1[2 * n];} \\ & \quad \quad \mathtt{b = src1[2 * n + 1];} \\ & \quad \quad \mathtt{c = src2[2 * n];} \\ & \quad \quad \mathtt{d = src2[2 * n + 1];} \\ & \quad \quad \mathtt{real\_sum += a * c - b * d;} \\ & \quad \quad \mathtt{image\_sum += a * d + b * c;} \end{aligned} \]

Details of each complex dot product function are described in the subsections below.

riscv_vec_cdprod_f32

Declaration
void riscv_vec_cdprod_f32 (float32_t * dst, float32_t * src1, float32_t * src2, uint32_t size)
Description

Complex dot product function for F32.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[out] dst

Pointer to the output complex vector

[in] src1

Pointer to the first input complex vector

[in] src2

Pointer to the second input complex vector

[in] size

Number of complex elements in a vector
Returns

None

Example

Given two sets of complex vectors, each containing three complex numbers, such as {3 + 4i, 4 - 7i, -3 + 5i} and {1 - 2i, 5 - 1i, -4 + 3i}, the complex dot production is as follows:

#define size    3
float32_t src1[2 * size] = {3, 4, 4, -7, -3, 5};
float32_t src2[2 * size] = {1, -2, 5, -1, -4, 3};
float32_t dst[2 * size];
riscv_vec_cdprod_f32 (dst, src1, src2, size);

This example also serves as a reference for examples of F16 and Q15 complex dot product functions.

riscv_vec_cdprod_f16

Declaration
void riscv_vec_cdprod_f16 (float16_t * dst, float16_t * src1, float16_t * src2, uint32_t size)
Description

Complex dot product function for F16.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[out] dst

Pointer to the output complex vector

[in] src1

Pointer to the first input complex vector

[in] src2

Pointer to the second input complex vector

[in] size

Number of complex elements in a vector
Returns

None

Note

This function is supported only by toolchains that support hard-float. Additionally, you must apply the -mzfh option in both compiler and linker flags when using this function. For details about the -mzfh linking option, see Linking Options for Newlib and MCUlib Toolchains or Linking Options for Glibc Toolchains.

riscv_vec_cdprod_q31

Declaration
void riscv_vec_cdprod_q31 (q31_t * dst, q31_t * src1, q31_t * src2, uint32_t size)
Description

Complex dot product function for Q31.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[out] dst

Pointer to the output complex vector

[in] src1

Pointer to the first input complex vector

[in] src2

Pointer to the second input complex vector

[in] size

Number of complex elements in a vector
Returns

None

Note

The values written in the destination vector are in Q29 format.

riscv_vec_cdprod_q15

Declaration
void riscv_vec_cdprod_q15 (q15_t * dst, q15_t * src1, q15_t * src2, uint32_t size)
Description

Complex dot product function for Q15.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[out] dst

Pointer to the output complex vector

[in] src1

Pointer to the first input complex vector

[in] src2

Pointer to the second input complex vector

[in] size

Number of complex elements in a vector
Returns

None

Note

The values written in the destination vector are in Q13 format.

riscv_vec_cdprod_typ2_f32

Declaration
void riscv_vec_cdprod_typ2_f32 (float32_t * src1, float32_t * src2, uint32_t size, float32_t * rout, float32_t * iout)
Description

Complex dot product type 2 function for F32.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in] src1

Pointer to the first input complex vector

[in] src2

Pointer to the second input complex vector

[in] size

Number of complex elements in a vector

[out] rout

Pointer to the real sum of output

[out] iout

Pointer to the image sum of output
Returns

None

riscv_vec_cdprod_typ2_f16

Declaration
void riscv_vec_cdprod_typ2_f16 (float16_t * src1, float16_t * src2, uint32_t size, float16_t * rout, float16_t * iout)
Description

Complex dot product type 2 function for F16.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

Pointer to the first input complex vector

[in] src2

Pointer to the second input complex vector

[in] size

Number of complex elements in a vector

Pointer to the real sum of output

[out] iout

Pointer to the image sum of output
Returns

None

For details about the -mzfh linking option, see Linking Options for Newlib and MCUlib Toolchains or Linking Options for Glibc Toolchains.

riscv_vec_cdprod_typ2_q31

Declaration
void riscv_vec_cdprod_typ2_q31 (q31_t * src1, q31_t * src2, uint32_t size, q63_t * rout, q63_t * iout)
Description

Complex dot product type 2 function for Q31.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in] src1

Pointer to the first input complex vector

[in] src2

Pointer to the second input complex vector

[in] size

Number of complex elements in a vector

[out] rout

Pointer to the real sum of output

[out] iout

Pointer to the image sum of output
Returns

None

Note

The values written into the two output variables are in Q48 format.

riscv_vec_cdprod_typ2_q15

Declaration
void riscv_vec_cdprod_typ2_q15 (q15_t * src1, q15_t * src2, uint32_t size, q31_t * rout, q31_t * iout)
Description

Complex dot product type 2 function for Q15.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in] src1

Pointer to the first input complex vector

[in] src2

[in] size

Number of complex elements in a vector

[out] rout

Pointer to the real sum of output

[out] iout

Pointer to the image sum of output
Returns

None

Note

The values written into the two output variables are in Q24 format.

Complex-Multiply-Real Functions

These functions compute the multiplication of a complex vector by a real vector and store the results in a destination complex vector.

The behavior can be defined as follows:

\[ \begin{aligned} & \mathtt{for \ (n = 0; \, n < size; \, n++)} \\ & \quad \quad \mathtt{r = real[n];} \\ & \quad \quad \mathtt{dst[2 * n] = src[2 * n] * r;} \\ & \quad \quad \mathtt{dst[2 * n + 1] = src[2 * n + 1] * r;} \end{aligned} \]

VEC Library supports distinct functions for the following data types: F32, F16, and Q15. These functions are described in the subsections below.

riscv_vec_cmul_real_f32

Declaration
void riscv_vec_cmul_real_f32 (float32_t * dst, float32_t * src, float32_t * real, uint32_t size)
Description

Complex-multiply-real function for F32.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[out] dst

Pointer to the output complex vector

[in] src

Pointer to the input complex vector

[in] real

Pointer to the input real vector

[in] size

Number of complex elements in a vector
Returns

None

Example

Given a complex vector containing three elements, such as [3 + 4i, 4 - 7i, -3 + 5i] and a real vector containing three elements, such as [1, -3, 2], the multiplication of two vectors is as follows:

#define size    3
float32_t src[2 * size] = {3, 4, 4, -7, -3, 5};
float32_t real[size] = {1, -3, 2};
float32_t dst[2 * size];
riscv_vec_cmul_real_f32 (dst, src, real, size);

This example also serves as a reference for examples of F16 and Q15 complex-multiply-real functions.

riscv_vec_cmul_real_f16

Declaration
void riscv_vec_cmul_real_f16 (float16_t * dst, float16_t * src, float16_t * real, uint32_t size)
Description

Complex-multiply-real function for F16.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[out] dst

Pointer to the output complex vector

[in] src

Pointer to the input complex vector

[in] real

Pointer to the input real vector

[in] size

Number of complex elements in a vector
Returns

None

Note

This function is supported only by toolchains that support hard-float. Additionally, you must apply the -mzfh option in both compiler and linker flags when using this function. For details about the -mzfh linking option, see Linking Options for Newlib and MCUlib Toolchains or Linking Options for Glibc Toolchains.

riscv_vec_cmul_real_q31

Declaration
void riscv_vec_cmul_real_q31 (q31_t * dst, q31_t * src, q31_t * real, uint32_t size)
Description

Complex-multiply-real function for Q31.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[out] dst

Pointer to the output complex vector

[in] src

Pointer to the input complex vector

[in] real

Pointer to the input real vector

[in] size

Number of complex elements in a vector
Returns

None

Note

The results are saturated to the Q31 range [0x80000000, 0x7FFFFFFF].

riscv_vec_cmul_real_q15

Declaration
void riscv_vec_cmul_real_q15 (q15_t * dst, q15_t * src, q15_t * real, uint32_t size)
Description

Complex multiply-real function for Q15.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[out] dst

Pointer to the output complex vector

[in] src

Pointer to the input complex vector

[in] real

Pointer to the input real vector

[in] size

Number of complex elements in a vector
Returns

None

Note

The results are saturated to the Q15 range [0x8000, 0x7FFF].

Complex Square Root (CSQRT) Function

This function computes the square root values of elements in a complex source vector and store them one-by-one in a destination vector.

The behavior can be defined as follows:

\[ \mathtt{\sqrt{a + i b}} = \mathtt{\sqrt{\frac{|z| + a}{2}}} + \mathtt{i} \, \mathtt{\frac{b}{|b|}} \, \mathtt{\sqrt{\frac{|z| - a}{2}}} \]

where \(\mathtt{z = a + i b}\) and \(\mathtt{b \neq 0}\).

VEC Library only supports the function for the F32 data type. The function is described in the subsection below.

riscv_vec_csqrt_f32

Declaration
void riscv_vec_csqrt_f32 (float32_t * dst, float32_t * src, uint32_t size)
Description

CSQRT function for F32.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[out] dst

Pointer to the output complex vector

[in] src

Pointer to the input complex vector

[in] size

Number of complex elements in a vector
Returns

None

Utils Functions

This section includes the following utils functions.

Vector Cosine Functions

These functions compute the cosine values of elements in a source vector and store the results one-by-one in a destination vector. The input values for these functions are in radians, with no limitation on the input range.

VEC Library supports distinct functions for the following data types: F32, F16, BF16, F64, Q31, and Q15. These functions are described in the subsections below.

riscv_vec_cos_f32

Declaration
void riscv_vec_cos_f32 (float32_t * src, float32_t * dst, uint32_t size)
Description

Vector cosine function for F32.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in] src

Pointer to the input vector

[out] dst

Pointer to the output vector

[in] size

Number of elements in a vector
Returns

None

Vector cosine function for F16.

Pointer to the input vector

[out] dst

Pointer to the output vector

[in] size

Number of elements in a vector
Returns

None

Note

This function is supported only by toolchains that support hard-float. Additionally, you must apply the -mzfh option in both compiler and linker flags when using this function. For details about the -mzfh linking option, see Linking Options for Newlib and MCUlib Toolchains or Linking Options for Glibc Toolchains.

Vector cosine function for Q31.

Parameter Description

Pointer to the input vector

[out] dst

Pointer to the output vector

[in] size

Number of elements in a vector
Returns

None

Note

The input range is [0x80000000, 0x7FFFFFFF] and mapped to the range [-π, π].

[out] dst

Number of elements in a vector
Returns

None

Note

The input range is [0x8000, 0x7FFF] and mapped to the range [-π, π].

Vector Sine Functions

These functions compute the sine values of elements in a source vector and store the results one-by-one in a destination vector. The input values for these functions are in radians, with no limitation on the input range.

VEC Library supports distinct functions for the following data types: F32, F16. BF16, F64, Q31, and Q15. These functions are described in the subsections below.

riscv_vec_sin_f32

Declaration
void riscv_vec_sin_f32 (float32_t * src, float32_t * dst, uint32_t size)
Description

Vector sine function for F32.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in] src

Pointer to the input vector

[out] dst

Pointer to the output vector

[in] size

Number of elements in a vector
Returns

None

Returns

None

This function is supported only by toolchains that support hard-float. Additionally, you must apply the -mzfh option in both compiler and linker flags when using this function. For details about the -mzfh linking option, see Linking Options for Newlib and MCUlib Toolchains or Linking Options for Glibc Toolchains.

Conversion Functions

These functions convert element values in a source vector from one data type to another and store the results in a destination vector.

The following data type conversions are supported:

float32_t -> float16_t
float32_t -> bf16_t
float32_t -> float64_t
float32_t -> q31_t
float32_t -> q15_t
float32_t -> q7_t
float16_t -> float32_t
float16_t -> float64_t
float16_t -> q15_t
bf16_t -> float16_t
float64_t -> float32_t
float64_t -> float16_t
float64_t -> q31_t
float64_t -> q15_t
float64_t -> q7_t
q31_t -> float32_t
q31_t -> float64_t
q31_t -> q15_t
q31_t -> q7_t
q15_t -> float32_t
q15_t -> float16_t
q15_t -> float64_t
q15_t -> q31_t
q15_t -> q7_t
q7_t -> float32_t
q7_t -> float64_t
q7_t -> q31_t
q7_t -> q15_t
q7_t -> q3_t
q3_t -> q7_t
s16_t -> s8_t
s8_t -> s16_t
s8_t -> s4_t
s4_t -> s8_t

These functions are described in the subsections below.

riscv_vec_convert_f32_f16

Declaration
void riscv_vec_convert_f32_f16 (float32_t * src, float16_t * dst, uint32_t size)
Description

Function to convert values from F32 to F16.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in] src

Pointer to the input vector

[in] dst

Pointer to the output vector

[in] size

Number of elements in a vector
Returns

None

Note

This function is supported only by toolchains that support hard-float. Additionally, you must apply the -mzfh option in both compiler and linker flags when using this function. For details about the -mzfh linking option, see Linking Options for Newlib and MCUlib Toolchains or Linking Options for Glibc Toolchains.

[in] src

Pointer to the input vector

[in] dst

Pointer to the output vector

[in] size

Number of elements in a vector
Returns

None

riscv_vec_convert_f64_f16

Declaration
void riscv_vec_convert_f64_f16 (float64_t * src, float16_t * dst, uint32_t size)
Description

Function to convert values from F64 to F16.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in] src

Pointer to the input vector

[in] dst

Pointer to the output vector

[in] size

Number of elements in a vector
Returns

None

Note

This function is supported only by toolchains that support hard-float. Additionally, you must apply the -mzfh option in both compiler and linker flags when using this function. For details about the -mzfh linking option, see Linking Options for Newlib and MCUlib Toolchains or Linking Options for Glibc Toolchains.

riscv_vec_convert_q7_q3

Declaration
void riscv_vec_convert_q7_q3 (q7_t * src, q7_t * dst, uint32_t size)
Description

Function to convert values from Q7 to Q3.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in] src

Pointer to the input vector

[in] dst

Pointer to the output vector

[in] size

Number of elements in a vector
Returns

None

Note

The q7_t output is composed of two q3_t values (e.g., 0x4 and 0x5 form 0x45). If size is odd, the second q3_t is set to zero, resulting in a value like 0x05.

riscv_vec_convert_q3_q7

Declaration
void riscv_vec_convert_q3_q7 (q7_t * src, q7_t * dst, uint32_t size)
Description

Function to convert values from Q3 to Q7.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in] src

Pointer to the input vector

[in] dst

Pointer to the output vector

[in] size

Number of elements in a vector
Returns

None

Note

The q7_t input is composed of two q3_t values.

Vector Exponential Functions

These functions compute the exponential values of elements in a source vector and store the results one-by-one in a destination vector.

VEC Library supports distinct functions for the following data types: F32, F16, BF16, and F64. These functions are described in the subsections below.

riscv_vec_exp_f32

Declaration
void riscv_vec_exp_f32 (float32_t * src, float32_t * dst, uint32_t size)
Description

Vector exponential function for F32.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in] src

Pointer to the input vector

[out] dst

Pointer to the output vector

[in] size

Number of elements in a vector
Returns

None

riscv_vec_exp_f16

Declaration
void riscv_vec_exp_f16 (float16_t * src, float16_t * dst, uint32_t size)
Description

Vector exponential function for F16.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in] src

Pointer to the input vector

[out] dst

Pointer to the output vector

[in] size

Number of elements in a vector
Returns

None

Note

This function is supported only by toolchains that support hard-float. Additionally, you must apply the -mzfh option in both compiler and linker flags when using this function. For details about the -mzfh linking option, see Linking Options for Newlib and MCUlib Toolchains or Linking Options for Glibc Toolchains.

riscv_vec_exp_bf16

Declaration
void riscv_vec_exp_bf16 (bf16_t * src, bf16_t * dst, uint32_t size)
Description

Vector exponential function for BF16.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in] src

Pointer to the input vector

[out] dst

Pointer to the output vector

[in] size

Number of elements in a vector
Returns

None

Note

This function is supported only by toolchains that support hard-float. Additionally, you must apply the -mext-bf16min option in both compiler and linker flags when using this function. For details about the -mext-bf16min linking option, see Linking Options for Newlib and MCUlib Toolchains or Linking Options for Glibc Toolchains.

riscv_vec_exp_f64

Declaration
void riscv_vec_exp_f64 (float64_t * src, float64_t * dst, uint32_t size)
Description

Vector exponential function for F64.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in] src

Pointer to the input vector

[out] dst

Pointer to the output vector

[in] size

Number of elements in a vector
Returns

None

Vector Natural Logarithmic Functions

These functions compute the natural logarithmic value of elements in a source vector and store the results one-by-one in a destination vector. The input value must be greater than zero.

VEC Library supports distinct functions for the following data types: F32, F16, BF16, F64, Q31, and Q15. These functions are described in the subsections below.

riscv_vec_log_f32

Declaration
void riscv_vec_log_f32 (float32_t * src, float32_t * dst, uint32_t size)
Description

Vector natural logarithmic function for F32.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in] src

Pointer to the input vector

[out] dst

Pointer to the output vector

[in] size

Number of elements in a vector
Returns

None

riscv_vec_log_f16

Declaration
void riscv_vec_log_f16 (float16_t * src, float16_t * dst, uint32_t size)
Description

Vector natural logarithmic function for F16.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in] src

Pointer to the input vector

[out] dst

Pointer to the output vector

[in] size

Number of elements in a vector
Returns

None

Note

This function is supported only by toolchains that support hard-float. Additionally, you must apply the -mzfh option in both compiler and linker flags when using this function. For details about the -mzfh linking option, see Linking Options for Newlib and MCUlib Toolchains or Linking Options for Glibc Toolchains.

riscv_vec_log_bf16

Declaration

Description

Vector natural logarithmic function for BF16.

Parameters are described as follows:

[in] src

Pointer to the input vector

[out] dst

Pointer to the output vector

[in] size

Number of elements in a vector
Returns

None

Note

This function is supported only by toolchains that support hard-float. Additionally, you must apply the -mext-bf16min option in both compiler and linker flags when using this function. For details about the -mext-bf16min linking option, see Linking Options for Newlib and MCUlib Toolchains or Linking Options for Glibc Toolchains.

riscv_vec_log_f64

[out] dst

[in] size

Number of elements in a vector
Returns

None

Vector Sigmoid Functions

These functions compute the sigmoid value of elements in a source vector and store the results one-by-one in a destination vector.

VEC Library supports distinct functions for the following data types: F32 and F16. These functions are described in the subsections below.

riscv_vec_sigmoid_f32

Declaration
void riscv_vec_sigmoid_f32 (float32_t * src, float32_t * dst, uint32_t size)

[out] dst

Pointer to the output vector

[in] size

Number of elements in a vector
Returns

None

Note

This function is supported only by toolchains that support hard-float. Additionally, you must apply the -mzfh option in both compiler and linker flags when using this function. For details about the -mzfh linking option, see Linking Options for Newlib and MCUlib Toolchains or Linking Options for Glibc Toolchains.

Vector Duplicate Functions

These functions copy element values from a source vector and store the results one-by-one in a destination vector.

VEC Library supports distinct functions for the following data types: F32, F16, F64, Q15, Q31, and Q7. These functions are described in the subsections below.

riscv_vec_dup_f32

Declaration
void riscv_vec_dup_f32 (float32_t * src, float32_t * dst, uint32_t size)
Description

Vector duplicate function for F32.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in] src

Pointer to the input vector

[out] dst

Pointer to the output vector

[in] size

Number of elements in a vector
Returns

None

riscv_vec_dup_f16

Declaration
void riscv_vec_dup_f16 (float16_t * src, float16_t * dst, uint32_t size)
Description

Vector duplicate function for F16.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in] src

Pointer to the input vector

[out] dst

Pointer to the output vector

[in] size

Number of elements in a vector
Returns

None

Note

This function is supported only by toolchains that support hard-float. Additionally, you must apply the -mzfh option in both compiler and linker flags when using this function. For details about the -mzfh linking option, see Linking Options for Newlib and MCUlib Toolchains or Linking Options for Glibc Toolchains.

Vector Square Root (SQRT) Functions

These functions compute the square root values of elements in a source vector and store the results one-by-one in a destination vector.

VEC Library supports distinct functions for the following data types: F32, F16, BF16, Q31, and Q15. These functions are described in the subsections below.

riscv_vec_sqrt_f32

Declaration
void riscv_vec_sqrt_f32 (float32_t * src, float32_t * dst, uint32_t size)
Description

Vector SQRT function for F32.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in] src

Pointer to the input vector

[out] dst

Pointer to the output vector

[in] size

Number of elements in a vector
Returns

None

riscv_vec_sqrt_f16

Declaration
void riscv_vec_sqrt_f16 (float16_t * src, float16_t * dst, uint32_t size)
Description

Vector SQRT function for F16.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in] src

Pointer to the input vector

[out] dst

Pointer to the output vector

[in] size

Number of elements in a vector
Returns

None

Note

This function is supported only by toolchains that support hard-float. Additionally, you must apply the -mzfh option in both compiler and linker flags when using this function. For details about the -mzfh linking option, see Linking Options for Newlib and MCUlib Toolchains or Linking Options for Glibc Toolchains.

Description

Vector SQRT function for BF16.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in] src

Pointer to the input vector

[out] dst

Pointer to the output vector

[in] size

Number of elements in a vector
Returns

None

Note

This function is supported only by toolchains that support hard-float. Additionally, you must apply the -mext-bf16min option in both compiler and linker flags when using this function. For details about the -mext-bf16min linking option, see Linking Options for Newlib and MCUlib Toolchains or Linking Options for Glibc Toolchains.

Vector SQRT function for Q31.

Pointer to the input vector

[out] dst

Pointer to the output vector

Number of elements in a vector

None

Vector SQRT function for Q15.

Parameter Description

[in] src

Pointer to the input vector

[out] dst

Pointer to the output vector

[in] size

Number of elements in a vector
Returns

None

Barycenter Functions

These functions calculate the barycenter of the input vector.

VEC Library supports distinct functions for the following data types: single- and half-precision floating-point. These functions are described in the subsections below.

riscv_vec_barycenter_f32

Declaration
void riscv_vec_barycenter_f32 (const float32_t * src, const float32_t * weights, float32_t * dst, uint32_t numofvec, uint32_t dimofvec)
Description

Barycenter function for F32.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in] src

Pointer to the input vector

[in] weights

Pointer to the weighted vector

[out] dst

Pointer to the output vector

[in] numofvec

Number of input vectors

[in] dimofvec

Dimension of vector space
Returns

None

riscv_vec_barycenter_f16

Declaration
void riscv_vec_barycenter_f16 (const float16_t * src, const float16_t * weights, float16_t * dst, uint32_t numofvec, uint32_t dimofvec)
Description

Barycenter function for F16.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in] src

Pointer to the input vector

[in] weights

Pointer to the weighted vector

[out] dst

Pointer to the output vector

[in] numofvec

Number of input vectors

[in] dimofvec

Dimension of vector space
Returns

None

Note

This function is supported only by toolchains that support hard-float. Additionally, you must apply the -mzfh option in both compiler and linker flags when using this function. For details about the -mzfh linking option, see Linking Options for Newlib and MCUlib Toolchains or Linking Options for Glibc Toolchains.

Weighted Sum Functions

These functions calculate the weighted sum of the input vector.

VEC Library supports distinct functions for the following data types: F32 and F16. These functions are described in the subsections below.

riscv_vec_weighted_sum_f32

Declaration
float32_t riscv_vec_weighted_sum_f32 (const float32_t * src, const float32_t * weight, uint32_t size)
Description

The weighted sum function for F32.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in] src

Pointer to the input vector

[in] weight

Pointer to the weighted vector

[in] size

Number of elements in a vector
Returns

The weighted sum value

riscv_vec_weighted_sum_f16

Declaration
float16_t riscv_vec_weighted_sum_f16 (const float16_t * src, const float16_t * weight, uint32_t size)
Description

The weighted sum function for F16.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in] *src

Pointer to the input vector

[in] weight

Pointer to the weighted vector

[in] size

Number of elements in a vector
Returns

The weighted sum value

Note

This function is supported only by toolchains that support hard-float. Additionally, you must apply the -mzfh option in both compiler and linker flags when using this function. For details about the -mzfh linking option, see Linking Options for Newlib and MCUlib Toolchains or Linking Options for Glibc Toolchains.

Arc Tangent Function

This function is the inverse of trigonometric functions, returning the inverse of the tangent for a given input value. The input values and output results of arc tangent functions are in radians and the output results are always in the range [-π/2, π/2].

VEC Library only supports the function for the single-precision floating-point data type. The function is described in the subsections below.

riscv_vec_atan_f32

Declaration
void riscv_vec_atan_f32 ( float32_t * src, float32_t * dst, uint32_t size)
Description

Arc tangent function for F32.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in] src

Pointer to the input vector

[out] dst

Pointer to the output vector

[in] size

Number of elements in a vector
Returns

None

Arc Tangent 2 Function

This function is similar to the arc tangent functions but accept two inputs x and y to compute the inverse tangent value. Typically, the output results are all in radians and always in the range [-π, π].

VEC Library only supports the function for the single-precision floating-point data type. The function is described in the subsections below.

riscv_vec_atan2_f32

Declaration
void riscv_vec_atan2_f32 ( float32_t * srcx, float32_t * srcy, float32_t * dst, uint32_t size)
Description

Arc tangent 2 function for F32.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in] srcx

Pointer to the input x vector

[in] srcy

Pointer to the input y vector

[out] dst

Pointer to the output vector

[in] size

Number of elements in a vector
Returns

None

Vector Inverse Functions

These functions compute the inverse value of elements in a source vector and store the results one-by-one in a destination vector.

VEC Library only supports the function for the following data types: F16 and BF16.

riscv_vec_inv_f16

Declaration
void riscv_vec_inv_f16 (float16_t * src, float16_t * dst, uint32_t size)
Description

Inverse function for F16.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in] src

Pointer to the input vector

[out] dst

Pointer to the output vector

[in] size

Number of elements in a vector
Returns

None

Note

This function is supported only by toolchains that support hard-float. Additionally, you must apply the -mzfh option in both compiler and linker flags when using this function. For details about the -mzfh linking option, see Linking Options for Newlib and MCUlib Toolchains or Linking Options for Glibc Toolchains.

riscv_vec_inv_bf16

Declaration
void riscv_vec_inv_bf16 (bf16_t * src, bf16_t * dst, uint32_t size)
Description

Inverse function for BF16.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in] src

Pointer to the input vector

[out] dst

Pointer to the output vector

[in] size

Number of elements in a vector
Returns

None

Note

This function is supported only by toolchains that support hard-float. Additionally, you must apply the -mext-bf16min option in both compiler and linker flags when using this function. For details about the -mext-bf16min linking option, see Linking Options for Newlib and MCUlib Toolchains or Linking Options for Glibc Toolchains.

Vector Ceil Functions

These functions compute the ceil values of elements in a source vector and store the results one-by-one in a destination vector.

VEC Library supports distinct functions for the following data types: F32, F16, and BF16. These functions are described in the subsections below.

Vector Floor Functions

These functions compute the floor values of elements in a source vector and store the results one-by-one in a destination vector.

VEC Library supports distinct functions for the following data types: F32, F16, and BF16. These functions are described in the subsections below.

Vector Reciprocal Square Root (RSQRT) Functions

These functions compute the reciprocal square root (RSQRT) values of elements in a source vector and store the results one-by-one in a destination vector.

VEC Library supports distinct functions for the following data types: F32, F16, and BF16. These functions are described in the subsections below.

void riscv_vec_rsqrt_f32 (float32_t * src, float32_t * dst, uint32_t size)

For details about the -mext-bf16min linking option, see Linking Options for Newlib and MCUlib Toolchains or Linking Options for Glibc Toolchains.

Merge Functions

These functions merge two input vectors based on the boolean value src_select, which determines which source vector to select from.

The input vector type can be any; use the appropriate element width. An example is shown below:

#define size  16
bool src_select[size];

## F32 example
float32_t src1_f32[size] = (...);
float32_t src2_f32[size] = (...);
float32_t dst_f32[size];
riscv_vec_merge_e32(src1_f32, src2_f32, dst_f32, src_select, size);

## Q31 example
q31_t src1_q31[size] = (...);
q31_t src2_q31[size] = (...);
q31_t dst_q31[size];
riscv_vec_merge_e32(src1_q31, src2_q31, dst_q31, src_select, size);

VEC Library supports distinct functions for the following data types: E32, E16, and E8. These functions are described in the subsections below.

riscv_vec_merge_e32

Declaration
void riscv_vec_merge_e32 (void * src1, void * src2, void * dst, bool * src_select, uint32_t size)
Description

Merge function for 32-bit elements.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in] src1

Pointer to the first input vector

[in] src2

Pointer to the second input vector

[out] dst

Pointer to the output vector

[in] src_select

Pointer to the select vector

[in] size

Number of elements in a vector
Returns

None

riscv_vec_merge_e16

Declaration
void riscv_vec_merge_e16 (void * src1, void * src2, void * dst, bool * src_select, uint32_t size)
Description

Merge function for 16-bit elements.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in] src1

Pointer to the first input vector

[in] src2

Pointer to the second input vector

[out] dst

Pointer to the output vector

[in] src_select

Pointer to the select vector

[in] size

Number of elements in a vector
Returns

None

Note

If the input type is F16 or BF16, the function is supported only by toolchains that support hard-float. Additionally, you must apply the -mzfh option for F16, and the -mext-bf16min option for BF16, apply in both compiler and linker flags when using this function. For details about the -mzfh linking option, see Linking Options for Newlib and MCUlib Toolchains or Linking Options for Glibc Toolchains.

riscv_vec_merge_e8

Declaration
void riscv_vec_merge_e8 (void * src1, void * src2, void * dst, bool * src_select, uint32_t size)
Description

Merge function for 8-bit elements.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in] src1

Pointer to the first input vector

[in] src2

Pointer to the second input vector

[out] dst

Pointer to the output vector

[in] src_select

Pointer to the select vector

[in] size

Number of elements in a vector
Returns

None

Vector Power Functions

These functions compute the value in a source vector raised to the power of exponent and store the results one-by-one in a destination vector.

VEC Library supports distinct functions for the following data types: F32, F16, and BF16. These functions are described in the subsections below.

riscv_vec_pow_f32

Declaration
void riscv_vec_pow_f32 (float32_t * src, float32_t * dst, float32_t exponent, uint32_t size)
Description

Vector power function for F32.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in] src

Pointer to the input vector

[out] dst

Pointer to the output vector

[in] exponent

Exponent value

[in] size

Number of elements in a vector
Returns

None

Declaration

[in] size

Number of elements in a vector
Returns

None

For details about the -mzfh linking option, see Linking Options for Newlib and MCUlib Toolchains or Linking Options for Glibc Toolchains.

These functions compute the base-2 logarithm (log2) values of elements in a source vector and store the results one-by-one in a destination vector.

VEC Library supports distinct functions for the following data types: F32 and F16. These functions are described in the subsections below.

For details about the -mzfh linking option, see Linking Options for Newlib and MCUlib Toolchains or Linking Options for Glibc Toolchains.

Vector Equal Functions

These functions compare two input vectors and return 1 to the boolean destination vector when src1 is equal to src2; otherwise, return 0.

VEC Library supports distinct functions for the following data types: F32, F16, and BF16. These functions are described in the subsections below.

riscv_vec_equal_f32

Declaration
void riscv_vec_equal_f32 (float32_t * src1, float32_t * src2, bool * dst, uint32_t size)
Description

Vector equal function for F32.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in] src1

Pointer to the first input vector

[in] src2

Pointer to the second input vector

[out] dst

Pointer to the output boolean vector

[in] size

Number of elements in a vector
Returns

None

riscv_vec_equal_f16

Declaration
void riscv_vec_equal_f16 (float16_t * src1, float16_t * src2, bool * dst, uint32_t size)
Description

Vector equal function for F16.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in] src1

Pointer to the first input vector

[in] src2

Pointer to the second input vector

[out] dst

Pointer to the output boolean vector

[in] size

Number of elements in a vector
Returns

None

Note

This function is supported only by toolchains that support hard-float. Additionally, you must apply the -mzfh option in both compiler and linker flags when using this function. For details about the -mzfh linking option, see Linking Options for Newlib and MCUlib Toolchains or Linking Options for Glibc Toolchains.

riscv_vec_equal_bf16

Declaration
void riscv_vec_equal_bf16 (bf16_t * src1, bf16_t * src2, bool * dst, uint32_t size)
Description

Vector equal function for BF16.

Parameters are described as follows:

[in] src1

Pointer to the first input vector

[in] src2

Pointer to the second input vector

[out] dst

Pointer to the output boolean vector

[in] size

Number of elements in a vector
Returns

None

Note

This function is supported only by toolchains that support hard-float. Additionally, you must apply the -mext-bf16min option in both compiler and linker flags when using this function. For details about the -mext-bf16min linking option, see Linking Options for Newlib and MCUlib Toolchains or Linking Options for Glibc Toolchains.

Vector Less Functions

These functions compare two input vectors and return 1 to the boolean destination vector when src1 is less than src2; otherwise, return 0.

Vector Less Equal Functions

These functions compare two input vectors and return 1 to the boolean destination vector when src1 is less than or equal to src2; otherwise, return 0.

Vector Greater Functions

These functions compare two input vectors and return 1 to the boolean destination vector when src1 is greater than src2; otherwise, return 0.

Vector Greater Equal Functions

These functions compare two input vectors and return 1 to the boolean destination vector when src1 is greater than or equal to src2; otherwise, return 0.

Get Library Version Function

This function retrieves the library version and its corresponding SHA-1 hash.

get_version_libvec

Declaration
char * get_version_libvec (void)
Parameters

None

Returns

The version and SHA-1 for libvec.a

Example
printf("%s\n", get_version_libvec());

Statistics Functions

This section includes the following statistics functions.

Maximum Functions

These functions compare values in a vector and return the maximum one along with its index, or just the maximum value.

VEC Library supports distinct functions for the following data types: F32, F16, F64, Q15, Q31, Q7, U64, U32, U16, and U8. These functions are described in the subsections below.

riscv_vec_max_f32

Declaration
float32_t riscv_vec_max_f32 (const float32_t * src, uint32_t size, uint32_t * index)
Description

Function that returns the maximum value with its index of an F32 vector.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in] src

Pointer to the input vector

[in] size

Number of elements in a vector

[out] index

Pointer to the index of the maximum value
Returns

  • The maximum value if successful

  • -1 if size is less than or equal to zero

riscv_vec_max_f16

Declaration
float16_t riscv_vec_max_f16 (const float16_t * src, uint32_t size, uint32_t * index)
Description

Function that returns the maximum value with its index of an F16 vector.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in] src

Pointer to the input vector

[in] size

Number of elements in a vector

[out] index

Pointer to the index of the maximum value
Returns

  • The maximum value if successful

  • -1 if size is less than or equal to zero

Note

This function is supported only by toolchains that support hard-float. Additionally, you must apply the -mzfh option in both compiler and linker flags when using this function. For details about the -mzfh linking option, see Linking Options for Newlib and MCUlib Toolchains or Linking Options for Glibc Toolchains.

Declaration
bf16_t riscv_vec_max_bf16 (const bf16_t * src, uint32_t size, uint32_t * index)

[in] size

Number of elements in a vector

[out] index

Pointer to the index of the maximum value
Returns

  • The maximum value if successful

  • -1 if size is less than or equal to zero

For details about the -mext-bf16min linking option, see Linking Options for Newlib and MCUlib Toolchains or Linking Options for Glibc Toolchains.

Minimum Functions

These functions compare values in a vector and return the minimum one along with its index, or just the minimum value.

VEC Library supports distinct functions for the following data types: F32, F16, F64, Q31, Q15, Q7, U64, U32, U16, and U8. These functions are described in the subsections below.

riscv_vec_min_f32

Declaration
float32_t riscv_vec_min_f32 (const float32_t * src, uint32_t size, uint32_t * index)
Description

Function that returns the minimum value with its index of an F32 vector.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in] src

Pointer to the input vector

[in] size

Number of elements in a vector

[out] index

Pointer to the index of the minimum value
Returns

  • The minimum value if successful

  • -1 if size is less than or equal to zero

riscv_vec_min_f16

Declaration
float16_t riscv_vec_min_f16 (const float16_t * src, uint32_t size, uint32_t * index)
Description

Function that returns the minimum value with its index of an F16 vector.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in] src

Pointer to the input vector

[in] size

Number of elements in a vector

[out] index

Pointer to the index of the minimum value
Returns

  • The minimum value if successful

  • -1 if size is less than or equal to zero

Note

This function is supported only by toolchains that support hard-float. Additionally, you must apply the -mzfh option in both compiler and linker flags when using this function. For details about the -mzfh linking option, see Linking Options for Newlib and MCUlib Toolchains or Linking Options for Glibc Toolchains.

riscv_vec_min_bf16

Declaration
bf16_t riscv_vec_min_bf16 (const bf16_t * src, uint32_t size, uint32_t * index)
Description

Function that returns the minimum value with its index of an BF16 vector.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in] src

Pointer to the input vector

[in] size

Number of elements in a vector

[out] index

Pointer to the index of the minimum value
Returns

  • The minimum value if successful

  • -1 if size is less than or equal to zero

Note

This function is supported only by toolchains that support hard-float. Additionally, you must apply the -mext-bf16min option in both compiler and linker flags when using this function. For details about the -mext-bf16min linking option, see Linking Options for Newlib and MCUlib Toolchains or Linking Options for Glibc Toolchains.

riscv_vec_min_f64

Declaration
float64_t riscv_vec_min_f64 (const float64_t * src, uint32_t size, uint32_t * index)
Description

Function that returns the minimum value with its index of an F64 vector

Parameters

[in] size

Number of elements in a vector

[out] index

Pointer to the index of the minimum value
Returns

  • The minimum value if successful

  • -1 if size is less than or equal to zero

  • 0x7fffffff if size is less than or equal to zero

riscv_vec_min_u64

Declaration

Absolute Maximum Functions

These functions compare absolute values in a vector and return the maximum one along with its index, or just the maximum value.

VEC Library supports distinct functions for the following data types: F32, F16, F64, Q15, Q31, and Q7. These functions are described in the subsections below.

riscv_vec_absmax_f32

Declaration
float32_t riscv_vec_absmax_f32 (const float32_t * src, uint32_t size, uint32_t * index)
Description

Function that returns the absolute maximum value with its index of an F32 vector.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in] src

Pointer to the input vector

[in] size

Number of elements in a vector

[out] index

Pointer to the index of the absolute maximum value
Returns

  • The absolute maximum value if successful

  • -1 if size is less than or equal to zero

riscv_vec_absmax_f16

Declaration
float16_t riscv_vec_absmax_f16 (const float16_t * src, uint32_t size, uint32_t * index)
Description

Function that returns the absolute maximum value with its index of an F16 vector.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in] src

Pointer to the input vector

[in] size

Number of elements in a vector

[out] index

Pointer to the index of the absolute maximum value
Returns

  • The absolute maximum value if successful

  • -1 if size is less than or equal to zero

Note

This function is supported only by toolchains that support hard-float. Additionally, you must apply the -mzfh option in both compiler and linker flags when using this function. For details about the -mzfh linking option, see Linking Options for Newlib and MCUlib Toolchains or Linking Options for Glibc Toolchains.

riscv_vec_absmax_f64

Declaration
float64_t riscv_vec_absmax_f64 (const float64_t * src, uint32_t size, uint32_t * index)
Description

Function that returns the absolute maximum value with its index of an F64 vector.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in] src

Pointer to the input vector

[in] size

Number of elements in a vector

[out] index

Pointer to the index of the absolute maximum value
Returns

  • The absolute maximum value if successful

  • -1 if size is less than or equal to zero

riscv_vec_absmax_q31

Declaration
q31_t riscv_vec_absmax_q31 (const q31_t * src, uint32_t size, uint32_t * index)
Description

Function that returns the absolute maximum value with its index of a Q31 vector.

Pointer to the input vector

[in] size

Number of elements in a vector

[out] index

Pointer to the index of the absolute maximum value
Returns

  • The absolute maximum value if successful

  • 0x0 if size is less than or equal to zero

riscv_vec_absmax_q15

Declaration
q15_t riscv_vec_absmax_q15 (const q15_t * src, uint32_t size, uint32_t * index)
Description

Function that returns the absolute maximum value with its index of a Q15 vector.

[in] size

Number of elements in a vector

[out] index

Pointer to the index of the absolute maximum value
Returns

  • The absolute maximum value if successful

  • 0x0 if size is less than or equal to zero

riscv_vec_absmax_q7

Declaration
q7_t riscv_vec_absmax_q7 (const q7_t * src, uint32_t size, uint32_t * index)

  • 0x0 if size is less than or equal to zero

riscv_vec_absmax_val_f32

Declaration

Number of elements in a vector

This function is supported only by toolchains that support hard-float. Additionally, you must apply the -mzfh option in both compiler and linker flags when using this function. For details about the -mzfh linking option, see Linking Options for Newlib and MCUlib Toolchains or Linking Options for Glibc Toolchains.

riscv_vec_absmax_val_f64

Declaration
float64_t riscv_vec_absmax_val_f64 (const float64_t * src, uint32_t size)
Description

Function that returns the absolute maximum value of an F64 vector.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in] src

Pointer to the input vector

[in] size

Number of elements in a vector
Returns

  • The absolute maximum value if successful

  • -1 if size is less than or equal to zero

riscv_vec_absmax_val_q31

Declaration

Pointer to the input vector

[in] size

Number of elements in a vector
Returns

  • The absolute maximum value if successful

  • 0x0 if size is less than or equal to zero

  • 0x0 if size is less than or equal to zero

Absolute Minimum Functions

These functions compare absolute values in a vector and return the minimum one along with its index, or just the minimum value.

VEC Library supports distinct functions for the following data types: F32, F16, F64, Q15, Q31, and Q7. These functions are described in the subsections below.

riscv_vec_absmin_f32

Declaration
float32_t riscv_vec_absmin_f32 (const float32_t * src, uint32_t size, uint32_t * index)
Description

Function that returns the absolute minimum value with its index of an F32 vector.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in] src

Pointer to the input vector

[in] size

Number of elements in a vector

[out] index

Pointer to the index of the absolute minimum value
Returns

  • The absolute minimum value if successful

  • -1 if size is less than or equal to zero

riscv_vec_absmin_f16

Declaration
float16_t riscv_vec_absmin_f16 (const float16_t * src, uint32_t size, uint32_t * index)
Description

Function that returns the absolute minimum value with its index of an F16 vector.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in] src

Pointer to the input vector

[in] size

Number of elements in a vector

[out] index

Pointer to the index of the absolute minimum value
Returns

  • The absolute minimum value if successful

  • -1 if size is less than or equal to zero

Note

This function is supported only by toolchains that support hard-float. Additionally, you must apply the -mzfh option in both compiler and linker flags when using this function. For details about the -mzfh linking option, see Linking Options for Newlib and MCUlib Toolchains or Linking Options for Glibc Toolchains.

riscv_vec_absmin_f64

Declaration
float64_t riscv_vec_absmin_f64 (const float64_t * src, uint32_t size, uint32_t * index)

[in] size

Number of elements in a vector

[out] index

Returns

  • The absolute minimum value if successful

  • -1 if size is less than or equal to zero

  • 0x7fffffff if size is less than or equal to zero

Mean Functions

These functions calculate the arithmetic mean of a vector.

VEC Library supports distinct functions for the following data types: F32, F16, F64, Q15, Q31, Q7, and U8. These functions are described in the subsections below.

riscv_vec_mean_f32

Declaration
float32_t riscv_vec_mean_f32 (const float32_t * src, uint32_t size)
Description

Function that returns the mean value of an F32 vector.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in] src

Pointer to the input vector

[in] size

Number of elements in a vector
Returns

The mean value

riscv_vec_mean_f16

Declaration
float16_t riscv_vec_mean_f16 (const float16_t * src, uint32_t size)
Description

Function that returns the mean value of an F16 vector.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in] src

Pointer to the input vector

[in] size

Number of elements in a vector
Returns

The mean value

Note

This function is supported only by toolchains that support hard-float. Additionally, you must apply the -mzfh option in both compiler and linker flags when using this function. For details about the -mzfh linking option, see Linking Options for Newlib and MCUlib Toolchains or Linking Options for Glibc Toolchains.

Root Mean Square (RMS) Functions

These functions compute root mean square of a vector.

The behavior can be defined as follows:

\[ \mathtt{RMS = sqrt\left(\frac{ (\mathtt{src[0]^{\scriptstyle{2}}} + \mathtt{src[1]^{\scriptstyle{2}}} + \dots + \mathtt{src[size-1]^{\scriptstyle{2}}}) }{\mathtt{size}} \right)} \]

VEC Library supports distinct functions for the following data types: F32, F16, Q15, and Q31. These functions are described in the subsections below.

riscv_vec_rms_f32

Declaration
float32_t riscv_vec_rms_f32 (const float32_t * src, uint32_t size)
Description

Function that computes the root mean square value of an F32 vector.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in] src

Pointer to the input vector

[in] size

Number of elements in a vector
Returns

The RMS value

riscv_vec_rms_f16

Declaration
float16_t riscv_vec_rms_f16 (const float16_t * src, uint32_t size)
Description

Function that computes the root mean square value of an F16 vector.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in] src

Pointer to the input vector

[in] size

Number of elements in a vector
Returns

The RMS value

Note

This function is supported only by toolchains that support hard-float. Additionally, you must apply the -mzfh option in both compiler and linker flags when using this function. For details about the -mzfh linking option, see Linking Options for Newlib and MCUlib Toolchains or Linking Options for Glibc Toolchains.

riscv_vec_rms_q31

Declaration
q31_t riscv_vec_rms_q31 (const q31_t * src, uint32_t size)
Description

Function that computes the root mean square value of a Q31 vector.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in] src

Pointer to the input vector

[in] size

Number of elements in a vector
Returns

The RMS value

riscv_vec_rms_q15

Declaration
q15_t riscv_vec_rms_q15 (const q15_t * src, uint32_t size)
Description

Function that computes the root mean square value of a Q15 vector.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in] src

Pointer to the input vector

[in] size

Number of elements in a vector
Returns

The RMS value

Power Functions

These functions compute the sum of squares of a vector.

The behavior can be defined as follows:

\[ \mathtt{sos = src[0]^{\scriptscriptstyle{2}} + src[1]^{\scriptscriptstyle{2}} + \dots + src[size-1]^{\scriptscriptstyle{2}}} \]

VEC Library supports distinct functions for the following data types: F32, F16, F64, Q15, Q31, and Q7. These functions are described in the subsections below.

riscv_vec_pwr_f32

Declaration
float32_t riscv_vec_pwr_f32 (const float32_t * src, uint32_t size)
Description

Function that computes the sum of squares of an F32 vector.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in] src

Pointer to the input vector

[in] size

Number of elements in a vector
Returns

The sum of squares

Declaration

Function that computes the sum of squares of an F16 vector.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

[in] src

Pointer to the input vector

[in] size

Number of elements in a vector
Returns

The sum of squares

Note

This function is supported only by toolchains that support hard-float. Additionally, you must apply the -mzfh option in both compiler and linker flags when using this function. For details about the -mzfh linking option, see Linking Options for Newlib and MCUlib Toolchains or Linking Options for Glibc Toolchains.

Function that computes the sum of squares of a Q31 vector.

Pointer to the input vector

[in] size

Number of elements in a vector
Returns

The sum of squares

Declaration

Description

Function that computes the sum of squares of a Q15 vector.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

[in] size

Returns

The sum of squares

Standard Deviation Functions

These functions compute the standard deviation value of a vector.

The behavior can be defined as follows:

\[ \mathtt{sos = src[0]^{\scriptscriptstyle{2}} + src[1]^{\scriptscriptstyle{2}} + \dots + src[size-1]^{\scriptscriptstyle{2}}} \]
\[ \mathtt{sqrsum = (src[0] + src[1] + \dots + src[size-1])^{\scriptscriptstyle{2}}} \]
\[ \mathtt{std = sqrt\left(\frac{sos - {\frac{sqrsum}{size}}}{size - 1}\right)} \]

VEC Library supports distinct functions for the following data types: F32, F16, F64, Q15, Q31, and U8. These functions are described in the subsections below.

riscv_vec_std_f32

Declaration
float32_t riscv_vec_std_f32 (const float32_t * src, uint32_t size)
Description

Function that computes the standard deviation value of an F32 vector.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in] src

Pointer to the input vector

[in] size

Number of elements in a vector
Returns

The standard deviation value

riscv_vec_std_f16

Declaration
float16_t riscv_vec_std_f16 (const float16_t * src, uint32_t size)
Description

Function that computes the standard deviation value of an F16 vector.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in] src

Pointer to the input vector

[in] size

Number of elements in a vector
Returns

The standard deviation value

Note

This function is supported only by toolchains that support hard-float. Additionally, you must apply the -mzfh option in both compiler and linker flags when using this function. For details about the -mzfh linking option, see Linking Options for Newlib and MCUlib Toolchains or Linking Options for Glibc Toolchains.

riscv_vec_std_f64

Declaration
float64_t riscv_vec_std_f64 (const float64_t * src, uint32_t size)
Description

Function that computes the standard deviation value of an F64 vector.

[in] size

Number of elements in a vector

The standard deviation value

Function that computes the standard deviation value of a Q15 vector.

Pointer to the input vector

[in] size

Returns

The standard deviation value

Variance Functions

These functions compute the variance value of a vector.

The behavior can be defined as follows:

\[ \mathtt{sos = src[0]^{\scriptscriptstyle{2}} + src[1]^{\scriptscriptstyle{2}} + \dots + src[size-1]^{\scriptscriptstyle{2}}} \]
\[ \mathtt{sqrsum = (src[0] + src[1] + \dots + src[size-1])^{\scriptscriptstyle{2}}} \]
\[ \mathtt{var = \frac{sos - {\frac{sqrsum}{size}}}{size - 1}} \]

VEC Library supports distinct functions for the following data types: F32, F16, F64, Q15, and Q31. These functions are described in the subsections below.

riscv_vec_var_f32

Declaration
float32_t riscv_vec_var_f32 (const float32_t * src, uint32_t size)
Description

Function that computes the variance value of an F32 vector.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in] src

Pointer to the input vector

[in] size

Number of elements in a vector
Returns

The variance value

riscv_vec_var_f16

Declaration
float16_t riscv_vec_var_f16 (const float16_t * src, uint32_t size)
Description

Function that computes the variance value of an F16 vector.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in] src

Pointer to the input vector

[in] size

Number of elements in a vector
Returns

The variance value

Note

This function is supported only by toolchains that support hard-float. Additionally, you must apply the -mzfh option in both compiler and linker flags when using this function. For details about the -mzfh linking option, see Linking Options for Newlib and MCUlib Toolchains or Linking Options for Glibc Toolchains.

riscv_vec_var_f64

Declaration
float64_t riscv_vec_var_f64 (const float64_t * src, uint32_t size)
Description

Function that computes the variance value of an F64 vector.

Parameters

Parameters are described as follows:

Parameter Description

[in] src

Pointer to the input vector

[in] size

Number of elements in a vector
Returns

The variance value

riscv_vec_var_q31

Declaration

Description

Function that computes the variance value of a Q31 vector.

Function that computes the variance value of a Q15 vector.
